Reviews.Title: “Met expectations for a 5 star CBD hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whareroa
Reviews.Content: I booked a secret hotel deal and was not overly thrilled to find out that the hotel was Radisson Blu Plaza, having stayed there before and finding the room to be incredibly pokey for the rate I paid. However, I was pleasantly surprised this time around. Our room on level 9 was spacious with king bed and a large bathroom with separate bath and shower. Room service is expensive but the service is prompt and they were able to cater for my special dietary needs. Location is right in the heart of the CBD and walking distance to Pitt Street Shopping mall & Circular Quay. I wouldnâ€™t pay rack rates for this hotel but would recommend staying here if you are able to secure a discounted rate. Overall, this hotel met my expectations of a 5 star CBD hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two hotels”
Reviews.Author: IanWhiteUK
Reviews.Content: This is a tale of 'two' hotels, the common parts, reception , restaurant and bar, executive lounge and such like have been through refurbishment and are very nice (apart from a musty smell around the entrance), however our room was in serious need of a freshen up (10th floor), being dull, over lived in and generally only suitable for one night max (we stayed three). A couple of aspects that need further comment are: 1. We arrived at the same time as a group of around 40 Germans, most of whom did not appear to have stayed in a hotel before, and instead of moving these guys to a separate area to avoid a complete obstruction of check-in pandemonium reigned supreme for a period of time. 2. There are two pianists in residence on Friday & Saturday - I am not expert but either they or the piano needs tuning!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet street just 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay this hotel is great for both tourists and business folks. The staff at the hotel were excellent - Albert the barman deserves a special mention! The room was spacious and modern. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower - the latter being particularly good. Breakfast is a little expensive but if you like a full cooked breakfast the freshly sliced baked ham was delicious. The rest of the fare was typical hotel buffet breakfast but with a good choice of fruit juices. There is a great cafe just across the street if you want a more cost effective light breakfast however as the hotel is in the business district, it is only open weekdays. There are many other cafes around Circular Quay which is a short walk of the hotel. The bar food is the best option if you need to eat at the hotel. It's the same menu as the Bistro but cheaper... plus the service in the bar is second to none. The staff cannot be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are created equal....”
Reviews.Author: Willstars
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last January overnight and had a beautiful spacious room with big windows and a city outlook. This trip staying 5 nights and the room is very ordinary small window and quite claustraphobic. I'm disappointed. It's clean and the bed is comfortable but I had higher expectations based on my last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location for shopping and sight seeing!”
Reviews.Author: hello272
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in March, it is an ideal location if you want to make the most of your time in Sydney. It's only a few minutes walk from Rocks, opera house, Sydney Bridge, CBD and Darling Habour. The rooms were very clean with no noise pollution from the bustling streets below. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at an for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Easy_Farva
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, the hotel was good. It was in a handy location and was perfect for a weekend stay. The one negative was when we asked one of the concierge where to go for breakfast. We got the following response "Um just go to Circular Quay". Hardly the response I would expect from the concierge of a 5 star hotel. Apart from that, enjoyed our time at the time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLock
Reviews.Content: Well located nice rooms mostly great indoor pool nice gym sauna and spa all very clean Service can be a bit hit or miss got overcharged for drinks in the bar The concierge is fabulous I have been given some rooms on some visits which were not acceptable asked to be moved Lots of tourists use the hotel so can take a while to check in at times Watch the web for specials they are very good value

Reviews.Title: “Very functional Sydney CBD hotel”
Reviews.Author: George G
Reviews.Content: If you are in business this is quite an efficient hotel in downtown Sydney. No water views though but quite good service. The only thing that bugged me was that at breakfast I had to sign the breakfast bill upfront after declaring to the head waiter what type of breakfast ie cost I was planning to have. When I complained they informed me that this is hotel policy to discourage people from avoiding paying their breakfast bill

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, charges 2% fee on final bill if you pay with credit card”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: Apparently the management of this hotel thinks you should be running around with lots of cash because they add a 2% fee if you pay with a credit card!!!!!!! This is really inexcusable for a hotel of this level

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: threepossums
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a studio spa suite with 2 double beds. The room was spacious, nicely furnished and very clean. We were on the mezzanine level, but there was very little noise from the street due to the double glazing. Air con worked well, and the shower had excellent water pressure. What stood out for us was the excellent staff. Concierge, housekeeping, wait and bar staff were all friendly, smiling and professional. Nothing was too much trouble, they actually looked as if they enjoyed their work and were most helpful. We enjoyed the food at Bistro Fax, again the staff were friendly and attentive in the bistro and bar. The pool is quite small, more of a lap pool, but was ok for our daughter to have a play and swim- it is also one of the more shallow pools we have come across at only 1 metre deep. Didn't have a spa treatment but they did look inviting! The location was excellent- a short walk down the hill to Circular Quay for the ferry and the Opera House and the Rocks area, and there are shops, banks and restaurants in all directions. The monorail, which has a station in Pitt Street Mall (5 min walk) will take you to Darling Harbour. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The standard of service is a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff-Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: csmurf
Reviews.Content: I did a bit of research before booking this hotel to find a nice balance of price against what appears to be good quality. I must say I was not disappointed that I ended up here, I've stayed in hotels in Sydney before that were $40 less per night and they were slums compared to this. This hotel is in a great central location, we walked almost everywhere for the 3 days we were there, its close to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, the Rocks etc. The hotel itself is very nicely decorated and laid out, the room was very spacious. The staff were brilliant, they were very pleasant, attentive and thorough. I will hopefully stay here again when I return to Sydney, I would highly recommend this to anyone else who visits Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, friendly staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: Blknyella
Reviews.Content: In Sydney during the Easter break our (my husband and I) first impression of the hotel were the staff. They are attentive, friendly and helpful. The standard rooms are clean, spacious and beds are comfortable. On Easter Sunday we came back to find a chocolate bunny set on our bed- it was a lovely surprise! Would definitely consider staying at any Radisson judging by this stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Good CBD Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoffg111
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight one business and found the staff and room to be very good. The location is very convenient and central to many of Sydneys attractions. The price was not cheap but fairly good for Sydney CBD particularly considering the quality of the rooms, the location and the service. The restaurant was very good for both dinner and breakfast. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all-rounder”
Reviews.Author: BritBronco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Club Carlson redemption, the cash price would be have been a little steep, but not out of line with other hotels in Sydney. The location is excellent, you can easily walk to all the main attractions from here, its not far from the Rocks. The room was very nice too, I paid for an upgrade to a business class room, which was well worth it because it includes access to the executive lounge. The lounge is one of the better ones I have found, a good breakfast spread, and canapes in the evening which were enough for a light dinner! The service was also very attentive in the lounge. The only complaint was the WIFI was very slow, but it was free so I shouldn't really complain!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blue Plaza Hotel is sooooogood”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: Awesome customer service delivered by business lounge staff over a 4 day stay. Great city location, close to public transport access for train, ferry or bus Quiet and comfortable room Excellent non heated pool Small Gym

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal to stay here. The location was fantastic. Easy walk to Circular Quay, Opera House, The Rocks, Darling Harbour and the City to shop. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: barry k
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson with my wife and 10 month old daugther, room was nice bed was good bath room ok. However i would not recommend going here with an infant, access with a pram is difficult, no ramp, and the staff to assit with getting the pram up the stairs where not always there resulting in me having to by carry myself, i also pre book a cot for my room, and found what i would regard as a cage rather than a cot in my room, it was all metal bars with no padding, not really child friendly, will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sandra_j_leong
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel. Pricey but the service was excellent. It is great to be able to say that every single staff from the Doorman to the Concerige where extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great for anything you want to do in the City, transport links good and very frequent. The room was spacious and well appointed, with everything you would expect from a 5-star hotel. We did find it a bit noisey from the ac but I suppose this can not be helped.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Astrobeemer
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal on this hotel and decided to try our first Radisson on our Australian trip. We arrived early in the morning, but we had corresponded via email with the hotel and requested (if possible) early check-in. When we arrived we were checked in immediately because our rood was ready. The staff here is exeptional, very helpful, friendly and courteous (something we did not always find in Sydney). We had done too much shopping so we decided to ship some of it back on the last day via FedEx (it was the christmas holiday so all the Australian Post offices were closed for an extended period of time). We filled all the paperwork, packed out items and left them in the capable hands of the concierge, who arranged for the pickup after we left and we received them at home a couple of days after our arrival. One night we took out two bottles of beer out of the fridge minibar and placed them in the other non refrigerated section of the minibar in order to have room for our bottle of water for the next day. Next evening we noticed the beers were entirely gone from the room and did not think anything of it. Upon checkout there was a hefty charge for two beers, so we explained what happened and the charges were taken out. We ordered room service one very late night, which was speedy and fairly tasty. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel. You had a choice of a-la-carte, continental breakfast or the full buffet breakfast. We switched back and forth between the three choices on different mornings. The staff here was touch and go. Some mornings they were super friendly and efficient, and other mornings a different shift was rude, slow and made mistakes. One particular morning we waited about 40 minutes for our sunny side up eggs, and when they came the toast was cold and basically not even toasted. we asked then to toast it again, and with a roll of the eye they took it away and brough it back 5 minutes later a little more brown. Some of the staff here definitely needs re-training! The rooms was large, had a balcony (however no view) and was very clean. The location is pretty central and we walked everywhere from our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge room & bathroom, great service”
Reviews.Author: BJKendall
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at 8.30am to be greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. We were not expecting our room to be ready but to our delight it was. Our room was very spacious with everything you would need from tea/coffee to an ironing board. Bathroom was also very large. The location is perfect, only a 10 minute walk to the Opera House & Bridge. No problems sleeping as it was quiet & very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value.”
Reviews.Author: willstravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights after getting a special offer through Wotif that reduced the rate to $260 per night. Fantastic. The location really is excellent and is close to the train to the airport, Circular Quay, shopping precincts, Exhibition centre and Darling harbour etc. The room was functional and comfortable and really not worthy of special mention. The bathroom was on the other hand one of the best I've seen. The layout, attention to detail and use of space was excellent. Definitely a place to consider when staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Superb. Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ianandalli
Reviews.Content: Sadly we only got the opportunity to stay for one night. Have been lucky enough to stay in some lovely hotels around the world over the years, and this has to be one of the best. We got an amazing deal through Booking.com. Our room was beautifully furnished and equiped. Hotel was quiet at night. We took advantage of the dinner special at Bistro fax. $35 for two courses and a glass of wine. Awesome value, superb food, and a lovely setting and atmosphere. What more do you want? Every aspect of the evening was perfect. After a wonderful nights sleep in an extremely comfortable bed we went for breakfast. Wow!!! Great selection and wonderful quality. The location of the hotel is great too being very close to Circular Quay. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont treat their regular customers right”
Reviews.Author: Konigv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend because my partner stays here for work as it is right across the road from her office. She has been staying there just about every week since the beginning of the year so you'd think they would have given us a nice room when we checked in but instead we got a room with a big wall and a tiny window. In fact just about every time she goes down she get put in a below average room and has to go back down and ask them to change. Very annoying and shows no appreciation for loyal customers. Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We'd return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Yickadee
Reviews.Content: to this lovely hotel. We spent a couple of nights for a girls weekend staying in a premier room which had a couple of very, very comfortable double beds. No view to speak of but that wasn't an issue for us as we only visited the room to sleep and a very nice sleep was had. Shower water pressure was amazing and the linen and towels were great. Service couldn't be faulted and a couple of night caps were enjoyed in the fantastic lounge area whilst listening to a very talented Joe Cocker type entertainer at the baby grand piano. Royland was our waiter here and his great service added to our enjoyment. We will have no trouble deciding on accommodation for our next Sydney trip. Loved the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TommyDevon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel in February this year. The hotel itself was very good and in a good position for sightseeing, its a short stroll to Circular Quay. Our room was very nice and had all the facilities you would expect. Our visit to Sydney was part of a trip to celebrate my wifes birthday this year and the hotel had very kindly left a bottle of bubbly in our room for us when we arrived. The staff at the hotel desrve a special mention, very friendly and will do all they can to assist you. This is an excellent base for your stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: thespooks1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights booking our room online direct from their website, booking a Premier Room with an option to upgrade to the Business Class floor, for a fee, if available on arrival. We were lucky enough to get this upgrade and our room was excellent. On the business class floor we had access to the business lounge which was a wonderful quiet place to enjoy some canapes and a drink at the end of a busy shopping day! We were looked after wonderfully by the attendants. Our room was a spacious king with marble bathroom - my wife enjoyed the deep bath with a treat she bought from Lush. The room was immaculate and serviced daily - the head housekeeper even called by to ask if we were happy with the room after they'd cleaned it, we liked that. This hotel is very unassuming from the street, you walk into a beautiful 5 star hotel. Located near Circular Quay, its a great spot. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gastronomyMD
Reviews.Content: $275 per night is actually a pretty good deal in Sydney. Our room was superb, well-appointed. Location is truly optimal. Close to Circular Quay and the Rocks, the Opera House and Wynyard Station. We had a beautiful run along the water during our stay, through the Royal Botanical Gardens by the SOH, etc. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Good all-around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent amenities, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Stufish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business trip. From arrival staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were a good size, clean and contained everthing that you need. Close to circular quay and mall. Will definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good central location”
Reviews.Author: rnizmo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located within the business district, however it was only a 5-10 minutes walk to circular quay and the ferries. The room was lovely and generously sized, but the highlight within the room was the separate shower and bath! The hotel had a nice restaurant/bar which offered a good set course menu at a really reasonable price. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay !”
Reviews.Author: Timginleitch
Reviews.Content: We had four days here on our way to a cruise around the top end of Australia. We really couldn't fault the hotel in any way. We were most pleasantly surprised at the high standard of the hotel. The staff in particular were very helpful and accommodating even to the point of letting us have our room earlier . The room was excellent and the breakfasts were some of the best we have had in all our years of travel. It is situated in a very convenient location and with assistance from the very helpful concierge team we were able to find our way around very easily. The pool although small was a fabulous place to relax after a days sightseeing. I could go on and on but suffice to say I would have no hesitation at all in recommending this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with high cealings. Two double beds rather than a queen is not ideal but comfortable beds. Really expensive valet parking so just parked on street. Expensive breakfast. Thin walls heard a lot of noise from next door at 3 am. Great location close to circular quay and centr of town

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Sami2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in January during a 5-day trip to Sydney. The location is great, walking distance from so many landmarks. The room was a little bit small and unfortunately there wasn't too much space for luggage and clothing but it was very clean. The bathroom on the other hand was large and very well kept. The pool was a nice place to relax in the evening. The hotel overall had a very pleasant atmosphere and the staff was always extremely helpful. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TrishalAucklandNZ
Reviews.Content: After ending a wonderful cruise on the Queen Elizabeth in Sydney, we transfered to the Radisson Hotel for three nights. We booked a De luxe room but was able to upgrade to the Business Room, with all the facilities of the Business Lounge.The 10th Floor room was spacious and luxuious which catered for all our needs. The food/nibbles in the lounge was good with a nice selection. The Bistro Fax restaurant also was superb, especially their $35 special meal. The staff, from the doormen, receptionists through to the business lounge staff was so friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location, less than ten minute walk to the Quay and about the same to the main shops.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Refinement”
Reviews.Author: wemyss1
Reviews.Content: This is a quality experience from the greeting at the front door, bags whisked away and up to your room. Quality furnishings, large bathrooms, big shower... but one fixed shower head maybe not for everyone. Executive floor worth the extra and staff there so helpful. Breakfast good, evening canapes in Executive floor club of a very high standard eg.oysters, hot food freshly cooked. Drink selection for Oz wines good, spirits range could be improved...Johnny Walker red label not really making the grade for decent whisky...Location excellent for shopping, The Rocks, main sites...YES!! Overall quality, quality, quality... You will enjoy this experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: runningrugby
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times in six months for business and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on business (like I was) or for pleasure. The measure of a hotel is consistency and I can say this hotel is consistent, consistently good. The staff are very helpful and attended to any requests that arose. Would recommend the in-house restaurant for dinner or breakfast as the food was very good and reasonably priced. The rooms are very comfortable and very modern. Location is excellent and it is an easy walk to the Pitt Street mall for shopping or to Circular Quay (where you can catch a ferry to tour the harbour) or to the rocks area (lots of restaurants and bars to choose from) or the opera house (recommend the opera outdoor bar, great views of the city and harbour bridge). Although I was travelling on business this hotel makes it a pleasurable stay and I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience thus far”
Reviews.Author: drest
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with the professionalism of all staff at Radisson Blu. From the doorman greeting me as I entered and taking my bag up to the efficient check in process, fantastic individual taking the orders for room service through to check out - the staff member even noted my room number on a tag so before I even started speaking he had quickly checked my room number in order to greet me by name - felt like personalised service and I was really impressed by all of the personable and very capable staff. Room was lovely, big shower and separate bath and gorgeous comfortable bed and choice of pillows, also a well set up gym. Would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: goldie01
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Business Class floor and to be honest, did not want to leave. The room was not huge but for a one-nighter, it doesn't need to be, there was ample space. The bath is large, shower pressure excellent and the bathroom large and spotless. Quality amenities were nice too. Despite being in a busy part of town, there was no traffic noise with double glazed glass, privacy screen and block out curtains. On the Business Class floor, there are lots of little extras like complimentary access to the business centre, lounge, gym and pool. You also have the choice of type of pillow which is a 1st for me and I appreciated it. Mini bar is not excessively expensive, in-room dining menu extensive. The full buffet breakfast has to be seen to be believed! Superb is an understatement. Location is oustanding, close to trains, circular quay, botanic gardens, museums etc and an easy walk to some of sydney's best shopping. I highly recommend this to fellow business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ! What great choice !”
Reviews.Author: Ian190762
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location perfect, rooms and bathrooms great, bar area and reception great, excellent choice if your staying in Sydney ...

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mi-Dan20
Reviews.Content: Helpful friendly staff, comfortable clean accomodations, excellent location, fabulous breakfast, lovely restaurant and nice spa / pool! Anthony at the Concierge desk was incredible, always advantageous from recommending a chemist to a fine dining experience, even the maid staff, Kamala for example, was superior! We stayed twice, once for a week while sightseeing and then 2 nights on our return trip...each time a simply brilliant stay...a stellar hotel in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “High comfort, good location”
Reviews.Author: pinskos
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights in Sydney on a 3,5 weeks trip trough Queensland, NSW, VIC, SA and NT. It was our 2nd stop in Australia and we had a very good time. The hotel perfectly represented the brand Radisson. Staff was very friendly and helpful (reception/concierge/porters/housekeeping). We shared a three-bed room. The extra bed was in fact not needed as we had to queen beds with enough room. We also liked the location with just a short walk to the Harbour and also to George and Pitt Street. Jamie's Italian is just across the street. What we did not really like was the spa, indoor pool and gym. The latter seemed a bit dated and was just toooo air-conditioned (turning off did not help as it had been cooled down troughout the night). The water temperature in the pool was actually too low and the sitting/relaxing area a bit too small to feel really comfortable. But that are the only complaints we have.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for staying in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SPF_Factor2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our first trip to Sydney. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, to the day we left, we thought everything was trouble-free.....the staff, the room, etc. Our 4th floor 'Atrium' room was adequate for our needs.., a good size, clean, VERY comfortable bed (and with a choice of 7 pillows!), even managed to stay up 'til about 4am to watch a Premiership match. After long days out walking around sightseeing, the swimming pool, sauna and steam room was a dream to come back to. Also made use of the free internet service in the Business Room (although a little slow at times). A very nice hotel to base yourself whilst staying in Sydney, especially as its close to Circular Quay (turn right out of the hotel - then follow the road straight down....done). I'd definately stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Two words, Absolutely Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian P
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Radisson Blu, we were treated to excellent service. The concierge was most helpful with any inquiries, the room service and house keeping did an absolute fantastic job. Definitely a 5 star job done. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to Sydney. It could be a bit pricey, but it is worth every dollar. Another excellent part of the Hotel is the Bistro Fax restaurant on the lobby level. Service at the restaurant is phenomenal and the food is fantastic. A must have is the chocolate fondant dessert, recommended by the waiter, and now recommended by us. Just the minor things the staff at the hotel do for you make your stay most memorable. Would recommend this Hotel to anyone who is travelling to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Beetrootears
Reviews.Content: My initial telephone dealings with the hotel were promising, with the staff member being courteous and helpful. We were greeted and served efficiently on arrival and even though arriving on a early morning flight in Sydney, did not have to wait long for our room to become available. The room was a large suite with 2 double beds, which suited us as a family. We did have the option of bringing in an extra bed if we wished, but the kids worked it out ok. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Wynyard Station, so if arriving from the Airport, catch the Airport link train and it's not far if you don't have too much luggage to lug! We checked out on the last day and stored our luggage at the hotel and were able to use the health club to freshen up before flying out on an evening flight after spending the day out and about. I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - pretty good”
Reviews.Author: travellingmel7373
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. Purchased through Wotif.com for about $230. Room was clean, bathroom was good, bed was very good. Staff were all very friendly, concierge was good with parking our car.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive and room just OK”
Reviews.Author: Gotoday1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night with my wife as we were having a weekend away in Sydney. Location is handy to Circular Quay and the Rocks but the immediate area was fairly dead on the weekend. We ended up going to Balmain for dinner, which was a lovely ferry ride away. I think that it cost over $200 for the night's accommodation and breakfast was not thrown in. The room was only OK and had a bit of a feel that it was a former storage area converted to a guest room. As with so many hotels, the place has that feel of sameness about it. I would not stay again as it was pretty unremarkable and not cheap - I reckon you can find something better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel Sydney -- awesome hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my wife and I visited Sydney, and the Radisson Blu made it a great time. When making the reservation, we mentioned it was our first visit and requested a room with a good view. They gave us the top floor with a balcony! Throughout the stay, they did all the little things that confirm why there were so many excellent reviews of this hotel. Everyone was helpful/attentive, the room was great, and the location is right in the middle of everything. We actually walked to most places! Overall, a wonderful stay and we'd recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: PinoyDutch
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a deluxe room at this property for a weekend city trip. On the positive side: the location was very convenient and the room was spotlessly clean. On the other hand, the room was also quite small and very plain; it felt more like a room in a 4-star hotel. Our biggest issue was with reception. The reception area is very small and both at check-in and check-out staff were not able to cope. We had to wait far too long on both occasions (30 minutes at check-in!) before being seen to. We also felt that AUD35 for the full breakfast was over-the-top for what was a much smaller selection than we usually get in similar hotels. Finally, given the room rate we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ingbing
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice rooms, breakfast & drinks in the lounge add to the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AngieNSW
Reviews.Content: Great stay in December 2011. Clean and comfortable room, but not at the 5 star standard of other Sydney hotels - nice but not luxurious. Concierge never spoke to us, reception service nothing special. The hotel restaurant, however, was exceptional. The staff were so lovely (I wish I could remember the name of the female manager), so helpful, and the food was fantastic. Breakfast was just as good. This was one of the highlights of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: charlieg
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, modern interior with good internet access. Well situated with easy walks to the Botanical Gardens, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and shopping area. Stayed for 3 nights and was a little dissapointed that they would not offer me the same rate for an additional night I needed two weeks later - insisted on a rate $80 more per night which I thought was unfortunate so I booked at the Sheriton on the Park - review posted.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie24
Reviews.Content: The Raddison Blu located in O'Connell Street in the Cbd in Sydney is in a perfect location. The hotel is situation near circular quay and the shopping precinct. There are many fabulous bars, restaurants and funky cafes nearby. The hotel staff are friendly, helpful, and available. Our room was spacious, clean, and super comfortable. The bistro offers a great $35 deal - an entree and main plus a glass of wine or a main and desert and a glass of wine. Billon Restaurant is located in the hotel. On our stay, bilson was closed for a private function. We look forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great position with class”
Reviews.Author: PKC54
Reviews.Content: A great spot with understated class. Handy to circular quay. Excellent concierge . Great value dinner. 2 courses with glass of wine for $35!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well placed”
Reviews.Author: Trudy R
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at the Radisson and enjoyed where it was positioned. We had a cheaper Atrium room, which although a little dark offered excellent value. The staff were very helpful and kept our room very clean. We enjoyed the gym and spa facilities, although it was sometimes difficult to get a place in the popular jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Beware this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobJAdelaide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times before and had small problems before but because of its location have overlooked them. I checked in early knowing the room probably wouldn't be ready and they said I could leave my bags with them and they would be sent up when it was ready. Arrived later to an interrogation at the front desk, who I was and did I have a male companion probably because my name appeared to be male and then asked for my credit card which had already been scanned once before. That out of the way I went to my room to find no luggage. I phoned down to find out what had happened to it and was told they would look into it and let me know. After waiting 15 mins and no phone I was on my way down to the desk to find out whereupon I met someone on the way up with my luggage. Two hours later I got a call to apologize about them having mislaid my luggage. This room was supposed to be an upgrade, I pulled back the curtains and found a tiny balcony with peeling paint, the veneer on the TV cabinet was worn away. I tried the curtain on the other window and had a lovely outlook on an airconditioning unit below. Marks on the walls and the tiles in the bathroom. I did not use the hotel restaurant as I had had problems before and did not want to repeat the experience. On booking out I was given my bill with an extra charge of $11 for using a credit card, they had never done this before. I asked if they now took cash the lady at the front desk said we take cash or eftpos which doesn't have a charge, I was furious because no one had told me about the extra charge or that you could use eftpos. To top it off today I get a letter charging me extra for minibar use, I did not use anything from the minibar except for tea bags. I don't drink alcohol because I have an allergy so this charge appears to be made hoping you will not challenge them. There are only 2 pluses with this hotel: its location and free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pommybattler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just become my favourite place to stay in Sydney. The hotel is a genuine 5 star establishment but doesn't charge the exorbitant rates demanded by some of the bigger chain hotels in Sydney. Whilst it has all of the features of a five star hotel its staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and provide enough room and the location only two minutes walk from Circular Quay means that you are never far from a good restaurant or a great view of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The breakfast at $29/$39 was a little on the expensive side but this is somewhat compensated by the reasonable cost of the rooms. In my view it's hard to go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow !”
Reviews.Author: SushNam
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is one of the best,most luxurious (for the price) I have ever stayed in. The size of the bathroom was equal to the room size and had a separate bathroom and bathtub. The location is bang in downtown,just 2 mins walk to George street or a 5 min walk to the quay. The room has all the amenities one can think of. Best of all they have free WiFi which is always good. The bed was very comfortable and soft. The staff is helpful and a friendly bunch. Definitely recommend, We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcd31
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideal if you are coming from the airport and get the train to Wynyard - it is literally 5 mins walk from the station, which is also on George St. The hotel itself is nice - what you would expect for Radisson, with good sized rooms and great services, such as the business centre, gym etc. We were unfortunate that we were on the 1st floor, so outside was slightly noisy, and we didnt have much luck with our neighbours, who were very noisy on the 1st night too! There was also an issue with the hotel which I won't go into as it is unnecessary - it was rectified effectively by the staff. Overall, worth a look into if staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service after an accident”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian C
Reviews.Content: I got hit by a car in Sydney while staying in this hotel. After I got out of hospital I spent a couple of more nights there. Personnel heard about the incident and took great care of me! I was traveling alone and they helped me out a lot. Helped me sell my car, get paper work sorted and helped me to get around in Sydney!! They did more than they actually had to do and I was really impressed! I would always go back to this hotel!!!! The concierge is the best and I had a really good time! This hotel is worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel fab location”
Reviews.Author: polly66Hertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location just a few minutes walk from the main city and maybe 15 mins to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Reception staff extremely helpful as were the restaurant staff. Our room was large and very well equipped with a beautiful bathroom. The breakfast was brilliant. Cannot fault this hotel at all and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherAdcockSchot
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good central location, a bit of extra walking to Darling Harbour but nice to be away from the tourist feel of Darling Harbour. Great food all around the hotel but I would suggest to get breakfast included as they do a beautiful breaKfast although on the high $ side. Close by was the Lane nice for breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy O
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in CBD, easy walking distance to circular quay, darling harbour and Westfield. Kerb appeal could be improved with few more plants and some ashtrays rather then the fairly numerous number of smokers when we were there being encouraged to put the stubs in the gutter......doormen were a bit hit and miss especially in the evenings....our room was good sized, clean and not really wanting for anything you would expect ina good four star hotel..... Pool and gym both satisfactory.....We had a fairly disastrous evening at the restaurant- Bistro Fax.....having enquired and been told there was no need to book on arriving 1 hour later we were told a 45 minute wait....not great with 2 hungry children....service was incredibly slow, catching a waiter's eye nigh on impossible, the bill incorrect- charging us for 3 meals when there were clearly only 2 adults in our party.....all fairly poor really.....but the hotel still pretty good overall.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JAMES R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice as we flew in and out of Sidney on a trip to tour Australia. The rooms were well furnished although a bit smallish. Staff and facilities were outstanding and the unlimited free in room wireless was a big plus. EZ walk to Quay and opera house. One mile to international ship terminal.The breakfast buffet is huge and well stocked. The best showers in Australia! We used the restaurant twice for dinner. the first time was great and thus a second visit on the night before we flew home. That was quite different as it took over 2.5 hours to complete the dining experience. We let the management of the hotel know and hope that was atypical.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Wrighter69
Reviews.Content: Great location in Sydney for circular quay, ferries opera house etc. My bed was the most comfortable bed ive ever slept, and my room was big, clean, and well presented ! i arrived early ( 7am) but check in is at 2pm, but they pulled out all the stops as i was so tired after my trip from UK, that i was in my room 10am ! the staff are so friendly, and very helpful, FREE internet in the business centre open 24hrs. this was my 1st stop on my round the world trip, and i didnt want to leave this fantastic hotel. i would recommend this hotel without reservation........... SIMPLY THE BEST

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: 315Catherine
Reviews.Content: When we took a taxi from the airport to this hotel, our driver had difficulty finding it. However, it was conveniently located near all the primary tourist attractions - the Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House, the Rocks, the Botanical Gardens, etc. The room was great, and the staff was extremely attentive. The facilities included a great fitness room and pool area, with massage options. We ate in the hotel a couple of nights, and the food was very good. This is a high class hotel conveniently located in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Again another brilliant stay at the Radisson Blu Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Caroline R
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Radisson Blu and it is brilliant. Great location, great service and great rooms. I've stayed in most of the hotels in Sydney and rate this as my favourite and one I would recommend to any visitor to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A surprising gem in the heart of Sydney...”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaChris09
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the attentiveness of staff, the wonderful lounge areas, and decor is very inviting. Only negative is the high height of the windows in the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service & location.”
Reviews.Author: ochriso
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 4 days at the Radisson last wk. They graciously checked us in on arrival at about 9am. We were upgraded at our request to a Buisness class room for a small fee. This included b/fast & evening hor dourves, at the Club lounge, which was fantastic. The whole staff were friendly & helpful. Location could not be better . Only small complaint was that the wifi was slow though free. Will definitely stay here again & again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sydney and the Radisson Blu!”
Reviews.Author: MaryT14
Reviews.Content: Great location, a lovely room, friendly and helpful staff...... we highly recommend staying at the Radisson Blu while in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: E1-gem
Reviews.Content: We had a 7 night stay in January and found the location ideal for first time visitors. The hotel is close to circular quay, the rocks and the opera house. We were also 5 minutes from the main shopping street. Our room had a poor internal view, but the limited time we were in the room meant it didn't matter. Upon check out the concierge staff looked after our bags all day and took them to our taxi - nothing was too much trouble. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: bryan b
Reviews.Content: Very convenient central location, we were able to walk pretty much all the tourist spots and transportation. Concierge service was helpful and made good recommendations for restaurants. Overall, the hotel is well-maintained and rooms are modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but uneven service”
Reviews.Author: imbarron
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location, especially if you are unfamiliar with Sydney and want easy access to the big tourist attractions. Room service was excellent. Room was nice but sadly I was right by the employee entrance which was very noisy. When I arrived I was very jetlagged and a member of staff asked one of the reception staff to get me a bottle of water - she stared at him coldly and loudly announced that that was not her job. Same offhand service and cold manner on checkout which spoils an otherwise good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: andblake
Reviews.Content: Convenient location and comfortable rooms. Service was good, with the odd exception. Room servicing was good. Most, but unfortunately not all, of the concierge staff were friendly and helpful. The fine dining restaurant, Bilsons, seems to be permanently closed. The other buffet reastauranf was ok for breakfast - we did not try it for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Short walk to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: PerthDave
Reviews.Content: Very central and easy to get to from the airport by train. 5 minute walk from Wynyard train station. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Hotel well kept and clean. Beds are big and comfy. wifi internet access is free and fast. Lobby bar has a piano player / singer most nights and is a relaxing spot to have a light drink before heading out. Well equipped gym. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Aniri67
Reviews.Content: Greit hotel in the heart of Sydney! Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, not child friendly”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous_Int
Reviews.Content: While otherwise a good but not great hotel, we had two major problems. First of all the staff were not helpful (room service excepted) and at on point we were even locked out of our room for "billing problems" (a blatant lie). Second this hotel is not child friendly at all, for example the sink is not usable by small children. Only redeeming quality is the quality of the food. We chose this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and were majorly disappointed. Absolutely not recommended for family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Short stop in style”
Reviews.Author: AiryTraveller
Reviews.Content: Only 30hrs here but once again a lovely relaxing stay. The hotel is right in the centre of the city a few blocks from Circle Quay and Darling Harbour and right on top of the shopping district. The bellboys always provide a warm welcome and whisk our luggage into the foyer. After our long flight from the UK via Hong Kong it was great to arrive to such a warm welcome. Rooms are modern contemporary dÃ©cor with a large double bed with crisp linen sheets and duvet. The bathroom has the best bath I have ever used in a hotel - deep, long and with a slope at the end so you can lye back in comfort. There is also a separate shower and marble basin surround with a funky counter top basin. Ample big towels and a good selection of amenity's. I haven't eaten in the restaurants as I'm always too tired to do so, however, room service is always hot, always perfect and always yummy. Not to mention 24hr, so if you fancy spaghetti bolognese (a favourite of mine) at 4am then no problem, it's yours. All the staff I have come across have always been very friendly and helpful and I always look forward to returning for my relaxing stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weeking...”
Reviews.Author: scrooby_13
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I decided to have a staycation and we chose to stay at the Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel. We are members of the Entertainment Book and were able to get a fantastic deal through them and we are glad we did. Our 2 nights were absolutley fantastic, the rooms are spotless, spacious and well appointed. Staff were super friendly and more than willing to go out of their way to help you out with whatever you may need. I would reccomend this hotel for anyone who wants a trouble free break in the heart of Sydney...

Reviews.Title: “Big firm comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Willstars
Reviews.Content: Just stayed overnight for a business trip- delighted with a huge king size bed in a very well appointed room. Not much of a view but all other aspects are excellent. Looking forward to a 5 night stay in April!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jean-GuyB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in late January for 3 nights over a weekend. It was located very close to Wynyard train stop which made travel quite easy. There were also plenty of cabs. We were able to walk to the Opera House in about 25 minutes at a quick pace. We also walked to the area known as the Rocks which had some nice dining options. There is plenty of shopping near here including - get ready for this - the most amazing food court we've ever seen in the Westfield shopping Centre. It truly is worth a look. We didn't dine at the restaurant in the hotel - breakfast prices seemed quite high. The room was of average size, but had a nice bathroom with both a lovely tub and shower. The rooms were kept very clean. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable and there were options for other pillow types if so desired. I can't see any reason not to stay at this hotel unless you want something much more upscale. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SweetpeaOlive
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice fluffy towels, quality toiletries, helpful staff and luxurious rooms. The free wi fi is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in CBD”
Reviews.Author: Trave1_lover
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at this hotel. Arrived very early so assumed we would just drop our bags off and go out for the day but the guy on reception made a few enquiries and sorted a room within minutes. The room itself was lovely, comfy beds (which a pillow menu), nice furnishing and one of the best bathrooms I've come across in a hotel. There was a huge tub and seperate shower cubicle - the shower was so powerful it felt like you were having a massage. The mini bar was also extremely reasonable therefore I was able to enjoy a few bubbles in the bath! We were on a room only basis so didn't try the restaurant or bar as they are lots of good quality cafes and restaurants nearby. Circular Quay, the Rocks the main shopping area and Darling Harbour are all in walking distance of the hotel. Concerige were great recommending bars and restautants outside of the hotel .... all of which were outstanding. The Shangri La hotel has an amazing cocktail bar over looking the Harbour Bridge and Opera house which is a must if in the vacinity. The hotel also offers free wifi to all its guests which is extremely handy. Will definately stay at this hotel again when in Sydney next.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Namrata B
Reviews.Content: great location for harbour and sydney opera house, very good value for money, Quite Decent breakfast selection though pricey - but everythign in sydney is...;)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband between Christmas and New Years as I wanted to stay in the city so we could do some after Christmas sales shopping and catch up with friends for dinner in the city. We booked our accommodation on the hotel's website. At the time of our booking, they had a special offer for room upgrades. The offer was only available on the day of check-in and based upon availability. As part of the condition when you apply for the upgrade of the day, you must take (and pay for) the upgrade if you are offered an upgrade upon check-in. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a Premier Room for an additional AU$12/night, which was a bargain! I thought this was a great marketing tool and of course it encouraged me to spend a little more on the hotel room. As most of the reviews say, the hotel staff are very welcoming and friendly. The concierge staff are ready to assist with any information you may need. The free WiFi was a bonus as my husband needed to work for a few hours during our stay. Not many Sydney hotels offer free WiFi, which I think is a shame in this day and age. I used the hotel gym, which was adequate, but quite small. The 1st morning I used the gym, there were 3 others in the gym at the same time, which made it quite crammed and a little uncomfortable. The next day, I went for a run outside, which was beautiful as I could easily run down to the Opera House and along the waterfront of the Botanical Gardens. I never tire of the scenery! The hotel's location was superb for us. It is mid way between the main shopping area of Pitt Street Mall (Westfields, Myers, David Jones) and Circular Quay. It was easy to shop up a storm, then return to the hotel when my feet ached or my fingers were numb from holding the shopping bags - whichever came first! The hotel's facade is a lovely old building and just like the photos. The hotel has managed to keep the old windows in tact whilst installing modern (sound proof) ones inside, so that the hotel doesn't loose it's old look or charm. The Christmas decorations in the hotel were tasteful and not over-the-top. Our room was clean and the bathroom was spacious with a separate shower and bath. The room decor was thoughtfully planned and in calming neutral tones. The bed was very comfortable as was the comforter and pillows. My only complaint was that the housekeeping service was not consistant. The 1st night we were given a turn down service with a breakfast menu on the pillow and water beside the bed. The following evening, we didn't. On the 2nd day of our stay when our room was serviced, our bathroom amenities were not replenished. Upon check in we were asked if we'd like a newspaper. The 1st morning it was delivered, the 2nd morning it wasn't. I know they're not major issues, just a little inconsistancy. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a great city hotel in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities with a heritage feel”
Reviews.Author: Gadman
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel, and it was a wonderful cocoon from the rigours of tramping around the sights in central Sydney and the waterfront. I chose it mostly for the location, and was pleased with the quick 10 minute stroll down Pitt Street to the waterfront--other sights, even the Australian Museum, weren't more than a 20 minute walk. The hotel itself is typical businessman's five star; newspaper delivered to your hotel door each morning, attentive porters and concierge staff; and best of all, free wi-fi internet. This last item alone tipped me on the Radisson Blu--surely at the prices in this category, a gouge for another $15 or so isn't necessary. Truly bothers me about the higher-end hotels. The hotel is housed in a glorious heritage building, which I was told used to be the home of a Sydney newspaper and another prominent operation a century ago. Exceptionally well restored, with high ceilings and period architecture kept intact. The gym and pool were quite small, but well maintained. I also liked the swipe card security system in the elevators and into the gym area--a comforting thought during high crowds downton on a Friday or Saturday night. My only complaint would be the rather average food in the dining room. I had a dinner, lunch and two breakfasts, but finally gave up after paying double the price for half the quality of food I could find just a block or two away. The meteoric rise in the Australian dollar over the past three years has put prices in Sydney into sticker shock category for North Americans(the latest world city index ranks it 30% higher than New York City) so I automatically assumed that a $30 plate of bacon and eggs wouldn't be swimming in grease) Gauging by comments from other travellers who had stayed in nearby five star hotels, I believe the Blu warrants its high ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well appointed rooms.”
Reviews.Author: kepsimax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, approximately halfway between Circular Quay and the Pitt St Mall, 50m from Wynyard Train Station and a few streets from the M5 / Eastern Distributor. Given the strange shape of the building (think the Flatiron Building in NYC), the rooms vary in size and layout. My room (222) was easily the largest, by at least an extra 5-6 square metres, albeit without views onto George or O'Connell Streets. The marbled bathroom was enormous, and included a separate spa tub and walk in rainshower (fantastic pressure). An iron & board were included in the wardrobe, which was handy, as well as a large desk and mini lounge next to the window. The large kingsize bed was a bit too soft for my liking, however Radisson offers a pillow menu (foam, feather etc) which was novel. Aircon is individually controlled - some fellow guests of mine failed to realise this - within the room. The TV featured an adequate selection of local and overseas TV channels, including all 3 Fox Sports (Australia). Minibar was provided, although the prices were horrific - $7.50 for a 1.5L bottle of drinking water, $8 for local beers etc. I suggest doing what we did, and deposit the contents into the drawers provided and restock with your own goodies from the minimart across the street. Note also the hotel bar is ridiculously expensive - for a drink I suggest going straight across the road to the Bavarian Beer Cafe. We did not eat in the reknowned Bilson's restaurant located within the hotel. I didn't get a chance to use the gym / pool / sauna but was informed by fellow travellers that it was certainly adequate. Overall a very nice hotel that I will certainly return to next time in Sydney - I would like to see their check in and concierge streamlined, as it was borderline chaotic when we arrived at around 11am on a Monday morning. I've never had to wait to check in to a hotel before, and after 20 minutes my patience was running thin. We were assured the rooms would be available by 1400hrs however by 1430hrs they were still not ready. Thankfully we were compensated by a late check out of 1300hrs at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clraedc
Reviews.Content: have stayed at this hotel twice now and have found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms are very smart, clean and spacious. Will definatly stay here again. Good location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: BrynEngland
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, though fairly pricey - but it is city centre. The room was decent sized and well-equipped room, whilst all the staff genuinely seemed to want to help/ It has a good (but rather expensive) restaurant. And free wi-fi - a trend setting idea in Oz! Itâ€™s located in a good area, 5 minutes from the Opera House and ferry wharfs, and 5 minutes the other way to the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a central location”
Reviews.Author: camelthief
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are excellent quality and the location is so close to everything in Sydney. The hotel provide free WiFi, which I have not found to be common in Australia. We wanted a night in the big city for our boys to experience before we flew back home at the end of our holiday, and this provided the perfect place to do it. The price was very good for what we got. But the real reason we were bowled over by the Radisson Blu in Sydney, was the friendly and helpful staff. Right from my first conversation on the phone, through early arrival with our car, check in, check out and everything in between, each employee we dealt with was excellent. They know their stuff, anticipate needs, have suggestions and appear to enjoy their work. The management are doing something right because I don't get this level of friendly service in Australian hotels very often. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheGoodsons
Reviews.Content: This was the forth luxury hotel we stayed in as many weeks. We loved it. All the facilities you would expect are there, along with something else.....friendly, personal service. We used the executive lounge on the 40th floor. The Hotel is nicely positioned equidistant between Circular Quay and Darling Harbour, each being a ten-minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debseleven
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (28th Dec) between Xmas & New Year & found the whole thing just great from start to finish. OK there are no harbour views but the location just a five minute stroll from Circular Quay & the shops, right within the CBD couldnt be better. You get a feel for a place the moment you walk in and we cant praise the staff enough - looked after us well without being over fussy & sorted a complementary late check out for us as our flight was late evening. Getting there from the airport is a breeze - just hop on the city bound train and alight at Wynyard and its a short walk around the corner to O'Connel St. Far cheaper than a taxi & quicker. Rooms were excellent, clean modern, spacious & well equipped. Breakfast was excellent too. My wife particularly appreciated the pool which she rated as one of the best indoor pools for proper swimming she had used in a hotel. This was our last stop on a five week Aussie adventure and it formed a perfect full stop to the whole thing. It isnt cheap - we booked via Booking.com and it cost us $210 au plus brekky and they put a 2% surcharge on for credit card payments which is the only downer but we dont mind paying for a treat if you get good value. Go for it !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cathybrisbane
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We arrived early and although advised our room was not available - the receptionist gave us a rough time that it would be (still 3 hrs before the normal checkin time). We arrived back not expecting the room to be ready - but true to her word - the receptionist had got us the room! And what a room - ours was at the end of the corridor and was more like an apartment than hotel room. Really very big. corridor entrance and high ceilings. Beautifully decorated and the comfiest bed i have ever stayed in. It was also very quiet with no noise from other rooms or in the corridor. We ate in the bar that night and this was very pleasant too- with great service. I would loved to have stayed longer - a fabulous hotel in a fabulous heritage building with great staff. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Therese210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on Club points. Everything was fabulous. Quick, efficient service, easy paid upgrade to Business Lounge, welcoming Staff, clean and spacious room, huge bathroom, lovely Business Class Lounge canapes in the evening(including fresh oysters) and lots of lovely wine, champagne etc, great hot breakfast ... The hotel is centrally located close to Pitt St Mall one one side and the harbour on the other. We were very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great mid city hotel - Great access for City, Rocks, Circular Quay and Opera House”
Reviews.Author: TommoUSA
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located hotel at the north end of the shopping and business district. We found it provided easy access to all the attractions and transport. Helpful staff, very quiet and really clean. Restaurants are expensive but with so much choice around you'd be better off spending money enjoying food elsewhere. Lots of great food courts nearby with exceptional choice, there the Cruise Terminal and Harbourside with 5 minutes walk and many of the amazing restaurants at the Circular Quay/Toastrack and near the Domain are a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, really comfortable hotel and fab location”
Reviews.Author: Ann_and_Steve
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel on our Down Under trek, and the compact business lounge on the 10th floor gave unrivalled service. Staff were well trained and went out of their way to help, and they always remembered our names. Excellent breakfast buffet and canapes in the lounge each day. We'd stay here again if we came back to Sydney. 10 mins to the main shopping area and 5 mins to Circular Quay and the ferries. We also walked to Darling Harbour - about 20 mins max

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BB88888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2011 on business and I don't have a bad word to say about the hotel. Service is exceptional, rooms are spacious, the beds are very comfortable, in-room dining is great (especially the beef pie!), and the location is right in the middle of the CBD, Highly recommended for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Nick H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Radisson Blu between Christmas and New Year Day. Great location for exploring Sydney, friendly service, spacious rooms. Would recommend if you're looking to explore Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: JenHillJHCCS
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Radisson for our first 2 nights in Sydney. When we arrived early in the morning on Boxing Day, they were extremely accommodating. They took our bags and held them for us until we could check in. We wanted to go to the zoo while we waited for check in and by the time we got back our bags were already in our room. The circular quay was just a short walk to catch our ferry to the zoo. Side note, the Taronga Zoo was amazing. It was by and far one of my favorite zoos I have ever been to which is saying a lot since I am from San Diego. When we returned we relaxed by taking a nice bath and a hot shower. The shower head felt like it was massaging you. That night, we were tired, but still wanted to go out for some local fare. The concierge recommended Jamie's Italian, which was only a block away. It was by and far some of the best food we have ever had. Everything was very fresh and delicious. The french fries (aka chips) were heavenly. They had the perfect texture of crunch on the outside with a soft warm inside that was only made better by the special mayo that was served with it. That night we slept fitfully in our comfortable beds. The next day we took a short walk to The Rocks, which is a must see. The shopping and art gallery area had lots of little eateries. We enjoyed some amazing lemon meringue pie at the Rocks Cafe. We then took a short cab ride to Bondi beach ($25.00 cab ride) and enjoyed a leisurely stroll from Bondi to Tamarama Beach which was a lovely picturesque walk. Finally, we finished our second day in Sydney by going to a bar and restaurant below the Sydney Opera house, again just a short walk away, and enjoyed an delightful meal while overlooking the bridge and listening to a live outdoor band. The hotel was extremely clean, comfortable and the staff were very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard corporate hotel. Short stroll to Circular Quay.”
Reviews.Author: PipYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in November 2011. It is situated in the middle of the Central Business District and is a rather anonymous building just like all those that surround it but a short stroll to Circular Quay. We found the check-in staff to be efficient but lacking in any personal charm. We found the barman to be very pleasant. We arrived at the hotel at about 7.30am and thank goodness our room was ready as we were almost beside ourselves with fatigue. We found the hotel in general and our room to be modern, bland and of a standard corporate look, lacking in any atmoshere. It was full of businessmen attending corporate meetings. We are at a loss as to why our travel agent, Trailfinders, put us in such a dreary hotel. It does not have any outside space of any kind, not even balconies, so no where to unwind at the end of the day with a coffee or a beer and watch the world go by. Our room was spacious but made cluttered by a huge desk - obviously provided for those businessmen - and was very modern and clean and the bathroom was well appointed with a seperate shower. We felt we were invisible for the whole of our stay and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Napier1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly and attentive staff, nothing was a problem, the room was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ezz17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Business class room for one night with my partner. We booked on wotif so we had a good deal for $350. The service was excellent, and the food in the business lounge is amazing, both for canapes and for breakfast. If we hadn't already booked to go out to dinner that night we would have easily been able to have a good dinner just eating the canapes. The room itself was very comfortable, with a fantastic bathroom with a full sized tub and luxury shower. The package came with fresh fruit, newspaper delivery and robes and slippers. I would definitely recommend upgrading if possible, these luxuries made all the difference to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Happy Anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVibes
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Radisson Blu and again it was excellent. I had booked a standard room plus breakfast and we were given an upgrade as an anniversary present. Still not the big upgrade we got on our first visit - which was to business floor 11, we were on floor 7 this time with a big room and very seperate bathroom but no window through to lounge. There was a little noise from other rooms but nothing much. The cleaning staff, as others have said, did park outside as if waiting for you to leave so they could come in. They even knocked at 9am despite the "Do Not Disturb" sign. The best thing about Radisson Blu is the atmosphere, friendly and yet professional and this is due to the wonderful staff. The breakfast is amazing, down to asking for your choice of how the coffee is served and omelet rather than the standard fare. The bar is relaxing and staff are really good (expensive drinks and food but good quality and quantity). I think your room comfort depends on what room you are allocated or have booked. We have had a wonderful experience on both stays. We even tried for Radisson Blu on a last minute website secret deal two months ago and got Sofitel instead which we didn't enjoy anywhere near as much. Our anniversary was also recognised with a bottle of bubby on arrival and a card. This hotel is special, not quite 5 star in some parts, exceeds it in others. It will definitely be our hotel of choice for future Sydney visits.

Reviews.Title: “Easily an excellent 4 star stay”
Reviews.Author: Oz4
Reviews.Content: Met a friend in Sydney for a long â€˜girlsâ€™ weekend and picked the Radisson, largely on the basis of reviews read here. We had a room with 2 Double Beds and paid $808 taxes all in, for 3 nights. The building exterior is beautiful. I believe it is heritage listed and the unusual shape and sandstone is quite lovely. On the other hand, the reception area has that bland â€˜chain hotelâ€™ feel to it. I was a little disappointed on first entering, but that soon changed... The main room in our suite was large, even with the two beds, although they were set fairly close together. There was a sitting area with small table and 2 chairs, a large desk and office chair, a flat screen TV, small fridge and the usual bedside tables and lamps. There were plenty of drawers and hanging space â€“ and even almost enough hangers! The beds were only doubles, which feels small these days even when sleeping alone. However they were extremely comfortable, with the most beautiful bedding. In fact, my friend took the pillows apart trying to find a label so she could get the same ones for home. The bathroom was large with a separate (deep) bath and shower. There was plenty of shelf space, even for the cosmetics of two females. The water pressure was strong and the shower fantastic. We could probably have done with an extra couple of hooks in the bathroom â€“ but I find that to be the case is every hotel Iâ€™ve stayed at (why is that?!) As others have said, we found the location to be handy to shopping/Pitt Street Mall, Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House etc. Central and fairly easy to get around once weâ€™d located ourselves. However we found it extremely difficult to find suitable places to eat. Looking for casual eating establishments â€“ cafe or bistroâ€™s â€“ for breakfast and lunch was a real mission. We wasted a lot of time walking around, thinking we would simply run into places (like we would expect to at home â€“ Melbourne/ Brisbane). After reading the recent reviews, I think we should have availed ourselves of the Concierge! Aside from that, I would say that the Radisson/Blu/Plaza or whatever theyâ€™re calling it now, was an excellent experience. I loved my stay here and the only reason I would stay anywhere else should I return to Sydney, would be to experience the city from a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: sentosa54
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room, but on arrival we upgraded to the Business Floor and it was an excellent decision. We had a beautiful room on the 10th floor, bright and spacious with a full sized tub and a luxurious shower. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The room also has a Nespresso Coffee Machine for coffee lovers. We also had fluffy robes and slippers , daily fresh fruit and newspaper delivery. We had access to the Club Lounge and had breakfast there every morning . There was an excellent selection and eggs were cooked to order.Lovely coffee, tea and soft drinks available all day and in the evening , cocktails, wine and hot Canapes are served. The lounge staff were extremely friendly and helpful.This was our first visit to Sydney and they had lots of helpful advice and suggestions to make the most of our time. The hotel is in a fantastic location for everything, we were able to walk everywhere. We hope to come back to Sydney and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern accomodation”
Reviews.Author: jumboshrimpy
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my partner. This was on a lastminute deal which was a good price. The location is good, the building itself has good character and the valet service is very good. Concierge is friendly and prompt. The swimming pool is a lot smaller than suggested from the photos! All in all a pleasant stay, but nothing particularly amazing about it

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful building but room could have been better”
Reviews.Author: TashBeestie
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Radisson Blu Hotel in June 2011. We had a good experience, the staff was very friendly and helpful, we drove in and had to double park in front of the hotel as there were no spaces. But the staff quickly took our suitcases and parked our car, so no issues. The building and the rooms were very nice, however I felt like it was more of a 4 star than a 5 star hotel. The furnishings were slightly too basic for a nice 5 star hotel. However the bathroom was very nice, with a large bath and shower. The large window of the bathroom also opened up to the room so you can bathe and watch TV. Location was great, in the middle of the city centre but in the business district and away from the nightspots so nights were quiet. However it was a fair walk if you were looking for great food in Chinatown! In saying that, just the next block up is Neil Perry's Spice Temple which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: A2DL
Reviews.Content: I was torn between the Radisson and the Marriott and am happy with the decision to stay a the Radisson. Customer service, namely Justin the concierge, made the difference in our trip as he helped select places to visit and excursions to take (Blue Mountains, Manly Beach vs. Bondi). He would ask how each day went and it really made us feel more at home as walked through the hotel lobby. Everything about this hotel was fabulous - we even went into the Marriott and had a cocktail to check things out - the experience confirmed our decision!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: npwebb
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. Perfect for walking to Pitt Street Mall, theatre, circular quay etc. The beds are really comfy and you get free wifi which is what you would expect from all hotels these days but sadly this is still so rare. The staff at reception are friendly and the door staff extremely helpful. However the cleaning staff seem a little inconsiderate. We had the 'do not disturb' sign on the door yet the cleaning staff decided to park the trolley literally right outside our door for 40 minutes and talked really loudly the whole time. This was common most mornings during our 6 night stay. The room itself was good however the bed is so close to the bathroom that if you leave the bathroom sliding door open and are sleeping on the left side of the bed you are staring at the awfully close toilet (see photos - room 115). Also the bathroom door is glass so if you want to sleep while your partner is in the bathroom you have no chance as the light is glaring through.
