Overall the hotel is one of the noisiest we have stayed in. The doors are really heavy and slam all day and all night however they don't seem to block out the noise in the hallways. You hear lots of noise, banging and talking from the adjoining rooms and above. In fact the walls are so thin that every time the person next door uses the wardrobe and closes the doors or drawers the loud bang wakes you up and the wall shakes. If you stay here do yourself a favor and try breakfast down the road at Fioro Cafe on Pitt St and dinner at Jamie's Italian but get there early.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: tortilena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the CBD just off Pitt St. with a short walk to the Circular Quay. The Sydney Opera House is near the quay. The hotel is classy, clean and wonderfully cool. I slept very well and enjoyed my space, breakfast and all contacts with staff. The Concierge desk was very helpful. I would enjoy using this hotel again and hope to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayank211
Reviews.Content: Bang in the middle of CBD, this hotel is a perfect location for business travelers. Walking distance from the harbor front the location is also great for those who wish to see the city. The hotel is efficient, and comfortable. Would always

Reviews.Title: “live like a king, for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: drmmer07
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, well looked after by the reception. One drawback was that i had organised a room upgrade and an early checkout. They did not have that on their system nor look for it, so i tested them to see if they would remember. Got taken to my room, and was straight on to reception to remind them of my upgrades. That got finalised and i was upgraded to a premier suite. Huge room, prob the size of three atrium rooms...heaps good. However, the room didnt have the window from the bathroom into the room, i was looking forward to this but oh well...a 60 sqm room was good enough. beds are the most comfy ive ever slept on, and linen was soft as!! could use a bigger bath...other than that..i paid $18 for a jack daniels and coke (double). My gosh, why do they put the price up so much?? anyway, u get what u pay for in a 5 star hotel, and this is one of the finest in town in a nice quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: rose2travel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Radisson Blu and we have stayed in many places in Sydney before. The Radisson is a great hotel with excellent attentive staff. From the moment we arrived on the street in our car looking a little lost the concierge staff came to our aid and the great service just continued. A very busy weekend but everyone was taken care of promptly. Super quiet rooms and very comfortable beds with large well appointed bathrooms and very clean. Breakfast was a very good selection so we could find no fault in our stay. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca R
Reviews.Content: two words = PILLOW MENU !! - such a great option ! Staff are very helpful (before we even got out of the cab they were in the boot getting our bags and escorting us in), rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast was great and a huge selection (and good coffee). Spa treatments were good. Great location -Close to a lot of things. Beautiful old building. We were also allowed a late checkout at 1pm at no extra charge ;)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room”
Reviews.Author: LionHongKong
Reviews.Content: We booked through last minute and this may have something to do with our sub-standard room. We left our booking quite late and still paid a lot more than we have paid for comparable hotels in Sydney, but availability was limited so prices were more expensive. Our room was on the mezzanine floor right next to the business centre and function rooms and we could hear people outside. There really shouldn't be guest rooms on these floors. The decor was tired and fittings old. The room was fairly small and looked out onto street level - you had to keep the blinds drawn at all times for privacy. The concierge didn't assist me with my bag on arrival. I arrived after my husband who asked reception to give me a key, I was quite surprised that they did this without checking my ID. My husband has stayed here before (for less) and had a much better room, so I guess this is just the treatment you get when staying with lastminute - we had the same experience this trip with the Amora Jamison in Sydney. If I'd known we would get such a sub standard room I would have booked a 3 star hotel and saved the money.

Reviews.Title: “location and class”
Reviews.Author: kez205
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay for 3 nights here recently, decor and furniture are stylishly understated quality and well maintained. Comfortable beds and glamorous tiled/marble bathroom. The basin tap dripped but when pointed out to staff was fixed straight away. Desk staff and concierge friendly and very helpful. The leisure facilities are great, pool, spa, sauna, gym, just the job after hiking around the city all day.Free internet access. Excellent location a couple of blocks from circular quay, and very quiet area on weekends. Food in the bistro and especially breakfast was too expensive, but that's typical for Sydney I suppose. Also we booked an "atrium room", which one would expect overlooked the atrium, but it didn't - no view at all.

Reviews.Title: “Top tier hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BarbFinStLouis
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu is a very nice hotel with an historic ambiance, located just a few minutes walk from the Circular Quay (in one direction) and Hyde Park and uptown shopping (in the other direction). The service is excellent, accommodations and amenities are quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Rad at Radisson Blu”
Reviews.Author: RainnIceberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great in almost all areas. Being from Canada and not familiar with the "Blu" version of Radisson, I was really shocked. Right from the front door, the service is superb and the Hotel looks fantastic. It's nothing unique or memorable compared to most 4 star hotels, but its modern, very clean, and practically looks like new. The bell service/doorman service is great. It seemed every time I walked in or out of the building they would make an offer or recommendation that I would not have thought of myself. As for the bell service, Justin helped me with my luggage in and out of the hotel and was friendly and courteous. The elevators can be a bit slow during peak times, but this is a minor annoyance. The business class rooms are comfortably appointed, but again, nothing spectacular compared to other hotels in its class. The bathroom is nice, clean and has a large soaker tub as well as a shower stall. Everything was spotlessly clean each day, and turn down service is prompt. The business class rooms also provide access to the gold lounge, which provides a delicious morning breakfast, snacks during the afternoon and evening and cocktails in the evening. The room is nice and the staff is fantastic. Sheila offered lots of recommendations on where to go for dinner, another lady from Bali (i believe she was the lounge manager, and I am sorry I can't remember her name) was very friendly and always made an attempt to engage me in conversation. She also made recommendations on where to go. The man that worked during breakfast was nothing but professional, and never said no to any special request. All in all, this is an amazing hotel, truly worth the stay. My only complaints are small: 1) What is with the excessively starched sheets? They were not uncomfortable, but took some time getting used to. 2) The prices for room service are out to lunch. I know its a 5 star hotel, but no hamburger is worth $30 ($25 for the burger plus a $5 delivery fee). That's ridiculous, and I actually stayed away from the bistro fax restaurant simply out of principal. However, there are lots of places to dine around the hotel, so don't let that scare you from staying! You will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Service outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JoyousGem
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel was outstanding! Everyone went above and beyond to help us out and make us feel welcome. Room was nice and clean and I would definately stay here again. The buffet breakfast was well worth the price. We upgraded to a Executive Spa Suite, which was very nice, but lacked a view which we would have loved. Couldnt fault them thoughh, the stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The best Sydney has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find fault.....Excellence & Elegance in one place. If staying in Sydney there is no better choice of Hotel. Close to everything Sydney has to offer. Have stayed here twice now & will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MattyJKirk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found the rooms to be great, faclities were fantastic and the location was perfect for a weekend of looking around Sydney. Whilst not cheap it does allow you to walk to most major activities located in or near the CBD. We walked to dinner at the Rocks and Darling Harbour and was an easy stroll to the ferry for the Zoo and across to Manly. Looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeB
Reviews.Content: Hard to add much to the many positive reviews of this property. All I can do is summarize what others have praised: location is superb (a short walk to just about everywhere); the rooms spacious, quiet and comfortable; the shower outstanding; the Internet complimentary; the staff exceedingly helpful and polite. The decor is elegant and understated, a rare pleasantry for a luxury property. If included in the room rate, the breakfast is tasty, the choices extensive.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and comfortable - hgihgly recommended”
Reviews.Author: scot_in_oz
Reviews.Content: It's not often that one stays in the centre of a large city (it's a short walk to Circular Quay, the Opera House, train stations etc) and yet has a peaceful time in a hotel, and yet that's exactly what this hotel managed to deliver. It's located on a slightly smaller street than some of the big main streets in the CBD, and so there's less traffic noise. Rooms are double glazed, and so it's possible to get a fantastic night's sleep, also aided by the extremely comfortable mattresses and pillows. I had a lovely time at this hotel: staff are friendly and helpful, room service is excellent, facilities are terrific (swimming pool, spa, gym), it's great for business travel too (free wifi and free wired internet - much appreciated, there's nothing I dislike more than hotels charging fees for wifi!). My room was also extremely spacious: high ceilings, lots of storage and floor space. The bathroom is large, with a fabulous bath and separate shower. There's a clever design that uses shutters to allow natural light into the bathroom too. My one criticism would be that breakfast is expensive: you should factor it in to the overall cost of your stay. The buffet breakfast (which is excellent) is expensive: $35 per person. Room service breakfast is also quite expensive: even if you only want tea, juice and cereal, you will end up paying around $25. Despite this, I'd certainly stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in downtown sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sureshan K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. Very nice hotel. All point attraction are close by. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eandg11
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with lovely rooms and great staff. The food in the hotel is v v good aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend as hotel excellent, service amazing and whole experience unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: brindie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night break and found this gorgeous hotel just what we needed . The reception staff were all very attentive and our room was beautiful , we could even pick our own style of pillow ,fantastic. We were caught up in the qantas debacle and the hotel gave us the same room to stay in for another night which was great . Whilst you are there try their cocktails even if they are not on the menu they will make for you it seems nothing is too much trouble . Service is very obviously important to management . The hotel is beautifully positioned for walking to the city and circular quay and the rocks area . So all in all we would thoroughly recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pheelinphunki
Reviews.Content: Its been some time since I went to this hotel, but I have stayed here twice. The hotel is stylish, modern, and in an enviable location. We were only a short walk from the harbour and opera house, and the was a veriety of bars and restaurants nearby. The staff were more than welcoming, which is more than can be said for some of the bar owners nearby. The hotel has a great spa. If I return to Sydney, I would definately consider this hotel again, as I was mroe than happy the last 2 times I was here.

Reviews.Title: “Great CBD location wth great rates”
Reviews.Author: malcolm1606
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Plaza is newly renovated in an attractive older building. Rooms are spacious, and, unusual for Australia, include free WiFi. The breakfast is excellent, the location quiet and only a short walk from the Rocks and Circular Quay. The restaurant is extremely high end, so we didn't try it, but there are lots of places to eat locally.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kayleen C
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels ive stayed in - the service and the staff were incrediably attentive. Had a girlfriends weekend there for two nights - by the time we left i think most of the staff knew us all by first names !! All staff made us feel very welcome and nothing was a problem - troy at the front had a dozen roses sent to our room that somebody had given him. If he didnt know the answer to a question (ie - how to get to somewhere) - he would find someone who did. I bought two lost tourist back to the hotel that were looking for a particular shop - the door staff found someone who knew the city well and directed them accordingly including walking them down to the lights and making sure the crossed the road safely !! From 4 mums with special needs kids - we were very spoilt and so grateful to all the staff that made our stay so special. We are just sorry we did not get all the staff members name to thank them personally. By the end of two days stay it was like saying goodbye to family !!

Reviews.Title: “stylish appointed hotel with perfect staff and a unique design”
Reviews.Author: HamburgAround
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located for most things to do in Sydney. There are quite a few shopping centers nearby (Arcade and Victoria Building) and the Opera as well as the Botanical Garden is within walking distance. Circular Quay is even closer. The hotel itself welcomes with a stylish lobby and very welcoming and attentive staff. The guestrooms have a decent size and the bathrooms feature both shower and a tub. Our Business Class room featured an interior windows bringing natural light into the superior bath with marble and granite flooring. The room and the hotel is in a perfect condition and well-kept. The staff is amazing with handy tipps and the attention to go another step for the guest. Thank you so much! We will surely com back! The best way to reach the hotel would be the Airport Link train (maybe with an interchange at Central) to Wynyard Station and another 5 minute easy walk downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money in Sydney ... Which isn't sayin that it is cheap”
Reviews.Author: mattmooney
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, wih rooms and amenities that have been done up pretty reently. good location fairly near circular quay. If you can get one of the 30 rooms (530, 630, 730 etc) they are quite a bit bigger. Overall, good value for what you pay - although that isn't cheap!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a bit "blue" about this stay”
Reviews.Author: tongi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few times back in 2002 when it was called the Raddison Plaza (I think) and it seems to have gone a bit downmarket since then (three-to-four star quality these days). When I stayed in the past the decor seemed quite sophisticated: now it looks tired and a bit tacky - for example the AWFUL blue roses in the flower arrangements in the foyer. BUT the staff were polite and efficient, and the hotel has a nice atmosphere overall plus a great midtown location, which is handy to many major attractions for tourists and convenient for business travellers. The bathroom was large and the shower roomy. The bed linen was good, too. I enjoyed a bar meal one night - food and drink were good. The bar, while looking a bit worn-around-the-edges, had a nice atmosphere. On the other hand, I was in an internal (atrium) room, which was a modest size, but OK for a short business stay. However, it wasn't clear how/if you could pull down a blind to darken the room if you didn't want to wake up early because of early morning sunlight. I was disappointed that while the hotel does have free wifi, it wasn't working one night, and there was no apology or explanation. And I was MORE disappointed that one morning there was no hot water, and the hotel didn't warn guests (I had to ring down to find out what was going on) or provide any gesture of apology for the inconvenience of guests having to take cold showers. And why do hotels charge extra when you pay with a credit card? Who carries around that much cash? BE TRANSPARENT WITH YOUR ROOM RATES. I wouldn't be in a hurry to return, but I wouldn't say no if it were suggested.

Reviews.Title: “A Raddisson Blu regular”
Reviews.Author: sophiej002
Reviews.Content: Everytime I need to book accomodation in Sydney I try to stay at the Raddisson. The staff are caring and attentive, the rooms are well appointed, clean and quiet. Location wise the hotel is located on the north of the city in walking distance to The Rocks and Pitt Mall. The hotel is also located within a 3 min walk to Wynyard Train Station which is on the City Circle route. Bilson's restaurant is a famous award winning restaurant and I highly recommend this culinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: travelwithnancy
Reviews.Content: The staff here was so friendly and helpful that we never wanted to leave. Wayne the concierge spent much time helping us with directions and other recommendations, even lending us an umbrella when it rained. They accommodated us with an early check in as well. Hotel is situated within walking distance of all of the Sydney Harbour attractions. Beautiful design combines historic building with modern convenience. Concierge level bar and breakfast room overlooking the city. Nice restaurant, complete spa and indoor pool. You cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay & attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: TimBags
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Raddison Blu after being transferred from the Sir Stamford hotel due to an erroneous overbooking. We arrived at the hotel around 1am and Oscar who met us at reception was extremely accommodating, he had has checked into our room promptly and his friendly attitude & attentiveness was much appreciated after such a long and exhausting day/night. The room was clean, very spacious and offered free wireless internet. The bathroom was also very clean and a generous size. The king size bed was extremely comfortable, having a choice of different pillow types is always a nice added extra and offers even greater comfort, we both had an amazing night sleep. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, I won't waste my time with the Sir Stamford next time though and will just head straight here!

Reviews.Title: “Quality sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Marcothepolopony
Reviews.Content: We found this inner city Hotel an excellent base for shopping in Sydney. Apart from having to lug my heavy case up several steps into Reception, the attentive staff were ever ready to assist. The room was beautifully decorated and the disababled facilities I had requested were immaculate and spacious. Thank you. The hotel does not have view from any window, but the compensation is the comfortable sleep in a very quiet room with quality linen on the bed. Large flat screen TV kept me happy when I was not out shopping at Pitt Street Mall, just up the road. I felt secure in that I could lock my room, but the lock was a bit suspect. Housekeeping. I would recommend this quality hotel to anyone wishing a quiet, serene central base in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: megalomaniac1
Reviews.Content: I booked a secret hotel for one nights stay and was happy to learn that it turned out to be the Radisson. I did not expect a big room but I ended up receiving the Studio Spa suite which was a great size and very comfortable. The marbled bathroom is huge with a separate toilet/powder room and the bed is super comfortable, it's probably one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in and I was disappointed that I only booked one night! Only two things irked me a little bit: my tv did not seem to work after exhausting every button and technique it displayed no channels but luckily I had brought a book with me and also the room service is a little expensive...$25 for a pizza?!. Aside from these two I thoroughly recommend this room and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: newbtravel
Reviews.Content: This is my second quick stay at Radison Blu in Sydney. I travel a fair bit for business and this has to be the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. Lovely building, great location and the staff will bend over backwards to exceed your expectations. The swimming pool is a lap pool so it would not be a place to take the little ones to play, but for someone who actually wants to swim it is great. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a 5 Star hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: GlomeshGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked through wotif and secured a very good rate. However, when we checked in, we had been given a disabled room. I could tell straight away from the bench seat and handrail in the extra large shower. I thought the room I booked meant to have a bath. Immediatley I contacted reception and within 5 minutes the concierge moved us another room which was better than I had anticipated. We stayed Thurs through to Sat night and found Friday was a little noisy for some reason. Im not sure where the music was coming from, but other than that I could not fault our stay and would stay here again. We didnt eat here as we had dinner appointments. We had drinks in the bar and the staff were excellent, very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 16th to 18th September 2011. Room: Very comfortable and modern, complimentary wifi was appreciated. Bathroom was excellent, large, with separate shower to bath and very nice complimentary toiletries. Great robes and towels. The bed was very comfortable, and the sheets were beautiful. TV had a good deal on movies, as many as you want to watch within 24 hours for $25. Meals: I had two dinners via room service and they were excellent. Delivery was less than 40min after ordering. Prices for chicken risotto and spaghetti bol approx $30 each. Location: Excellent. Very close to Pitt St Mall for shopping, very close to numerous restaurants, very close to Circular key with the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. I stayed here to do Sydney Marathon which starts on the other side of the Harbour Bridge. I caught a train from Wynyard station, which was also very close, to get to the race start. Very convenient. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again. I've also stayed at the Shangrila in the Rocks area, which was wonderful, but I think the location of this hotel suited my needs better - marathon and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Lauren C
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel when visting Sydney for a friends wedding. The service at this hotel is first class. From the moment we walked in the doors they couldn't do enough to help you. We only stayed one night & the room was perfect for what we were after. Clean, tidy & comfortable. The location is fantastic & so close to everything. We will be returning next year for 2 nights on the first leg or our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Terry G
Reviews.Content: This a very nice 5 Star hotel in a Perfect Location! Walking distance from the Harbour, Opera House, The Rocks, Aquarium, China Town, the Needle Tower, etc! Plenty of restaurants in the area, and a great place for coffee and breakfast just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “First choice in Sydney near Martin Place”
Reviews.Author: perthmarlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business. Speedy check in and I was upgraded to a balcony room, whih isn't huge but is on the quieter top floor with lots of natural light. The concierge and bellboy staff were lovely and so helpful. I am happy to carry my own bags, but the offer was always cheerfully made. Breakfast was included in the room price and was a hot and cold buffet with a la carte options. Beautifully presented and delicious food. Mineral water available! Love this hotel which is hard to beat. Congratulations to the management and staff. You make visiting an absolute delight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: TMF73
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at the Raddison Blu Sydney. From the moment the taxi pulled up to the time we left the hotel, all staff were accommodating, friendly and courteous (what a nice change). The room was clean, the bed very comfortable, great coffee machine and amazing room service. Central location, it was an easy walk to Sydney Harbour and Pitt St mall. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: PandaMoy
Reviews.Content: Location - Good It is walkable to chinatown and many food stores around Staff / Service - Good Staff is friendly and helpful Room - Very Good The room / bed is comfortable and quite spacious. Breakfast - Not included. To include breakfast, you need to top up. It is not worth the amount for breakfast since there are many options available around the hotel ***Not much of chanels available on TV to watch...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bluechch
Reviews.Content: Very close to Circular Quay, Pitt Street shopping centre and Theatre Royal. Spent two nights in this lovely five star hotel. Very friendly staff. My two teenage daughters loved the indoor heated swimming pool and spa pool. I enjoyed drinking a cocktail or two in the comfortable bar off the reception area. Room was very clean. Slight downside, was lack of natural light in the room, due to the surrounding large commercial buildings in the area. However, a small price to pay for the convenience of having everything practically on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew255103
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and found this to be an excellent hotel on a number of fronts. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed with separate "large" bathtub and shower. The room offers a large cupboard, tea and coffee facilities, and large work desk, with free wifi internet making it ideal for a working trip. The staff is very helpful and I was most impressed when the bell staff at the front of the hotel went in search of a cab when there wasnâ€™t one waiting at the front of the hotel. Umbrellas are freely available at reception which you do not need to sign for making this very convenient. The hotel is excellently located and within 250 metres of Wynyard station for the train and easy walking distance to circular key for the ferries. There are also excellent cafeâ€™s, restaurants and bars very close by. I will definitely stay here next time Iâ€™m in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times now, and I keep returning! Dont have much to say regarding service etc in the hotel as I am normally out and about doing my own thing. The location is super, literally a few minutes walk to circular quay. I get the impression that its mostly used by business guests but its a good choice for leisure travellers too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at its best.”
Reviews.Author: DavidOMalley
Reviews.Content: Once was Bank,and converted to a superb Hotel, situated in the middle of the city, within easy reach of sightseeing and restaunts. Service in the Hotel excellent, staff very helpful, and the very large beroom, with crisp white sheets, plus extremly clean.Just a fabulos hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodfanOZ
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient staff, nice spacious rooms and bathrooms. Shower seperate to bath. Very comfortable beds and double blinds that darken the room completely for a good and long sleep. The hotel is only minutes away from Wynyard and you can walk through Hunter Arcade (during the day) to get to Pitt Street and find the hotel to your left.The only downside are the small windows. The rooms are quite dark and you look pretty much into other hotel windows. Other than that we recommend this hotel and would stay there again any time. Sometimes on Wotif as a secret deal and therefore at a fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely, the Best”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVibes
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly modern 5 Star hotel with old world charm. I don't usually like older buildings and older style but this hotel makes it work with old style look (amazing desk in business class rooms) along with up to the minute bathroom style and fittings. Reception area, huge lounge and bar and Bistro Fax are modern and very well presented. Service was top class, I can't fault it - from the Concierge with helpful hints of how to get to places despite us knowing Sydney quite well, suggestions to take an umbrella in the evening, help with bags and genuine interest in us; through to the Chef and Staff at breakfast in Bistro Fax. I ordered omelet two mornings and they were prepared within minutes and delicious. I even swapped the pot of coffee for a latte (no problem at all). All the food was well presented and very yummy! Bar service in afternoons was excellent and the burgers (both chicken and beef special) were very filling with chips also. Check-in was so fast I can't even remember it. Check-out was by speedy card (I'd checked and preapproved the final costs via the TV link). Pool, spa, steam-room were very much appreciated after a long day of shopping and walking about Sydney and Darling Harbour. My husband said it was the clearest, cleanest pool he has used in a hotel. The gym looked good and will be used on a future stay. Like a previous reviewer I'd like to keep this all a secret but I can't so I will instead ask management to ensure these high standards remain - we have stayed in other good hotels and sadly seen the standards drop when staff become lax. Radisson Blu has very good staff - they are what make your business so good. I forgot to mention the cleaning staff - very friendly greetings and again, a very high standard. I asked for a cupboard door hinge repair if possible - it was done within minutes and with a smile. I'm sounding like an advert but this is a genuine and somewhat surprising to me (I don't usually rate Sydney hotels highly) excellent for this hotel. Price is higher than some but excellent deals can be found both on the Radisson Blu and on last minute sites.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Peta255097
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and from the moment we arrived we enjoyed our stay. The concierge and front reception staff were so polite and welcoming. The hotel services staff were friendly and efficient. The room was beautifully presented and quiet. It is very conveniently located within easy walking distance of the CBD as well as the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Generally a great stay but a few things let it down”
Reviews.Author: katy35
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a mystery deal on wotif so the price was great about $180 a night. We had a generally lovely stay, my only gripes being the following: - when we got room service breakfast, one of the fried eggs was uncooked and inedible - i have been charged a mysterious $40 that is showing on my credit card as a hotel charge but the hotel has no record of it - they have suggested it is an authorisation amount but i dont think it is - its been a week and its still showing on my card. - the room was a bit tired - cracks in the wall under the window.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blues”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn51
Reviews.Content: No, we won't be staying here again... Despite the exhortation on the bedside table that Radisson Blu guaranteed satisfaction, we weren't. We also let them know. The manager was very sorry. So were we. Firstly, the pool was out of action for the duration of our stay. Then there were no PayTV stations available. When we were checking out, a "delivery truck" was blocking the way for our car to be driven up to us. Too bad about the plane we had to catch. And so it went... on and on... There are many other 5 star hotels in Sydney. We will be staying with one of them in future.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Elegant, a true 5 star”
Reviews.Author: PDAX
Reviews.Content: Radisson Plaza is delightful. The Victorian building has beautiful character and sits in the heart of Sydney CBD whilst tucked away from the hustle and bustle. 5 minute walk to the shopping mecca and all the best restaurants. A very beautiful short walk to The Rocks. We had an emaculate large room flooded with warm golden light. A rare true 5 star hotel with old world charm. It houses Bilsons restaurant which is known as one of the worlds best. The service and food were superb. We received their utter most attention. Bistro Fax also is fantastic at night transforms into elegant fine dining. Loved this hotel. Would love to keep Radisson Plaza Sydney a secret, but it's so wonderful we can't resist but to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect end to a Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: giselle s
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and a great location. Our room was comfotrable and quiet with excellent facilities. Good breakfast in delightful surroundings and lovely drawing room in which to relax. We were given lots of useful advice for our first visit to Sydney and if we return we shall definitely try and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Zan9
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our stay at the Radisson was perfect. Doormen and porters were always helpful and quick to assist, check in was speedy, the room was lovely, the bed and pillows were a dream. We had breakfast in the business lounge, and also went there in the evening for canapes where we very much appreciated the tranquil atomosphere after a busy day. The service and standards were excellent . We are seasoned travellers and find large city hotels are usually impersonal but in our opinion the Sydney Radisson really is quite unique in that the excellent, efficient staff by their friendly manner also convey that they are genuinely pleased to see you and want you to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in the centre of all that shopping!!”
Reviews.Author: bluey829
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel loved the room spacious comfortable beds. the bathroomwas a reminder of a similar hotel in Phuket with the door directly opening into the bathtub. Very friendly concierge , bar and restaurant staff. we had drinks first and then went on to the Bistro Fax for dinner. Loved the cocktails and food. Very family friendly spa and indoor pool. Great location for mid city shopping etc. Definitely will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu hotel for three nights in August 2011. This is our second trip to Sydney and we will definitely stay here again on our next visit. The hotel is ideally located: 2 minutes from Wynyard Train Station, 5 minutes to Circular Quay, 7 minutes to The Rocks and about 10 minutes to the Pitt St shopping area. There area a couple of pubs nearby, but the rooms are so well sound-proofed that we did not hear a bit of street noise for our entire stay, which included a Friday night. The hotel itself is in an historic "flat-iron" building, that has been completely redone on the inside. The lobby is very bright and airy. There are a bistro and lounge with direct access off the lobby, as well as Bilson's restaurant, which is accessible but not visiible from the lobby. We ate at the bistro (Bistro-Fax) and had a drink in the lounge. Both places had great selection and service. The room was very spacious and well laid out. We were in a studio suite, which has a spa tub, sitting area and king size bed. The toiletries provided are of good quality. It was very relaxing to get back to the room at the end of each day and go to the pool for a swim, followed by a soak in the spa tub or steam. There is a gym attached to the spa area, as well as spa treatment areas, but we did not take advantage of these. Overall our stay there was fantastic. The service was very good, the hotel is beautiful and the location can't be beat. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Gooster47
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly and efficient, presentation and layout of room was excellent. Room was quiet and very comfortable. Very good bathroom and shower. Good pool, spa and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is a nice hotel in a great location. The exterior of the building is quite beautiful with it's old style architecture but the interior does not do the building justice. The lobby is rather ho-hum and tired, the lifts need an upgrade. Service staff are efficient and friendly. As for the rooms, they are nicely decorated but not really very luxurious. The beds are EXTREMELY comfortable though. Another great plus is the free internet, that definitely earns points for me. A couple of points to note on the rooms, the do not disturb sign is not wired, the hotel still uses the old fashioned cardboard on the door handle. What this means is that the door bell does not get disabled and I got a very rude wake up at 3:30am one night. I'm not sure who the person was but the door bell rang twice and stopped, so I'm assuming it was a prank or a mistake. House keeping was only so-so. Example: the work desk in the room has a piece of glass over it, between the glass and the desk surface were crumbs left over from a previous guest and the crumbs remained there for my entire stay. All they needed to do was stick the vacuum hose on it for 2 seconds. Room service was good and prompt, food was hot and VERY reasonably priced for Sydney. Breakfast at the restaurant was okay. Staff are friendly, but the choices are limited and didn't really change every day. Despite the issues that I had, I don't mind this hotel. I would never rank it as a favourite but I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels and great location”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotting_HKer
Reviews.Content: By international standards, this is definitely closer to a four star as other travelers have also mentioned. But by Sydney standards, this is one of the better hotels and honestly better value for money than say the Shangri-La. Stayed here for one night as a personal extension to a business trip (company-paid nights were in the Shangri-La). Was a great base to explore the various city sights, 2 minute walk to both Circular Quay and Martin Place. There isn't a proper driveway here unlike the Shangri-La but didn't have any issues arriving or leaving. Service was commendable (in fact, much better than the Shangri-La) and the concierge (both an older guy and two younger assistants) were enthusiastic and took initiative, and clearly knew the surroundings very well. They even gave me detailed instructions on my planned Blue Mountains day trip, which worked out without a glitch. No shortage of restaurants in the vicinity both Asian and Western, and award-winning Bilson's is of course right in the ground floor of the hotel. The room I had was small-ish, but well appointed, with comfortable bed, a pillow menu, a small work desk, and a comfy bathroom. Only gripe was that I could find neither a toothbrush nor a comb but these were promptly brought when I rang housekeeping. The shower area also didn't have a light directly above it, which made it darker than I am typically used to. Wardrobe was awfully tiny and in dire need of an upgrade. No view to speak of (looked out at a wall and a sliver of the swimming pool if I looked down). Other than that for a historic hotel, decent service, and GREAT location, I thought this was one of the better value for money hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “My Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer_Rome
Reviews.Content: I chose this among the top ten hotels listed for Sydney because of the consistent high reviews, location to Circular Quay (good transport hub), value for price, and FREE WI-FI in room. I will stay here again and again. I brought my Sydney-sider friends to see my room and they were equally impressed, noting the rooms are larger than you find elsewhere in the city. I chose the business deal which was only like $13 more expensive than standard. This provided breakfast, access to drinks/aperitif in business lounge, and other little amenities in the room. I took advantage of breakfast a couple times but not drinks, as I went out with friends. The bathroom is large with separate shower and bath, and I liked the idea of space and openness that the window from the bath provided. The view is of other buildings, but to be expected in the middle of the city. The bed is PERFECTLY firm, not too soft, not too hard (I'm Goldilocks) The TV is large and the interface for channels is quick and responsive. Unlike some lesser and annoying systems. The hotel is in the Central Business District, but so near to the new Westfield Mall (Excellent food court, unlike most malls, worth a visit), movie theatre and high-end boutiques off George, and so close to buses that go out to wherever you need to go, and 10 minutes from the Opera House and the Rocks and Circular Quay for ferries. (and the Museum of Sydney, a great place to go learn about the city and see great exhibitions). I find the Australian star system to be a bit inflated compared to the US system, for example a 5 star here is like a 4 star in the US. But all things considered, for this property, given the quality to price ratio, it is great value for the money, and I didn't find any details in the room to be overlooked or features to be run down or lacking. It is well maintained. The only bad thing was the 2% fee for using a credit card. Apparently hotels in Australia pass this expense on to the client overtly instead of just working it into their price structure as they should. Some charge 1.5% some charge 3.5%. The sign at the front desk says if you have questions you can ask the Manager, so I did, and he was quite flippant in pointing out that the Radisson's rate is less than the Westin's rate (where he used to work), and since I wasn't staying a month, it shouldn't be an imposition. The hotel I stayed in in another Australian city charged 1.5% but waived it. Whatevs. Hotels obviously have the discretion to choose their fee and Managers are able to waive the fee, but Benjamin was clearly not impressed by me. Nor I by him, though he was professional.

Reviews.Title: “A polished operation, couple of oddities but a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: georgieandthree
Reviews.Content: My overall impression of this hotel was excellent. I love the heritage building it is housed in. I arrived about 9.30pm and there were staff to help me with my small suitcase. The room was about 90% perfect: a full-sized bathtub (a rarity, and a godsend as I'd run a half-marathon that day and then had a 4-hr flight!) plus a separate shower, a comfortable and good-sized bed, nice desk, good-sized wardrobe. Three oddities about the room: the shower door did not quite close properly, which resulted in a wet floor (not a huge deal), the vanity basin tap fittings were very visible under the vanity top (not a big deal in any functional way, but it detracted from the overall appearance of quality), and the blinds on the window were see-through. The design of the building meant I was very close to other rooms in the hotel and I could see into their windows easily; I assume they could therefore see into mine and I don't know why there are not thick curtains as well as the sheer blinds. Breakfast was good and the service attentive. A nice touch was being offered a complimentary bottle of water when I got in from my early-morning run one morning of my stay. Don't really know how it compared cost-wise as my employer paid for it, but I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful old building, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: paulab666
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely old lady on the outside, but very modern on this inside. The staff were all very friendly and efficient. Our meals were very nice and our room was all you would expect. Good location and hardly any traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory; a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBphoque
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 2 nights during the week. We arrived on Monday morning after a long flight from Paris, so were quite happy when we called and they said we could check in at 10am. We arrived at the Pitt Street entrance, which is downstairs from the lobby and reception. There is a phone there, which indicates you can call to have someone help with luggage, we did so. However no one came for a good 10 minutes. So we lugged our bags to the main entrance. As we were waiting for our room in the lobby, we heard the concierge tell one of the porters to "go downstairs, because there might be some people waiting with bags". It was probably just an oversight, but a bit annoying, nonetheless. The room itself was quite nice. Modern, clean, nice finishings with a big bathroom. The window is large, but starts from very high up on the wall, so there isn't the feeling of spaciousness that you get from rooms with lower windows. It's understandable though, as the room is right in the middle of the CBD and a lower window would probably give us a view into someone's office next door! Breakfast was included in the rate and it was pretty good. Fresh OJ, different selections on the 2 days, good condiments. The hotel is in the business part of the city, so it's a bit dead in terms of eating, sightseeing, culture. But it's an easy walk/busride to all the fun stuff. We got a good rate and apart from a few small things, we were pretty happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Value for money Very well managed Albert the housebarman is attentive rooms esp the upgrade ones are great.

Reviews.Title: “Classic comfort”
Reviews.Author: Dennis3836
Reviews.Content: I regularly visist this hotel when in Sydney on business. It is in a great location, has very comfortable rooms and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonnogreig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July 2011. Very good value for money. Great location too.....minutes from both Circular Quay and Wynard Train ststions. Very good gym / pool, which I used. Very friendly staff and a superb concierge. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good standard accommodation - F&B too pricey for what it is”
Reviews.Author: C073
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel with our two late-teen daughters for four nights. The hotel is quite conveniently located in the CBD within walking distance to shops and - if you are not too spoiled - even Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. If you like to eat out at night, the fact that the hotel is in the CBD does however rather limit your choices. On daytime you have plenty of take-away outlets throughout the area. Sit-down places with a nice atmosphere are however rare in the immediate surroundings. The rooms are comfortable and nice and the hotel can certainly be recommended as good value for money if you can get a good deal (in an Australian context) through a discount hotel site (e.g. Agoda); we got Friday to Monday for approx. USD 210 per room and night - breakfast included. The extension for one night at the rack rate of AUD 310 per room made the value for money we got for that Monday night accordingly less attractive, especially since it did not even include breakfast. Considering that the buffet costs AUD 35 per head, the equivalent package was hence more than double of what we paid during the first 3 days. We had breakfast, tea/drinks and dinner at and room-service from the hotel's brasserie/cafe restaurant. The breakfast spread was okay and the food quality also - but nothing to rave about (especially the bread/bakery section was on average underwhelming in quality, also the spread of fruits was boring and the savory hot food section lacked choices for vegetarians). I would not pay AUD 35 per head for it again - especially not for someone who has dietary restrictions (e.g. vegetarian). Dinner was fine in terms of quality and presentation but - if you are not yet used to how expensive Australia in general has become - it may be rather pricey. The staff was generally competent but in terms of friendliness and helpfulness we experienced the full range from excellent to quite poor. Variations occurred especially in the F&B section and the guy who took the room-service order was outright snooty and impatient. The receptionists/concierge and especially the bell-boys were however always a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered on their 100% satisfaction policy”
Reviews.Author: jazzcazznz
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain has a 100% satisfaction policy and they certainly met it. So many hotels deliver average service and you leave with no memorable moments at all. To start it was so easy for me to get there on my own as my husband was already in Sydney. A 15 minute journey on the train from the airport to Wynyard Station. Out to George Street down Hunter St and you are at the hotel. Friendly welcome at the door and then again at reception. During our 3 night stay we were acknowledged by all staff everytime. Our deluxe room was very modern with an upmarket bathroom that had a large bath and shower. Location wise the hotel is right in the hub of the shopping mecca (just happened to be sale time) and a block away from the bridge, Opera House, Circular Quay where we caught the ferries out to Manly and Taronga Zoo. Stand out was the full buffet breakfast that was included in our room rate. Everything you could want for breakfast and more as each morning there were a few chefs specials - extremely tasty! This was the first time we were offered a latte or flat white with breakfast and wasn't charged for it. Well done Radisson Blu, well definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CAR_UK
Reviews.Content: After a very long flight from London we were greeted by the well presented reception and then the very friendly and helpful concierge staff. Our first impressions were great and upon checking in to our room we were further impressed. Great clean, spacious and modern room with a very well equiped bathroom. On further inspection we noticed that a bottle of champagne had been left with us and a lovely hand written note from the hotel manager congratulating and welcoming us on our honeymoon - a really great personal touch that we hadnt expeceted and something i guess you wouldnt experience in many hotels! During our stay we asked the concierge staff for help and advice and were always pleasantly suprised with their level of customer service and professionalism and are definatly a credit to the hotel. The location is excellent being central to all the main points of interest and also quiet enough to ensure a good nights sleep. If we return we will certainly stay here agian!

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargE-10
Reviews.Content: There is a very upbeat atmosphere at this hotel, door staff, reception, concierge, restuarant and cleaning staff were all happy , pleasant and professional. We stayed 4 nights the rooms are lovely, and they are clean. The location is great for Circular Quay, Rocks, Shopping and site seeing. we needed a hire car dropped off at the hotel and the concierge organised it within minutes. I think that "some" of the hotel chains in Europe should send their managers to stay here to learn about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, lovely clean room and great room service”
Reviews.Author: JoContour
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Close to everything, lovely staff, good food and just a nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: fatcat46
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Raddison Blu. It is a beautiful hotel. We arrived very early in the morning and our room was not ready but they let us use the spa to take a shower and stored our luggage. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was a perfect location to walk to major attractions. The resturant food looked and smelt amazing. We were on tours where most food was included so we did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Robert250711
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were on our first vacation to Australia and we arrived at the hotel late in the evening after flying in from Thailand. We were immediately made welcome by the Concierge and the friendly front desk staff. Throughout our stay, all of the staff could not have been more helpfull and we ended up extending our time at the Radisson Blu by an extra day. The room was bright, fresh and clean and the hotel is very conveniently situated for both the tourist attractions and shopping. A hire car for our onward drive to Brisbane was arranged by the Concierge and delivered to the hotel without hassle

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Julie1505
Reviews.Content: I was at Radisson Blu Plaza on my vacation in Sydney. Everything starting from arriving and being greeted at the door to departing was one perfect and excellent experience. The courtesy and kindness of all working at the hotel is exceptional. The hotel is in a great location of walking distance to main attractions. It is beautiful, clean and... just stay there! :)

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: TheBumpkin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Radisson before and were happy with it. But this time i was a bit disappointed. Nothing major but just small things, for example, the gym equipments are geeting tired and lacks proper maintenance. Two out of three times, one of the treadmills wasnt working. They could do with one more treadmill too. Food wasnt as good. Maybe it was the room i was in this time (105), the plumbing noise was a lot more noticable. Location is still unbeatable though. Also love the Masuya Japanese restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, defiantly 5 star”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaJayne05
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely rooms. Hard to find the entrance when trying to park a car because of all the one way streets. The staff were fine, nothing great, but did their job. Lovely hotel, room and facilities. Most defiantly a 5 star hotel. However, I did a wotif mystery deal, if I had to pay the actual price per night, I don't know if I would rate it so high.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way.”
Reviews.Author: MagpieJB
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience. We stayed for 2 nights and were very impressed with the overall quality of this hotel. Immediately upon arrival we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are fantastic. Although conveniently located in the heart of the city, the rooms are quiet and private. The only criticism I have would be the prices at the hotel bar. Even for Sydney, it was quite expensive. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A couple of nights in the city”
Reviews.Author: mameshiba
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for a few days so I thought I would check out the Radisson plaza. It was a decent size room, good bathroom and a small balcony. If you crane your neck, you can catch a glimpse of the harbour bridge. The location is good for the Quay and the Rocks and isn't that far to walk up to Pitt St Mall. I liked that it was a little bit away from the busiest streets of the city. I called room service and was told there would be a 45 minute wait, but thankfully it was only 25 mins. The heated lap pool, jacuzzi, steam room and gym are nice. The staff were very friendly and attentive which made the stay just that little bit nicer. Free internet access was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a stay in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Itchy_English_Feet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights. Arriving early off a long flight, the front desk staff were extremely friendly and allocated us a room before normal check-in time. We were upgraded to a premier room, with large king size bed, seating area, flat screen tv, desk, large marble bathroom, free wi fi, ipod docking station, tea/coffee-making facilities and safe. The free newspaper outside our door every morning was a great bonus. One minor complaint was that the bed wasnâ€™t very stable and every time we sat up on it to watch tv or read and leaned against the headboard (ie the wall), it rolled away from the wall! This should be easy to fix so Iâ€™m surprised it hasnâ€™t been done. The hotel itself is in a lovely building with lots of character. The location is great - within an easy walk of The Rocks, Circular Quay, the Bridge/Opera House, Botanic Gardens and the shopping areas etc. Thereâ€™s also a bus stop nearby which takes you to Bondi Beach. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel as breakfast wasnâ€™t included in our rate, but there are plenty of nearby cafes and restaurants for breakfast/dinner. Itâ€™s the little things that made this hotel stand out â€“ the free newspaper delivered to our room every morning, the helpful doorman who gave us free umbrellas when it was raining, the extra friendly staff. We will definitely stay here when we come to Sydney again, and have already recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way.......”
Reviews.Author: Bairdbunch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a King Atrium Room. The service at this hotel was excellent. All staff knew what to do and when. The bellhop, valet and reception were just great. We arrived just before 11am for a 2pm check in and the room was ready. Very clean, spacious and well appointed rooms. Bathroom was exceptionally clean and well maintained. Block out blinds were a really nice touch and with the courtesy late check out of 1pm the sleep in was well worth it. The bar was fantastic - drinks arrived promptly and the piano playing made for a great atmosphere - we didn't want to leave for dinner. Breakfast was included in our room rate and the onsite chef was only too happy to make eggs to order. Everything was really fresh and the coffee was lovely. Location is awesome. Close to everything. Stay here - don't bother with looking for other 5 stars in Sydney. This is the one. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Bawler787
Reviews.Content: Its always difficult to find a business hotel that is in the heart of the CBD, but close to all other facilities; has an excellent restaurant; valet parking; business centre; gym and pool; and friendly staff. Well, for Sydney, the Radisson Plaza Hotel is it! Folks, it is always a great thing to find such a gem, since I am fussy about hotels I use. I was thoroughly satisfied and will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Will return to Radisson”
Reviews.Author: LynCanberraAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night prior to our cruise and absolutely loved it. Haven't stayed here before and it was a secret stay thru Need It Now - got a free upgrade which was fabulous as there were 3 of us - everything was first class, accommodation, staff, facilities.....would definately recommed staying here

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Helenewe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Sydney several times. WE've stayed at some of the best hotels in the city, but decided to try the Radisson. What a find! It has a convenient downtown location and the best concierge service in Sydney. The room was medium size but the bathroom was huge and filled with many upgardes such as a separate tub and shower and a vessel sink. There is a warm Asian feeling in the decor. But, the shining light were the concerges who gave us personal advice to make our last evening in Sydney very special. They really listened to us and even printed out some menus for us. This hotel is a bargain for downtown Sydney and a rare find....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daelc80
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel the beautiful building it is and the wonderful location. We only stayed for the night but would definetly come back and stay again. The rooms where so very spacious and the staff were all very nice and professional

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: TokyoCC
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel has everything you would expect from a good business hotel in an international city...clean and spacious room, free Wi-Fi and plug-in Internet access in the room, nice breakfast buffet, and a friendly helpful staff. The hotel is also within walking distance (about 10 minutes) of the Circular Quay and Sydney Opera House. It's quite a pleasant walk on a pretty day. The best parts of this hotel were the close proximity to the touristy areas and business district and the fabulous in-room bathroom. As much as I enjoyed my day out in the city, I was excited about getting back to the hotel to enjoy a long soak in the huge tub. The downside of this hotel was that the bed wasn't bolted to the wall, which doubled as the headboard. As a result, it was nearly impossible to sit up in bed to read or watch TV (with back resting on the wall) or to engage in any more "bed activities" without pushing the bed away from the wall and creating a huge space between the bed and wall. It was pretty annoying. On another note, here's a tip - either bring your own adapter or ask the front desk to borrow theirs. They will try to sell you one for $20 or so (it's in the bar area in the room), but they have one they can loan you for free! Don't let them fool you. Overall, a nice stay at a nice hotel. Nothing over the top fancy, but a good business hotel with all the comforts you need to enjoy your vacation or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vossy3207
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located is a fantastic position, close to the business centre of Sydne, and within walking distance of Circular Quay. The hotel is well equipped, although is proabably due for an update. The service is always friendly and professional, and the room service menu is comprehensive and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Overall beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: SouthAustraliaAussie
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we stayed at this hotel and we were not disappointed. The staff were all freindly, the the rooms were spacious, clean and what a beautiful bathroom. It was nice to have the free wi fi in the rooms. Breakfast was fabulous. There was an abundance of everything and lovely service. For us it was the perfect location for our holiday. Our new favourite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hannahadelaide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and would do so again, always a consistently high standard and in a good location too.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: alex2528
Reviews.Content: very good location we were upgraded to the business lounge and loved the club level floor, breakfast buffet was fantastic, the rooms were very clean and spacious and quiet for beeing in the middle of the city, front office staff very helpful as well, will go back again for another trip soon, and can only recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. It was very close to walk to the stunning Sydney Harbor and the Rocks (although whenever we walked back to the hotel from this area, we would pass the Marriott first and wished we had stayed there because it was just a little bit closer...). We easily cabbed to other areas like Darlinghurst. The room was a good size and was clean and comfortable, but very standard corporate hotel. It was relaxing to come home to, but wasn't particularly memorable. I did use the pool one day which was nice and relaxing too. All in all, a solid choice, comfortable, convenient but no wow factor (which you may not need).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it , nice rooms , friendly staff , great cocktails”
Reviews.Author: Geoff J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great night , found the staff to be friendly / helpful but not over the top. Rooms seemed to be recently refurbished and clean. Great cocktail bar with live music provided a nice kick start to the night out on the town. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cmccm
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Room was fantastic (on top floor). No views but room was very large, spacious and clean. Also got a later check out for the next day. Didn't eat at the hotel for either breakfast or dinner as cost was a bit much - but plenty of places around the hotel to choose from. It is also a short and easy walk from Wynyard station (taking the train from the airport was very easy and quick).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: importantinfo
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, modern, clean and quiet. Bathroom very well appointed and super-modern (Tip, leave the complimentary shower products behind, the lids cannot be secured and they'll leak terribly). Buffet breakfast was excellent. Arrive early to avoid a queue. Check in/out super-fast and staff very friendly. On arrival just after lunch, the hotel looked a little shabby as the carpet in reception looked like it needed a good vaccuum but the rest of the property was in A1 order. Bed was very comfortable. Take water, drinks & a few snack as the mini-bar is pricey. We had a fantastic time and would return in a flash. Bilsons restaurant was a great experience, the degustation dishes were a little bamboozling, even for seasoned diners like ourselves and following a full description by the wait staff. A little card served with every course detailing components of the dish would have been a welcome addition. In an excellent location on a quieter City street, The Radisson Plaza gets the thumbs up from us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Obie1960
Reviews.Content: Staff WANT to make your stay memorable, not just a job to them. Nothing too much trouble. Central to all Sydney has to offer. Rooms well presented and provisioned. Room service and Bistro wonderful. Can't wait for my next trip to Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints...a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aspiring1
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel. The room was lovely with a very comfortable bed and nice furnishings. It has a great location within easy walking distance to just about everything. We didn't eat at the hotel. Like many 5 star hotels, breakfast was outrageously priced. Fortunately, there were many places to eat nearby. The service was exceptional. I left a jacket in the lobby and was not able to come back for it until after the the end of the trip. One month later, I walked in and described it to the concierge, Ten seconds later he appeared with my jacket. I give them 5 stars for service that is both caring and responsible.

Reviews.Title: “A very well located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KT-JKLLim
Reviews.Content: Having read several good reviews on this boutique style property, we decided to check it out instead of returning to our usual hotels on George Street and Kent Street. Our check-in was swift and efficiently done. The receptionist was very cheerful and obliging with providing information. The Concierge was also most helpful in providing a free map and directions. The entrance and lobby area is not as grand as one might expect, probably due to the constraintsâ€™ of the existing structure of a restored heritage-listed building dating back to the 1800â€™s. Our luggage did not take long to arrive in the room. This was followed some minutes later by a staff from housekeeping to check the in-room fridge/bar, to ensure that the stock was complete or weâ€™d be charged for what the previous guest might have consumed. I asked about the provision of complimentary bottles of drinking water as the 1.5 liter bottle provided in the room had a $7 tag on it. He immediately said that he could provide us with a complimentary small bottle of drinking water and this came within minutes after he left. Impressive! The room has been refurbished, and everything from carpet to upholstery looked clean. The bed is made up everyday and should you want to them to change the bed linen, you need to place a card on the bed to indicate this. This is their â€˜greeningâ€™ effort to conserve the environment. Another feature not usually seen in many hotels, is the option to request for pillows (ranging from Boomerang, Contour Foam, Feather or Down, Micro-fibre or Latex Rubber), so that with your preferred pillow, you may sleep a little longer in comfort! The mattress is comfortable, although on the soft side. I rate the sleep quality as 4 plus. Not five as thereâ€™s still noise heard either from the road below, or through the thin walls? I can hear if the occupant next door turns on the water tap or whenever the toilet is flushed! The room has a small balcony but the view is not fantastic. A Travel adapter plug is provided and Internet access is free, as it should be these days in any good hotel. The toilet is rather small but this did not hamper movements. There were sufficient towels and the usual amenities like a hair drier, lighted mirror, bathroom scales, etc. provided. Thereâ€™s a bathtub and a separate glass enclosed, shower area. A window over the bathtub opens to reveal the bedroom so the entire suite has the appearance of looking bigger. As the room itself is not large, there is no proper table for boiling water, and space for making tea or coffee. This is done either at the table where the flat screen TV is positioned, or on the writing table. The air conditioner has a good thermostat and the temperature can be set to your desired level easily and effectively. The best thing about this property is without doubt its location, which is midway between Circular Quay and the Queen Victoria Building on Pitt Street. Depending on how fast you can walk, it takes between 7 to 10 minutes to get to either destination. Once in the vicinity of the QVB itâ€™s no problem to get on to the monorail to Chinatown, Paddyâ€™s Market, Darling Harbour, etc. And at the other end of Pitt Street, to Circular Quay and a short walk further to the Rocks, the Sydney Opera House, Royal Botanic Gardens, etc. Tip: Get to George Street by crossing through Hunter Street outside the Hotel, and catch the FREE shuttle bus no:555 that runs around in a loop within the CBD every ten minutes! The Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel besides having good food, a nice bar, and other facilities like their swimming pool, gym, business centre, health club, etc. also has close by, many ATMs, Banks, convenience stores, small cafes, restaurants and bars around the area. If youâ€™re not too fussy about having great views, but will be in Sydney for shopping and sightseeing, this is a good hotel to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, best service!”
Reviews.Author: stacytoby
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a flight from Adelaide at 10:30, and my room was ready! Once I had mentioned that I was doing the SMH Half Marathon the next day, the front desk gave me a 1pm checkout at no extra charge, that was amazing! The room was super clean and comfortable, and the free wifi meant that I could do some work whilst I was there too. The next morning when walking to my half marathon, everyone wished me good luck, and upon returning asked me how I went. I have stayed in countless other hotels in Sydney, but none can compare to the service I recieved at the Radisson - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elyse_mara_s2
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than check in time (10am) and went to the desk. The Clerk told us that our room wasnt ready but he would hold our bags and get the room ready by 12... which he did! the location is fantastic. Walking distance from everything! there is also a GREAT little chinese/malay restaurant where my fiance could not get enough of the laksa! it was great. The staff at the Radisson were really friendly and the service was great. Our tap handle in the room was leaking so we rang housekeeping and they came up literally 5 minutes later and fixed it. They were very appologetic about it (although it was only the washer that needed to be changed) which was nice. They gave us complementary late check out (1pm) as our flight was leaving quite late and looked after our bags after check out before we left for the airport. all in all one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in! 5 star quality!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: Debra0330
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because of the price and the Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed! When we arrived after landing very early in the am, the attentive desk representative told us that they had a king room available. We pointed out that the room was booked for two twin beds. That was not a problem at all. She told us that that room would be ready at noon. As it was 9:45am, we left our bags with the concierge and headed out to start exploring. After an early lunch, we came back, our bags were already in the room, and the concierge handed me the keys. As check-in is usually 2pm, we were thrilled, after a long flight, to get into the room. And what a room!! We opened the door and were more than pleasantly surprised. The room was HUGE! It had two queen beds, a spacious bathroom and a nice sitting area. Since the hotel is located in the Central Business District, the view out the window was of an office building, but we didn't care in the least. The room was spotless and stayed that way each time housekeeping came in to clean and straighten. The beds were more than comfortable, and the easily adjustable thermostat kept us comfortable as well. The shower head was amazing, and while I didn't try out the soaking tub, it looked really appetizing. The corridors were fairly quiet, the staff in the lobby were more than attentive every time we came in and out, and were more than happy to answer any questions we had about Sydney. I would highly, highly recommend this hotel. While not on Circular Quay, everything was in complete walking distance....maybe 7 minutes tops to the Quay, 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, feet from the major bus lines, and just two blocks away from George Street, one of the main shopping avenues. Perfect hotel! If I were to find myself back in Sydney, this is where I would be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jkl80
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel. Easy walking distance to the "Rocks", Circular Quay and the Opera House. Room was clean and comfortable. Hotel bar was a pleasant surprise and a cozy place for an evening glass of wine. Hotel breakfast buffet was very good. Free internet in the room was a really nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “A treat in CBD!”
Reviews.Author: VajVaj
Reviews.Content: In Sydney most luxury hotels are situated in skyscrapers dated from the 70Â´s. If you fancy something more rustic the Radisson is a solid option, located in an old nice stone house. (old bank I believe) We stayed in the Radisson for four nights. The location of the Radisson is unbeatable both for business and leisure. Close to the harbour and its boats, the park and walking distance also to other areas with more bars and a younger crowd. The downsides with the Radisson was that the rooms were not that spacious and the walls not soundproof. Not an actual issue thou. (even thou we stayed in one of the larger rooms on the top floor) However, I was a bit disappointed with the pool and spa area. Not necessarily the pool itself more the fact that there was always a group that kids playing in the pool. Nothing against kids, but when you want to relax and take a swim you donÂ´t want kids jumping in the pool. Overall a very pleasant stay at the Radisson, great breakfast and room service menu. Staff was very professional, specially the Japanese guy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location but you need to negotiate...”
Reviews.Author: GaneshV
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by my secretary as this was the closest to our office. I cannot complain about the location though as it is just a minute away from Wnyard station and it was another minute walk from my office. Most hotels in Sydney have the strange problem that they don't allow early check-in. Most international flights land in Sydney early morning and it was an amazing crowd in the reception all waiting for the rooms to free-up (including the flight crew). I couldn't take chance as I had an early morning meeting and so had to pre-book the room for the previous day itself. I felt this was a rip-off as I had paid over AUD 280 just to take a clean shower after my 15 hours journey from San Francisco. I cannot believe why such hotels cannot offer 24-hours checkout, which sounds very crazy to me. Having said that I have had similar experience in Singapore also - having to pay for having a early morning shower!!! The restaurent was decent - as I had seen in other Radisson hotels (the best one is in Berlin). The choice for breakfast was decent. My room rate didn't include breakfast but I had to negotiate with the front office to take it on the house. The most surprising part was my room was not serviced when I returned in the evening - they said you had checked in the morning only and so it was not serviced. Of course I had to remind them twice and got it done while I was away for dinner. Overall good place for business travellers but could be heavy on pocket if you on personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Can I Live Here Please?”
Reviews.Author: DanielleMonique
