Reviews.Content: The Radisson Plaza Hotel Sydney is fabulous. I loved every minute of my stay there. I would have liked a room with a view other than that of the internal structure of the building complex, but I guess I could also have chosen to upgrade if I was really desperate for a view. There was no waiting around for my room to be organised. It was ready upon arrival. Loved that the porter brought up my bags. It's the small things that really make you feel special. Food is a big thing for me, and the in-room dining menu was fabulous here. Of course, there are many restaurants around Sydney if you so choose to go out and dine, and the hotel does have a top restaurant. However, the hotel is a short walk from Circular Quay, so I'd recommend checking out any of the restaurants and cafÃ©s that are located there. Loved that the room was clean. You hear lots of horror stories about hotel rooms that, despite the 4 or 5 star rating of the hotel, are unacceptably dirty. No problems here though. My room was spotless, and housekeeping kept it that way for the week that I stayed. And one of the best parts of my stay, was that it is a smoke free hotel! The staff are polite and helpful, and there was no hint of condescension from any of them. They gave the impression that they genuinely were happy that I'd chosen to stay at the Radisson Plaza. I was certainly happy that I'd chosen to stay there. Again, for a 5 star hotel, it was lovely to see all manner of guests, from business people, to families, to couples, and solo travellers, and a great age range of patrons as well. The location of the hotel is perfect, with Circular Quay a short walk away, Pitt Street Mall is even closer, and for a longer walk, Darling Harbour isn't too far away. I absolutely LOVED staying here, and I highly recommend it to anyone . . . to be honest, I'd be quite happy to permanently reside at the Radisson Plaza in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandie002
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Location great. Staff were incredibly helpful and made sure we had everything we needed. Room was great. I needed the wheelchair accessible room and it was one of the best we have stayed in. Thanks - will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: pzfus
Reviews.Content: A great all round stay. From the greeting at the door to final check-out, the staff in this hotel could not have been more welcoming and obliging. The hotel is in a fantastic location, very close to most of the downtown locations especially Circular Quay, the Rocks and the Royal Botanical Gardens. In style the hotel is modern but tasteful, with some deceptively spacious public rooms. My room was very spacious and had a delightfully comfortable bed, with a spotlessly clean bathroom with a full sized bath in it. Food in the hotel was good with the prices reasonable for such a well located hotel. The facilities were good, but in tune with this being a business hotel rather than a leisure hotel. All in all it was difficult to fault this hotel, and speaking to Australian friends in Sydney is a well regarded place for visiting colleagues to stay when on short trips. In particular it would be hard to find a better located hotel without paying twice the price in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: RevellingAround
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times and will be back again. The rooms are plush and spacious. The breakfast is the best breakfast I've had at any hotel anywhere (all the standard cereals, hot breakfast, plus pancakes, waffles, pastries!). Great location for spending the weekend in the city - close to Wynyard Station and Circular Quay. A little bit pricey - but good for a treat!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5* hotel, more 4*.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelG
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other reviews, which are normally very accurate. We pre paid for 4 nights via Thos Cook; had we not, we would have checked out after 1st night. Previously we have stayed at the ShangriLa or Inter-Continental; Raddison Plaza does not begin to compare. It is an old building with secondary type double glazing, which failed to block the sound of street traffic. Self closing room doors noisely slam shut, which after midnight reverberated down corridors waking us up. Front of house staff were unhelpfull in being able to deal with complaints about the above.The entire hotel is past its sell bye date. There is no lobby area to speak of, where you can wait to meet friends. There is a huge selection of 5* hotels in Sydney, most of which are in excellent locations. You have been warned about choosing this one. We will not make the same mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson was relaxing, luxurious, clean and had extremely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Andy100
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Radisson Plaza in early April 2011. We found the bedroom & ensuite large, clean and luxurious with everything we needed. The hotel lobby was large and clean. It never felt busy nor crowded. Check in and check out were really quick and effifient. The concierge staff were extremely friendly and helpful, there were plenty of them around to help, and nothing seemed too much trouble. I note that the restaurants and things they recommeded were high end, price-wise, but I'm sure they would have widened their recommendations had we been more specific about price! Our only criticism of the hotel is that they charged 2% on credit card payments. The location is very good - walking distance from Circular Quay, the Botanic Gardens and Darling Harbour. Loads of restaurants and bars nearby once we got our bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable visit but lacking the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: MissyKafoops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for four nights as part of a surprise 40th birthday package I organised for my darling boyfriend. I booked it through WOTIF 'mystery' room deals for a five star hotel. I was a little disappointed with the room as, although it was furnished very nicely, it was a bit stark in terms of the view? There was a small window that looked out to an office block. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was nice and clean, though the bathrooms are just starting to show signs of ageing? The service was good, although I had requested a bottle of champagne to be waiting on check in. I had to ring down to reception and ask them for it, but when they realised the error, they promptly delivered it. It was a very comfortable hotel and in a fantastic location. The staff were very nice. I would definately shop around for a better deal (I've previously stayed at Sofitel for around the same rate and got a 'club room') but would be happy to return to the Raddison Plaza Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LissyL0u
Reviews.Content: We picked to stay here due to reviews from other travellors and it was all true. Were a little disappointed with the view from the room, however the rest was good. We stayed two nights and the lobby is gorgeous, staff good. The room is nice, not overly big, but bathroom good size. The location is the best part though. Really close to markets, Opera House, The Rocks, and Sydney Harbour bridge, everywhere else we went we went via taxi, even from the airport it was only $30 to hotel. I also had a facial on the Saturday afternoon which was marvellous. The buffet breakfast we were disappointed in, was $35 per head, and food was a little on the average side of things, lots of choice, taste not so good. We had a fabulous time, and also saw the terricotta warriors whilst there, great weekend all around and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, not honest to customer”
Reviews.Author: willseeyouthere
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one day, upon check in at 2pm afternoon, was told the room not ready, have to walk around for 2 hours to wait the room ready. Then when check in, hotel request to provide a credit card number for other expenses. Hotel did not provide information they will actually take $100.00 out of the card as deposit which is not acceptable as customer has the right to know if they take money off you (hotel duty manager later said it is standard policy for all the hotel, even thou we should still be notified that there will be money taken out). Later, we were allocated to a room just opposite to the lift, and whole night we heard people come in and out, kids run around and screaming. In the room there is a pad said if we want newspaper, leave it outside before 10pm and we will get newspaper next day, which also never happen, this hotel service turn to a joke and what we got only the room but no services at all. Until now, one week after I left the hotel, I still has not get my refund for that $100.00 deposit as my bank said the money has been taken out, can not get it back. Hotel said I have to contact the bank and they can not refund the money as they don't have it. Now my $100.00 been left somewhere and the only lost is me. Not recommend this hotel to everyone, be careful as they cheating customer.

Reviews.Title: “The best little 5 Star Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveller3000
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I have been staying at the Radisson for more than 10 years and it just gets better and better and better. From Wayne on the front door through to that compliamentary coffee at 7am when sitting reading the papers. I cannot fault the service and the renovations have set this hotel a world apart from all other 5 star places in Sydney CBD. The rooms are comfortable and the pillows are to die for. I hope you enjoy the stay as much as I do. Thanks to the Radisson Team. You are continously exceptionally good at what you do. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and comfortable place in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tommie53
Reviews.Content: I was lucky. Not knowing anything about Sydney, I chose the Radisson on Liverpool through Expedia because I thought it's a basic standard, but I found out it was much more. I stayed for 11 nights by myself and loved it. The staff were all very nice and friendly. The hotel is CENTRAL to everything. It was a three minute walk to Darling Harbour. I felt safe, the room was immaculate and more than I anticipated. This is not your typical European box. There was a wonderful kitchen with plenty of space. The bath was bright, clean and big. The towels were nice an thick. The A/C was very powerful, more than the room needed, but I could regulate it. The bed, a king (two twins pushed together) was adequate, not the best mattress but not the worst. Having never been to Sydney, it makes all the world of difference when you feel safe and have a comfortable home base to work from. I truly enjoyed staying in the Radisson and would definately stay there the next time. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “impressed”
Reviews.Author: mossvale
Reviews.Content: we got a wot-if mystery deal $257.00 so we stayed at the radisson plaza from the drive down the m5, ed to the motel was a breeze the valet parking team very professional and helpful to the desk for check in also polite and friendly even house keeping greeting with a hello as we found our room the room was spacious the bathroom the same every thing you would expect from a 5 star motel the only complaint would be the bed not a dream bed (rydges) great location to the rocks,circular quay etc value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very Diasppointed”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel01
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a reasonable rate for this hotel for a 1 night stay so decided to try it out and from reading all the good reviews was expecting nothing but great! Check in was smooth, staff friendly. I didnt check in until 8.30pm and ordered some room service within about 15 mins (Risotto with mushrooms and some garlic bread as I was starving. I was informed it would be 45mins.. Boy, I can cook Risotto much faster than that and its past peak dining time so thought this a bit too long. When the food was delivered, the young man commented that it had taken a long time and when I didnt comment, he said it did take long didnt it and apologised. In the meantime after ordering my room service, I opened a small bottle of the white wine in the fridge and pured into a glass and made a couple of phone calls... in between talking I took a small sip and something was not right so after I hung up, i tasted the wine and it was water... well i think it was water and am hoping it was nothing more!! So i immediately rang reception and told them and it was apologies and i wouldnt be charged for this, Upon hanging up, I looked at the contents of the glass and the bottle and there was bits of food at the bottom of the bottle and some in my glass. YUK!! I had just drunk some of this. I rang to complain and the duty manager called me back as he was busy, he offered me a replacement small bottle with his compliments and apologised. Sorry but that doesnt cut it with me, replacing a used $9 mini bar item with a complimentary $9 mini bar item... not good enough. I drank and unknown something from a minbar that should have been checked and it did make a click sound but its because whoever had bent the cap and the bit around the neck of the bottle so they rubbed together to make that sound and was on the phone so was a little distracted. The bathroom looks great, room is large but it to me is looking a little dated.. maybe just jaded after the whole wine/? thing but I will def not be staying here again. Need to add that the staff are lovely but I dont think anyone has the authrity to make a decisison re keeping a guest happy and this guest is not happy with a replacement little bottle of wine. Also Risotto was average and not hot and same with garlic bread.. All in all a fizzer for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DSB57
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel to base yourself for the Sydney sightseeing. It is close to all the attractions. Rooms are not the largest but they are OK. Would I return - yes.

Reviews.Title: “Right where you want to be in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Bee0202
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews that the hotel staff are brilliant, so helpful, and they make a big difference. The location is perfect for tourists as most attractions are a short walk away. The car can be safely parked beneath the hotel as it will not be needed until you leave. So pleasant to be able to wander around Sydney but not have too far to get back to a pleasant quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: LeLeAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after good experience with Radisson hotel in Malta. We were travelling with 2 small children age 2&3 and stayed 4 nights. When arriving there was already a baby cot waiting for our daughter, however we were able to push the beds together which we prefered as taking the baby cot away gave us more space for the stroller. Not that the rooms wouldn't be spacious enough, rather the opposite - nice spacious rooms with lovely bathroom. There was a note in the bathroom about changing the towels (if you want to have it changed - hang it on the bath, if not - hang it on the rail), so trying to save the enviroment I hang the towels on the rails, but they were always changed for clean ones. (I am not complaining about it, just wondering if I didn't get it right ;-) One one night we ordered room service - good service, lovely food. The staff was wonderfull - concierge explaining us every morning how to get there and there and giving us a map - and still the last morning he was not fed up with us. Good location - walking distance to all major attractions. We would definitelly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location.”
Reviews.Author: kev22o8
Reviews.Content: Just come back from holiday in Australia. We stayed in Sydney for 4 nights at the Radisson Plaza hotel . This was booked for us through Trailfinders Travel agents. The hotel is in the Central Business District . A great central location for all the major tourist attractions. Excellent service, spotless rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the bustle”
Reviews.Author: ammark57
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights, booked thru wotif , good price, asked for quiet room, upgraded to club floor (room only, not access to lounge, but still nice gesture), nice sized room / bathroom, and spotless. Can't stand old mushy carpets / mould in shower etc . Bit of a mix here, some of the furniture was obviously more mature, but in good condition but mixed in with newer pieces, all blended well. As with many city hotels no view, choose differently if a priority, but room was definitely quiet and bed very comfortable. Less than 5 mins walk to circular key, George street with Wyngard station 1 min , Pitt street right there. 10 mins to chinatown / darling harbour and the bussle there.Didn't do breakfast, felt $35 a bit steep, prefer brunch type meal a little later in day, there is a cafe over the road. Dinner in Bistro was nice, nothing outstanding, but after the theatre was handy, 20% off Sunday evening a sweetener. Didn't do the Bilson restaurant, didn't have time, looked interesting. Perth Visitor

Reviews.Title: “Staff are a point of difference”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneAust
Reviews.Content: I should qualify by saying this wasn't my first choice for Sydney but was delighted with the hotel. The sejour began on a positive note by quickly checking-in a couple of hours early, always appreciated. This was typical of the staff making an effort to help out throughout the stay.The hotel isn't located next door to any of the major sites but is a 10 minute stroll to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour & the POI in the CBD. The only view from the room was the street. Was provided with a map & advice on what to do/how to get there etc. after checking in. It was nice to stay in a historical (by local standards anyway) building rather than a generic, corporate one. The internet in the business centre was fast & free, and is open 24/7. The printer worked.Those four (4) things sound simple but certainly doesn't happen frequently. Room service was tasty & fast, they forgot to collect it straight away, but it was gone by the time we woke up when it was left outside the room. Breakfast is $35 (coffee inc) if not included in your rate and has a reasonable range of buffet options. All of which was enjoyable. I had an evening domestic flight, enjoyed complimentary late check late until 1pm & access to health club afterwards which allowed us to clean up after a day of sightseeing. Very accomodating of the staff to be so flexible, when I probably would have paid for the priviledge. Nice to not be nickle & dimed when on holiday. The heated lap pool is in the health club (indoors) and would be a bit tight if there was another patron swimming. As (I thought bizarrely?) is indicated on the key cards the hotel is 100% non-smoking. The cabin crew of two (2) foreign airlines were at the hotel when we were, if that is of any interest. An enjoyable option for a 2 night mid week break in Syd. This is my second positive experience with Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Our "Best" stay ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda_Ann_11
Reviews.Content: I picked the Shhh! off of this website! I could not have got a better hotel and experience!! 27 yrs of marriage and travelling... This was the "Best" place we've ever stayed at! We felt so special at the attention we recieved from any staff member that we came into contact with. The valet parking, the very welcoming reception lady, the staff that answered the phone for any request, The Concierge, Even the Doorman helped us with our directions.. The Mezzanine Level is so peaceful with the most beautiful pool, A jacuzzi and steamroom wihich was so relaxing. The King size bed, the pillows, the flat screen TV, A big bath and a shower that actually shot out hot water... We had everything we needed for a romantic getaway! Thankyou Radisson, We will see you again!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Secret Suprise”
Reviews.Author: timandvix
Reviews.Content: Booked via lastminute.com's 5 star secret deal. This was the hotel that was the secret. The room was very comfortable and simply but stylishly furnished, the bathrooms are proberbly the biggest of any Sydney hotel I've stayed in. All the staff that I came into contact with were friendly and attentive. We had theatre tickets so had to have a quick meal, the bistro had a theatre menu which was really well priced and the food was delicious. After the theatre (only 5mins walk away) we had some cocktails in the bar (again, good service and prices) and ordered some room service which was delivered very quickly. I cant comment on the breakfast or pool as we did not have time to use these facilities. I would happily stay here again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT CHOICE OF HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JAYDEEGEE
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to The Radisson Plaza in Sydney and provided a pleasing choice of accommodation for the Fifth Ashes Test 2010/11, where England , having retained The Ashes, went on to win the series 1 - 3. The S.C.G. was easily accessible via a short twenty minute Bus Ride.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free internet & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LFLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a standard room for one night, hotel is in a good location a 5 minute walk from circular quay, check in was quick and staff friendly. Room: probably smaller than the typical standard room however still plenty of space for 2 of us and 2 large and 2 small pieces of luggage. Bathroom: large, very clean with a great shower plus a separate bath with windows looking into the bedroom, different but I quite liked it â€“ there are shutters if you prefer your privacy! This hotel offers free wired internet access in all rooms, which was fantastic, we used it to skype family at home in the UK and it worked great. We didnâ€™t have breakfast or use the pool/gym so canâ€™t comment on those. We left early in the morning and upon checking out the staff asked if we wanted to take a piece of fruit or bottle of water which I thought was a nice touch. A short but good stay and if I was in Sydney again Iâ€™d definately check the rates for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Scotsman1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson Plaza for a couple of nights on our arrival in australia and a further night prior to our departure. The hotel is located in the Central Business District (CBD) which in Sydney makes it ideally placed for the Opera House; Botanical Gardens; Ferries and a wide range of restaurants and bars. The hotel was extremely comfortable and we also (using my goldpoints) made use of the Club lounge which offered a comprehensive range of drinks and canapes in the evening and an excellent breakfast, The hotel offers a small but well equiped health club including small pool as well as a pleasant bar area and restaurant. Bar prices seemed a little on the high side but we found prices high eveywhere (relatively) for food and drink.. We also utilised valet parking which I though a little expensive at $A 40 per night, especially when this was within the hotels own underground car park. Nonetheless we enjoyed our stay and found all staff to be very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: Jcradds
Reviews.Content: the Radisson is the place to stay in Sydney. Superb rooms , friendly and helpful staff. Great food, a place were you real feel like you have had a break from the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: HanD
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and hotel for a city break in Sydney. This was the best hotel we stayed at in Australia - the staff and rooms were excellent and we felt looked after and welcomed at every point during our stay. Only small improvement we could suggest would be a wider menu in the restaurant for veggies. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet042
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service - especially all the front desk staff who are happy to help with any number and type of queries. Ideally located for all attractions, but very quiet hotel, ideal for recovering from jetlag. Great pool, but can become full of children in the afternoons. Lovely breakfast, and lovely restaurant staff. Chose initally for free internet, makes a big difference. HIghly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janepad
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel. The staff where very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was well presented. The rooms where immaculate and had a very clean and comfortable feel about them. Very impressed about having a choice of pillows and it only took 5 mins at the most to bring them to our room. The position of the hotel also was excellent, we could walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lets Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: emmeh
Reviews.Content: I have to consider this hotel as a serious contender for knocking my current Sydney favourite (and I'm not telling where it is coz I don't want it all booked up by you guys) of it's perch. From the genereous valet (we were barely in the street before he took care of the car..and that is too good an oportunity to pass up in the sydney CBD) through to the relaxed yet professional (and quick-wow, I haven't seen anything like it) check in staff I knew this would be good! Elevator up to the top floors, unlock the entry way door, unlock the room door, walk down the hallway (don't worry, didn't forget to check out the marble bathroom with shower, giant mirror, 2 person deep, long spa and loads of little amenities bottles of goodness) and check out the big fluffy bed! Oh, and the balcony with the doors that open-these seem rarer and rarer in hotels the higher up on floors you get! So, in summary: awesome room. awesome service. Yep, we ate there at Bilsons and drank in the hotel bar. Believe me, it was good. But that is for another review. Get here when you can..its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff who could not be more helpful. Very central to CBD.”
Reviews.Author: enneiviv
Reviews.Content: Used to live in Sydney and I am often back in the city for business and pleasure. The Radisson is very centrally located and the rooms are clean and well presented. The room I had did not have a view and was not huge but the staff made our stay exceptional. Food was great in the bistro and you are surrounded by all Sydney has to offer. Valet parking is available and the front desk is happy to hold luggage at check out. I cannot express how lovely the conciege was, he really made us feel like it was important to him personally that we enjoyed or stay. I would recommend the hotel highly if you want to be cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Sydney break perfect”
Reviews.Author: GarryLee316
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the radisson for new year, stopping for 6 nights and whilst its not a cheap experience (but nothing is in Sydney) it was worth the money. Location was great, close to nightlife, shops and ferries. The restaurants in the hotel looked really good (we did not get to try them) and the rooms (we had just a standard one) were excellent. Massive bathroom with separate shower and bath, good sized bedroom and all keep in perfect condition. Staff were helpful when required and overall we loved our stay

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was a bit better than I expected. Great food, location, and beds. I will choose it over the four seasons in the future and at 1/3 the price of the Hyatt, it's a great deal. With its handy location in a nice historic building, and great staff, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, easy walking distance to major sites - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveHolidays21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the CBD and within walking distance of The Rocks, Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The room was large, although no view - but I didn't pay for that! We arrived late so dined in the general Bistro Fax which was good and attentive friendly staff. They also provide free internet throughout the hotel and business services - which although this should be standard most hotels still charge a small fortune. if we returned we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: dynamic-hoteliers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on the day before christmas eve, and despite it being a large hotel, it has a warm feel about it. Checked in quickly, and handed a christmas card which had been posted to the hotel immediately. The room was large, and comfortable, although we had to ask for additional pillows, which arrived swiftly. We had booked in for a meal on christmas day evening, a buffet at $50 plus $25 dollars per person for as much alcohol as you need was an extremely good deal. Being brits we looked forward to a turkey dinner(!), and found the choices met with our expectations, although for some reason there were no potatoes, but the maitre d offered to rustle some up for us, which we declined. We found, as already mentioned, that the hotel is very central to circular quay, George street and in the midst of the CBD, but it can be extremely frustrating finding it at times. It is tucked away on a corner, and the first couple of days we had difficulty navigating ourselves around the area. The concierge was extremely helpful, along with the guys on the door, and as we were there for two weeks over christmas and the new year, they quickly recognised us, which made it pleasurable. We felt like individuals, and not just another couple of guests. All in all, well worth staying, although a bit on the pricey side.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite after trying a few”
Reviews.Author: widtml
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a couple of hotels in Sydney during my stay and this one turned out to be my favorite. The hotel is located somewhat close to Circular Quay, walking distance, so location was fine. The room rate was reasonable among the hotels that I stayed in it was tended to be slightly less than the others. They had free internet which was a huge plus for me. The other hotels had a tendency to nickel-dime me (i.e. had a lot of additional charges) which I found upsetting. The rooms do not have a view of the Opera House or the bridge because its shorter than the buildings around it so if that is important to you then you will want to choose a different hotel. Overall I found this hotel met my needs at the most reasonable price so after tial and error this one became my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Free Stuff”
Reviews.Author: TyroneW
Reviews.Content: On a two-week trip in Australia, this was the only hotel we stayed at that offered free in-room wireless. Every other place we stayed wanted to charge $20-$30/night. We arrived in Sydney extremely early in the morning, and they managed to check us into our room several hours early anyway. Finally, when we got to the room later that day, we found a nice bottle of champagne waiting because we had mentioned it was our honeymoon. This place won alot of points with me for those simple things, especially after comparing it to other 5 star places we stayed in Aus.

Reviews.Title: “OK nothing special”
Reviews.Author: lazyboy52
Reviews.Content: I had asked for adjoining rooms if possible or at least close by as we were travelling with my 18 year old daughter. We arrived late in the evening from the airport to discover that the only rooms available were three or four floors apart. Now I know these things are never guaranteed, but every other hotel we booked on the trip (five) managed it, and having seen the request I would have thought they could have at least managed the same floor! I just did not get the feeling that the reception staff were that interested in our request. The hotel was probably full but the booking had been made some months before so I would have thought that something could have been done. The staff at breakfast were friendly and the breakfast fare ok but the place was pretty average really. Where it does score for me is location. It is a short walk to The Rocks and Harbour. Likewise the main shopping areas and Darling Harbour are within walking distance too yet because it is located in the CBD it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience... great staff, excellent service, modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: YahooSydney
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a quiet and relaxing Christmas eve in the city and choosing this hotel to stay at had been such a very positive experience especially to our 9 yo son. The staff were very courteous and very professional. The rooms are modern and very well-maintained. They smell great too! The indoor pool is very impressive. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angelseth
Reviews.Content: I give it 4 star in value as I found it a bit pricey for what it was...even with staff discounted rates it was still quite expensive at nearly $250/night for half price. However, Radisson was unlike other city hotels where the service was very personalised. It's a large hotel but it felt very cozy. The room was just normal but with high standard furnishings. The room is inclusive of a bar fridge, study table, queen bed, 2 bedsides and a wardrobe. Bathroom was quite large and had a bath. Loved that the bath screens were able to be opened so you can watch TV whilst having your bath. My only qualm with Radisson was the very tiny balcony and that it was a very hard hotel to find when your not from the city. Due to it being off 2 small streets that were both one-way taxi drivers had difficulty getting us there. Service, cleanliness, rooms and sleep quality were all excellent and of high quality!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bevanorma
Reviews.Content: The Sydeny Radisson Plaza started our holiday on a high note. It is in a good location, service, rooms and ameneties were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: paultry
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean and quiet room (the iPod dock is a nice touch), 24 hr business centre with free internet access, and nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality No 1 at Radisson Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Hasse57
Reviews.Content: Radisson Plaza in Sydney is not only well located and comfortable, they also have some of the best staff around. I travel extensively for business and felt incredibly welcome when checking in at this hotel, almost like coming home although I am not a regular guest. My room met all expectations and restaurant serves surprisngly good food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: YADX
Reviews.Content: This place has a terrific location, right in the center of the city. Other hotels are much more expensive, especially if located in or near the Rocks or Circular Quay, and are not necessarily as nice. Excellent room facilities, free Wifi in rooms, very good service. The only not so positive thing is that there are no views or the Harbour, but itÂ´s a walking distance to it, so it wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in Sydney, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Roger.pauline
Reviews.Content: After reading â€œFalling Starâ€™sâ€� review (26.9.10) we contemplated asking our tour operator to find us a different hotel. Weâ€™re delighted we didnâ€™t â€“ we had a superb stay. In response to Falling Star, the hotel is in the central business district so views are of â€¦ the CBD! If you want views of the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, you need a different hotel. The location is superb - very convenient. The staff are wonderful. The maitre dâ€™ at breakfast â€“ Alexander â€“ is a national treasure. He chatted to us on our first morning when weâ€™d just flown in long-haul. He then delivered our â€˜one tea, one coffeeâ€™. Next morning, he obviously recognised us & enquired after our jet lag. Afetr chatting, we then said weâ€™d have a table down the stairs near the buffet. No sooner had we collected our orange juice than our tea & coffee were delivered (without asking); this continued each morning. He made us feel like part of the family. Darren and Justin on Concierge desk are superb. Their knowledge appears limitless and nothing at all is too much trouble; this applies to all the staff we encountered. Our room was excellent â€“ spacious and, as weâ€™d specifically asked for a bathtub, we were quietly upgraded (no song & dance about it) to a spa bath. The hotel is quiet and we peaceful nights. The pool is excellent for lane swimming alhtough would not be ideal for family fun. The free in-room WiFi was appreciated. Why do not all five star hotels learn this lesson & provide free internet access instead of stinging their clients with a hefty bill for something which costs them nothing? Good for Radisson. This will be our first choice of hotel next time weâ€™re in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position....Awsome Staff, They couldn't do enough to help.....”
Reviews.Author: JellySticks
Reviews.Content: After alot of deliberating over a few Sydney Hotels, we decided to go with the cheaper 5 star option and book the Radisson Plaza and spend the difference on ourselves (Lunch at Aria). When we arrived we weren't expecting too much, The Hotel is an Old Landmark Building that has been transformed and is in a brilliant location, close to Circular Quay, The Rocks, Opera House and lots of other attractions. When we arrived, we were greeted and shown to our room very promptly and told that if we had any questions or requests, not to hesitate to ask. As we had tickets to see Wicked the musical, i thought I'd go down to reception and find out the best way to get there and also ask about some of the weekend markets that Sydney has. Unfortunately I don't remember the staff members name that served me but he was fantastic, he gave me a map and pointed me into the right direction, served us with a smile every time we passed and he seemed to be genuinely interested in how our trip was going (He even gave us a complimentary wicked cd and program) Our room was faultless, the breakfast every morning was delicious, the chef even remembered what my partners omelete was after the fist morning and with nothing more than a smile he started cooking it when we entered. I'd like to thank everyone at the Radisson for making our stay fantastic and will definitely stay there next time we visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but didn't think it was 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: EmailQueen
Reviews.Content: My best girlfriend of more than 50 years was celebrating her birthday, and we decided instead of doing the shopping at "Peters of Kensington" in one day as we did last year, that we would spend the night, enjoy dinner, and explore The Rocks as well as Peters. It was difficult finding a TWIN BED ROOM in Sydney!! As we were getting closer to our departure date, we decided we HAD TO BOOK SOMETHING...and lastminute.com.au was the best site for us with SECRET HOTELS. We found one that had twin beds, but could not guarantee them....we booked it...and hoped we would have them. We are good friends but NOT THAT GOOD. Our secret hotel was the Radisson Plaza hotel - 5 Star. Our taxi knew it, and we were greeted warmly, easy check in - and YES WE WERE ALLOCATED A TWIN ROOM. Nice size, two queen beds, views to offices, marble bathroom and separate good size shower. It has a nice small swimming pool, and we enjoyed the spa too. Buffet breakfast at $28 each was just average after paying $249 together for the room. Wasn't sure how good a deal we got. Spent $10 each way on taxis to the Rocks as my friend had a sore knee and couldn't walk - it was a fair walk. Look out for the free buses around Sydney - great. Enjoyed Peters of Kensington, and also discovered Victoria's Basement. Overall the hotel was nice, but thought more of a 4 star............

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Syam52
Reviews.Content: We came to Radisson after staying at Bondi for a Conference. What a refreshing change from the previous hotel. I arrived alone, laden with mine and my husband's luggage while he was still attending his conference. The doorman greeted me and whisked my luggage away. Check in with Michael was a dream. Whatever this gorgeous young man has should be bottled and sold to all hotels. His manner and demeanor is the perfect example of how all hotel staff should conduct themselves. Our room on the 11th floor was gorgeous, clean and comfortable. Comfortable bed, Beautiful bathroom. Superb location - admittedly, no real views, but I like to be out and about to take in the scenery, anyway. Check out was as easy as check in. Our luggage was whisked away and stored for us until it was time to leave. Nothing was too much trouble for the very excellent and efficient staff. We just couldn't fault our experience there- its the best I have had at a Sydney Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the first time as a business traveller. I highly recommend it. The room was spotless. Bathroom relatively big and had all toiletries etc that you would require. The shower was fabulous!! Bed very comfortable, room service menu was very good, with lots of options and food delivered was good, though not as hot as should have been. The window was high up the wall, so I couldnt see out without standing on tip toe, but it actually was unusual and made me feel like I was in a New York loft. I didnt consider it a negative. The room was decorated nicely and not in a cliched hotel way. The cable TV had lots of options. I should say I was in one of the cheaper rooms as the hotel was quite heavily booked. Staff were polite and professional. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others. The hallways were quiet too and my sleep was not disturbed. Hotel is also right near Wynard station which is on the train city circle line.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business, but not for leisure”
Reviews.Author: Winetraveler78
Reviews.Content: Location is great, service is good and the rooms are ok (not much view). The hotel is for business people only. Everyone is all in the suits and i have not seen anyone that are here to relax and enjoy. Seems like the staff is used to suits as well and not shorts and t-shirts. Really like the hotel but would consider somewhere with a view the next time.... Free internet is a plus!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous wheelchair friendly hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Neeeeeeeena
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we panicked because all we saw was stairs but there was a wheelchair lift to get up to reception. Check in was quick and easy. The bell boy and concierge were fantastic with the luggage, helping with the wheelchair and parking the car. The room was very big and spacious - lots of room to get around in a wheelchair. The bed was devine and there was a pillow menu to select your desired pillows!! Best sleep ever! Very quiet hotel which was great so we could finally relax on our holiday. The bathroom was a big flat shower room with plenty of space. The toilet could have been a little lower for use with a shower chair. Had a couple of great cocktails at the bar and the barman was only too happy to help us with our desired cxocktails which weren't on the menu! Since it was our anniversary we were pleasantly surprised with a bottle of bubbly and choc covered strawberries the day we arrived. A very nice touch!! Will definately stay here again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Searene10
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable stay which was assisted by the great staff member at reception who, as we arrived early (7.00 am) said he will trty and get us a room at around 10.00. At about 10.20 am, we were sitting in the lobby, he called me over adn said the room was ready - fantastic as we had been on the 'red-eye' from Perth, He was good. Room service was good with great food. Location si excellent just down frfom Goerge street adn the WYnyard Station and close to trhe rocks. Only problem was on checkout. The concierge said we could do the quick checkout instead of waiting in the queue which we did. When the bill arrived we were charged for the minibar which we doid not use. Even brought our own Coca Cola?? Will be contacting them about that

Reviews.Title: “Bright at night”
Reviews.Author: berlin_style
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Plaza Hotel in Sydney, Australia is convenient located in the heart of the city, only a short hop from downtown business and shopping streets. We stayed in an atrium room, which faces a grey high wall. We were lucky as given a room on a high floor, as we got some natural light in the room; nevertheless, we needed additional electric light also during noon time. But the light I misses during daytime was compensated in the night, because of a lot off small light from TV etc and from the floor shining under the door. There is also a permanent noise from outside the window, AC? What I really hate are beds with wheels but without a wheel stop. Watching TV with your back on the head end of the beds causes rolling away....... Bathroom is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disgrace - avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: FemaleLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived with high hopes for our holiday in Sydney, Australia. Being advertised as a boutique, 5 star hotel, we thought we would treat ourselves to a bit of luxury and a room with a view. We paid a little bit extra for it but thought it would be well worth the money. How we were wrong. Reception kindly allocated us the wrong room. How disappointed we were to open the doors into a dark and shifty room, only a few floors up and with one small window overlooking the hotel wall. No natural light whatsoever or the 'premier view'. We went down to reception immediately to ask them to check our booking and were hastily told 'you get you pay for'. An upgrade would incur a further 100 pounds a night. We resigned ourselves to the fact that Australian hotels were rubbish. It wasn't until halfway through our stay that my husband had the foresight to double check the hotel literature and realised we HAD been allocated the wrong room. We were finally moved to the correct room on the Saturday night, a great time to have to pack up your belongings and shift. Breakfast was offered by way of compensation but with only a few days left and two early starts, this was a feeble apology and one of which we could barely partake. No financial compensation foer the money we had missed out on by being allocated the wrong and chearper room. To add insult to injury, the housekeeping is sporadic, the complimentary water and newspaper appears when it feels like it, food orders are inaccurate and expect someone else's bill to be delivered to your room. All in all, a truly 5 star experience. This is the last time I will be staying at a Radisson. Their customer service is an absolute disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dankins
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay. Staff are great, decor after their refurbishment is lovely. My room is spacious - bed is massive and being short I feel like I have to take a running leap at it (willingly as it's soooo comfortable). I wish I could remember the name of the commissionaire (? - doorman with top hat who amongst other things hails the taxis) - when I was staying 6 & 7 October, great staff member. Victor the chief concierge was charming. Love the complimentary internet (which I am using now). Great for leisure and business. Easy walk to so many shops, restaurants, bars and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Falling Star”
Reviews.Author: ProblemSolver255063
Reviews.Content: I used to be a regular at the Radisson but I don't think I'll ever go back. I travel to Sydney regularly and appricate that if you stay in a cheap hotel that you will recieve bad service, that is why I pay the $400+ per night at the radisson. On my last trip, I booked a car through the concierge (Victor?) for an airport pick up. It didn't arrive, so I called the hotel who said that no car had been booked and that if I wanted one I would have to wait 2 hours. No thanks, plenty of other limo companys at the airport. When I got to the Hotel, the concierge (short, lebanese man) yelled at me and said if I didn't want a car I shouldn't have booked one. He said he would charge me anyway. Having arrived at 11am, I was not expecting a room to be ready for me so I asked to leave my bags at the hotel until I could check in at 2pm. I went to the hotel resturant bistro-fax for lunch with a client and was interupted by the hotel "something-or-other" manager Bernie. I have met him before but he introduces himself everytime he is on. Kinda cute watching him pretend we are old friends but not while I'm with a client. He has all the grace on a train wreck. I came back to the reception desk at 1:45pm and was told by a skinny white russian kid that my room now won't be ready till about 4 or 5pm. Great. I asked if I could get something out of my bags, to which I was told that they had already been delivered to my room?? By the time they were found, about (30 minutes) the concierge had come over to gloat that he had indeed charged me for the hire car that didn't turn up and yelled something about how having golden keys made him some sort of demi-god. With that in mind, when my bags were found, I put them in a cab, took them round the corner to the intercontinental and checked in ($120 per night cheaper!) They even gave me a harbour view room! Much better than looking at a 1970's bank from the radisson. I only needed to wait 15 minutes for a room there, and there limo company turns up on time. I used to like the Radisson, but has fallen in service, risen in cost and is now a dissapointment. I would have considered going back if I got a call from my pretend friend Bernie, but instead I got a call from someone called Abdullah, saying I owed $50 on the minibar plus a late check out fee for a room I never saw.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small room for money”
Reviews.Author: mercslk69
Reviews.Content: We had booked in advance with the hotel . The room was very small and no view, room 120 .Had problems with the door card keys and it took 3 trips to reception to get in. The hotel is clean and modern but at $240 a night was a lot. Went to a friends room who was on his own paid $184 a night 2 queen beds and spar bath.So ask at reception when booking what you get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: siienka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with my partner to attend the Good Food & Wine show. Recieved no upgrade or gifts when our anniversary was mentioned. Was a bit dissapointed with this seeing the hotel is currently undergoing renovations & there were plenty of rooms available that night. Our room was very small & standard with no view. Expected something better for our first time in a 5 star hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable though & the bathroom delightful & elegant. Location isn't great if staying for the weekend as it is quiet & in the business district part of town (Wynyard). We were offered a free upgrade for our next stay after I filled out a feedback form so their service does get a gold star for that. Not sure if I would like to return just yet though.. maybe just for the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Top class Hotel-fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: ingrid074
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights, and it was a fantastic experience. The staff live and breathe customer service, and thanks to concierge Wayne who did a fantastic job in obtaining tickets for a very important Rugby League match for us. The Hotel is in an ideal location, as just outside bustle of Harbour but only 5 min walk to Harbour/Opera house etc. Our room was gorgeous with gigantic bed, spacious, great bathroom, lots of space to put suitcases etc. Gym facilities good. We did not eat in Hotel, as we were travelling so much in the day time, getting early ferries etc. However, there are so many coffee shops outside and great bars and cafes. Highly recommend the Hotel, and would most definitley recommend it to anyone staying in Sydney and wanting to be near all major sights. Almost 10 out of 10 !!!

Reviews.Title: “It's Great”
Reviews.Author: Out0ft0wner
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. The staff are lovely, the room and bathroom (Premier) were very attractive and a very comfortable bed. The rooms are well-cleaned and the room service is good. The free internet is wonderful and should be available everywhere, especially where people are paying for 5 star accommodation. I was both with my partner and solo duing my stay and i found it all to be suberb. The hotel is very close to the shops and also to Circular Quay and don't miss the wonderful Rocks markets on Saturday and Sunday morning. I hope to come back to the Radisson very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as one might expect”
Reviews.Author: Runninguy1011
Reviews.Content: This is a top end hotel and the room rates reflect that. On the plus side, it is in a great location, is modern, has a nice gym and pool, the staff gave good service, and its looks nice from the outside. On the minus side, the hallways should have been monitored and cleaned more frequently (e.g noone wants to look at other people's room service left- overs) and my major gripe was the noise from the hallways into the room. My room even had a set of earplugs that I did not expect to require. There was a lot of noise from people's voices and doors slamming in the night. This was particularly bad on the Saturday night but noise was an issue every night of our 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Savy_Sydney_Lily
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this hotel. I've stayed here a few times. Having moved out of Sydney for work, i love indulging whenever i get back home, by staying in a CBD hotel. I've stayed at a few different hotels this year, however this piece of heaven is my favourite place to rest and unwind in Sydney! Perfection from beginning to end - always an easy and quick check in. The valet staff are so polite, as are the check in staff and housekeeping. The staff here are so genuinely nice - i know people get paid to be pleasant, particularly in customer service type industries, but the staff at the Radisson always come across as happy in their jobs and very lovely people. I've stayed in other Sydney hotels where you barely get a smile. That is why i always rave about this hotel to friends and work colleagues (we all travel a lot, so i always recommend the Radisson Plaza Sydney for a 100% fantastic stay!). Enough of the gushing - to practicalities. The rooms are always so immaculate, and the decor very pleasant. The beds are like beds for a princess (or prince) - so high and comfy - being an occasional insomniac, i always fall straight to sleep without waking during the night. On my recent stay, as previously, there weren't any problems with noise from outside. The room service menu is by FAR the best of any hotel! I highly recommend the spaghetti wagyu beef bolognaise as a late night treat - the best pasta meal ever, I always doze comfortably off to sleep every time. The hotel offers so many services such as internet, newspaper delivery in the morning, in room massage (divine!), access to your account via the tv (so if you're on a budget, its easy to keep on top of hotel expenses - very handy) with the benefit of Bilson's restaurant just downstairs. The location itself is perfect, and close to all the touristy sights, which as someone born and raised in Sydney, i now get a kick out of participating in, now that work has kept me away. The vibrancy of the city is right at your doorstep! I recently took a weekend away on my own as a stress reliever and to recharge my health, and ive got to say, the stay was better than any health spa or counselling session could ever be! ;o) Yes, the hotel can be pricey, but the experience is so worth the expense. PERFECTION! BLISS! INDULGENT! UNPRETENTIOUS!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Auntiehairy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel- first impressions were fantastic - after all, who doesnt like men in top hats and tails opening doors for you? Beautiful building - orinially housed a newpaper print, and then a bank.. has retained a lot of its heritage. gorgeous entrance and impeccable service. On arrival, we were informed we had been upgraded to a spa suite (I had informed the hotel our stay was for a special celabration) on the 7th floor. The room - The suite was stunning - a corner room with a massive bed, workstation and lounge area.. down the seperate hallway was the toliet and possibly the most beautiful bathroom i have ever seen. Also waiting for us was a bottle of sparkling wine on ice and some chocolate dipped strawberries , with a note congratulating us :D The suite was tastefully decorated The bed was massive, extremely comfortable and had a pillow menu (which made me giggle). Facilities/service- we checked out the pool/gym area - didnt use it, but it looked gorgeous. Didnt eat in (as we were on a really tight budget) cannot fault service - concierge staff very friendly, turndown service made me giggle again at the opulence, Ingred (the customer service officer?) went above and beyond to make our stay special Location- gorgeous spot - just out of the bustle of the main shopping precint, but close to everything. 5 minute, if that, walk to the rocks (ferries, harbour bridge, opera house), probably same distance to pitt st mall.. we walked everywhere, and were buggered at the end, but we did a couple of loops of the city, and to oxford st and back to see one of Australia's best bands - My Future Lies :) there's plenty of budget food places close by, and coffee. Overall, could not recommend this highly enough to others, and will return ourselves as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “A Beutiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Amandalin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my Birthday and i couldnt of picked a better place. I have stayed here before and the service was just as good. Because it was my Birthday room service bought up a bottle of wine and wished me happy birthday. All the staff here are so friendly always saying hello and are so helpful. Breakfast was lovely our waiter sat us down and bought us a pot of tea and coffee straight away. Our room was perfect we had a premier room and the bath had shutters that opened up so you could see into the bed room. The bed was so compfy and everything was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel with very attentive staff and free wi-fi.”
Reviews.Author: Leightwaves
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfortable, the sheets luxurious and the room quiet.The hotel was undergoing some renovations and presumably replacing some furniture as my desk chair was on it's last legs. Room service food was very good and seemed fast. Almost all staff extremely friendly and efficient. Room was a bit dark. Decent length heated pool was very handy. Terribly street parking availability for anyone visiting. Virtually no street parking ever so option is $40 in lot nearby. Great wi-fi at no additional cost. Walk to Botanical Gardens. Good coffee shops close by. Great doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler22
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Radisson. Location was great as subway station is just couple of blocks from the hotel. Circular Quay is also within walking distance. The room was very clean and beds were very comfortable. We got the spa room which is a little bit larger than a regular room. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Business centre located on floor 6th offers free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent package and service”
Reviews.Author: Bridgeclimber
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of "The Wicked Package" for a Saturday evening overnight City stay and were very impressed with the efficient, friendly check-in procedure, the Premium room, "Wicked" dessert, plus Breakfast served in the room and the overall positive attitude of all the staff we met. It was great value and we would highly recommend the hotel for a City break, as such a handy location between Circular Quay/The Rocks and the main department stores. Free internet access was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: robsta01
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9am and our room was ready straight away. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Room was very nice. All of our meals in the hotel were very nice (particularly the club sandwiches) and room service was on time every time. Internet connection was easy and being able to check your hotel account on the T.V whenever you wanted was very convenient. The Hotel is very well placed and it only took 5 minutes to walk to the opera house and circular quays etc. Our stay was perfect from the moment we arrived untill the moment we left 3 days later and we recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Sydney. We look forward to returning to the Radisson Plaza in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JasonFJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location virtually next to the Botanical Gardens and Opera House, and a short walk to Queen St Mall and the Manly ferry was an unexpected bonus. The room was quite decent. Australian customer service isn't exactly reknown, but the staff at Radisson were very professional and to this day I remember the asian floor manager constantly zipping around attending to guests checking in and out: excellent. The only potential downside to the trip was the way they cleareed the breakfast buffet militantly 10 minutes before closing: fortunately the floor manageress arranged for fresh omelet and sausages to be prepared and single handedly turned what could have been a negative review into a positive. The only feedback I'd give the hotel would be to not charge for a cappercino at breakfast - the profit isn't worth the guest dismay.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: floydbloke
Reviews.Content: Great service, helpful staff. Bit noisy having a streetside room but hey, it's a central city hotel, great location near Darling Harbour, Paddy's market and Chinatown. Attended a conference, lunches were great, breakfast OK. Nice pool, a bit short. Good size room, decor nice, a bit dated maybe. Useless shower, water pressure good but it's a two-tap rather than a proper mixer which always makes it impossible to get the temp how you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: AngelaJ76
Reviews.Content: We spent a little more than we usually would on this room, but it was well worth it. Our room was huge, had a great spa bath and shower, comfortable bed, office desk for checking emails. Proximity to Circular Quay and the Botanical Gardens was great. Staff were polite and obliging. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal CBD hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmurphAustralia
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with an internal facing room to courtyard. High ceiling and well presented room made for a wonderfully quiet stay. Really efficient checkin in and check out - no time wasting adn very considerate. Value for money it kills most of the other CBD hotel in Sydney. Great position in the top end of town. I will happily send all our staff there and avoid more expensive, less deserving options.

Reviews.Title: “can not fault it”
Reviews.Author: horsyc
Reviews.Content: Usually we can fault the hotel but not this one - it's good location and reasonable price. Staff are so friendly - it's big ,but like a boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay...”
Reviews.Author: rosecoloredclouds
Reviews.Content: I stayed with the Radisson Plaza Hotel Sydney for about 3 weeks in February. Room: My room was a spacious Plaza Club Room. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I was so in love with the pillows that at one point, I wanted to purchase them. Another feature that I really loved was the shuttered window in the bathroom which allowed me to look into the room/TV while taking a relaxing bubble bath. The Plaza Club room included complimentary access to the Radisson Plaza Club Lounge where I had my breakfast every morning. Breakfast was of reasonable standards and refreshments were also provided throughout the day. Complimentary internet access and room turn-down service were also included. Location: The hotel is about 5 minutes walk away from the nearest subway station - Wynyard. There is a bookstore opposite the hotel and various dinning options nearby. Service: The hotel staff (check-in, concierge, housekeeping, porter, etc) were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: chrisp64
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, right in the heart of Sydney; within walking distance to everything. Great gym and lap pool. Huge bed and the little extras in the bathroom. I like the way the window above the bath opened into the room. Free internet access. Nice boutique hotel. The Bluestone Cafe across the road is excellent for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dont compare with Asia hotels”
Reviews.Author: keclare
Reviews.Content: Was supposed to stay in this hotel for 3 weeks but decided to cut short my stay. Even though it was corporate rate but this looks more like a hotel I would go to on a budget leisure tour in sydney. The business centre is very private and good. The location is superb for a business hotel in the centre of CBD, can walk to Chinatown or to Circular Quay anytime. Staff is also very friendly and everyone at the desk but this is not something expected of a 4 or 5 star hotel and here are some of the reasons why. - No complimentary water - Toothbrush, toothpaste [have to ask every 3 days], brush, slippers, razors have to ask when needed. - They don't throw newspapers and don't tidy the tables and basin area neatly all the time [even didn't washed the cups once] - Don't always replace stationery like papers, and sometimes they don't throw all the rubbish away like the laundry box that comes with the lingerie - Food is not as great [based on feedback from the rest, one order takes 40 minutes to come]. Beef patty was served instead when beef steak was ordered. - Housekeeping do not adhere to the "do not disturb" signs - Housekeeping and laundry are seperate and if we call for laundry late nights, they will say 'they have left for the day' and we have to call tomorrow morning - Laundry don't get picked up during cleaning in the day and we have to call the next day or they will leave a msg that they note we have laundry but we only got the msg at the end of the day after work. So I missed the first day cut off time for pressing and have to do ironing myself. - When i put the iron back to the cupboard, they don't help to roll wires back up neatly and nicely. Hair-dryer when taken out will be left there and i have to put it back to the cupboard myself. - Guess it gets worse when the bed starts sinking during my 2nd week there. I brought the attention to reception but not sure if they have responded as they didn't track my queries/requests until i repeately asked. - Actually the room is really small and simple fuss free kind, bare minimal, no extra couches and no views.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & well located”
Reviews.Author: Gl0balTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very good well located business hotel with efficient staff. Not many dining options close by outside of business hours Spacious rooms with great bathrooms. Don't expect great views though!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: divebr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. As most Radisson Hotels, rooms are clean, large and quiet. Location is absolutely fantastic and staff is very helpful whenever needed. The hotel was redoing the lobby and even so they made sure guests had an alternative entrance and there was no disruption whatsoever. I had no problems during my stay and will definitely come back as this is an excellent hotel for any standard,. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wishing0602
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service was wonderful. We booked via Wotif and were made to feel as special as the Hotel booked guests> The location of the Hotel is possibly the best in Sydney. Stroll to shops, botanic Gardens and the rocks. (the much nicer end of town!) Rooms were large for a twin and big bathrooms for 2 ladies to share! Very nice decor and the choice of pillows was a surprise. Considering the renovations, we didnt experience any noice or disruptions. Drinks in the make shift bar on Friday night was just as nice. Didnt get a chance to try the Restaurant as we were meeting friends. The staff were just lovely. Final plus was returning from our last morning walk and the lovely bell boy offered us a bottle of water!! Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel but recent No Smoking policy disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DebMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We made an online booking on the 7th of May for our stay from the 20th of June through to the 23rd June. We specifically booked a room on the Smoking floor. I also confirmed with the Hotel by phone that there was in fact a smoking floor. Upon arriving at the Hotel on the 20th of June, 2010 I was extremely annoyed to discover that the whole Hotel was now non smoking however, no one from the Hotel thought to advise us prior to our arrival. I spoke to the Duty Manager and expressed my disappointment at not being notified prior to our arrival. To his credit, the Duty Manager provided us with complimentary passes to the Plaza Club Lounge where we were able to have breakfasts in the morning and cocktails in the evening. We are grateful to the Duty Manager for his help. Our hotel room was fine. It was clean and inviting. The location of the Hotel is excellent. Close to the big Department stores and City shopping. But what really sets this Hotel apart from some others is the wonderful staff. The Doormen, the Porters, the Inhouse Dining staff, Housekeeping and the staff on the 10th Floor are brilliant. They are all so helpful and so friendly. The Doormen that we dealt with were extremely helpful and did their utmost to make sure we had a great stay. Even though we were initially disappointed at not being notified about the "no smoking" policy before we arrived, we would be happy to once again stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and great Sydney location”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: We searched multiple web sites for Sydney city hotels with some sort of value for money, also with a reasonable location. The Tripadvisor reviews were promising for the Radisson Plaza, so we booked a week as their cancellation policy allowed for any last minute hiccups. We were not disappointed. The location is great, a few blocks from Circular Quay, a 5 minute walk to The Rocks area, a short walk to the Botanical gardens, 2 minutes to Wynyard train station and lots of great cafes and restaurants nearby. We were given a room on the top floor. It had no views but this meant we had no outside noise at all. The room was extremely comfortable and quiet as the clientele are mainly business people, who probably need their sleep. The staff were great in every way. We would love to go back after the ground floor refurb. is completed in August as I imagine it would have a grand feel in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business”
Reviews.Author: alkira_roaming
Reviews.Content: Thanks to our corporate travel arrangements, I usually stay at The Radisson when in Sydney for business. It is a clean, comfortable, efficient hotel - perfectly pleasant, but unremarkable. Most room are reasonably spacious, with very good beds, and functional areas for working. I always seem to end up with an internal room, though really there are no 'views' from the hotel anyway, apart from standard city streets. It is well located in the CBD, a few blocks away from the harbour. If you are in Sydney or business, and can manage a good rate, this is a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, like the desks!”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really nice and have good lighting. Especially liked the iPhone/iPod dock/radio. The bathroom has a separate shower and bath. Lobby was getting renovated at the time i stayed there ( i think )

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterMMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I really like the Radisson Plaza. It is what it is and it does it well. The Atrium Rooms aren't the best, but if you are looking for a good sized, well appointed room and aren't fussed about the view this is a good room. The Deluxe Rooms with balconies are much nicer. Not a big fan of the toiletries. The Club feels like a bit of an after thought. While in a very interesting part of the hotel (in the original Cupola), the layout is messy and it feels cramped. Breakfast is nice and only $25 which is good for a 4.5-5 Star Hotel. Although espresso coffees are $4.85 on top of that. Porters are very friendly and I never seem to wait long at reception. The hotel opened in time for the Olympics in 2000 and hasn't hard a full refurb since, which is surprising as it in very good condition. Having said that the decor could be modernised and I believe the hotel is starting a renovation soon (during 2010). All rooms have flat screen TVs (as they should in 2010), although no way to connect laptops etc.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend to my best friend”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights when in Sydney for business, and had a room on the 8th floor. I am not sure about their room types but I think I got one 1 up from the most basic. the room was really large! Miles of room. the same for the bathroom - HUGE. OK - so they have the basics - bed, bedsides, desk and chair, fridge/minibar cabinet with flat screen TV, lounge chair and coffee table. the bathroom had a full sized tub and separate shower. All the usual toiletries - although I am still wondering how, according to the packaging, they make a shower cap "luxury" and how they do "deluxe sanitary bags"? There was also a vanity kit, sewing kit and shoe shine. waffle weave bathrobes were very nice, and a pillow menu (so I changed my pillow). Bathroom does have one of those magnifying "shaving" mirrors, and this was the only flaw in the room - its light was broken.. I used the gym which was as good as they come. treadies, stairclimbers, bikes, rowers, one of those multi-function pull down machines and free weights. They also have an indoor pool. Dinner room service was slow (they warned me on ordering) and was decent normal serving cooked well - although a tad expensive. I ate dinner in the bistro which was very good - full service, very good wait staff, food quite good - again just a tad on the expensive side. I travel with my work colleague who is in a wheelchair and they gave us good attentive, helpful service when arriving at the valet, with our bags, getting him in the chair lift etc. The only problem he had was that although the room was wheel chair accessible, housekeeping then treated the room like any other - so the toiletries and water glasses were placed up high out of reach on a shelf, the adjustable shower head was up high at standing height, the bed was too high for him, the wardrobes were normal so he couldn;t hang his clothes, the robes were hanging so he couldn't get them down, the door was a normal heavy door he couldn't push, light switches were up high etc etc BUT - the rooms were spotlessly clean, were obviously recently refurbished with new tiles, fabrics, carpet, easy a/c controls - and a great price - I rang around and it was the cheapest out of 6 I tried. Free newspaper and free internet (including wifi). Valet parking $38/night so I had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED - Good location - Heaven help you if you have a problem -”
Reviews.Author: andrewhrogers
Reviews.Content: Hi, Overall its a hotel - nothing spectacular, but for the rate I was paying it wasn't too bad. That said - Whilst staying in the city I had my wallet stolen. Well... This is where it all starts. I reported the lost wallet and room key to the front desk, and was told that even though I had lost my wallet I was able to extend my stay by one night and charge incidentals to my room so I could sort out the wallet and replacement card on Monday. Not a problem - To me - that is good customer service. I've provided details on check in, you have my address etc etc, not an issue. Great, I went back and relaxed and did some work on Sunday whilst whiling away the time waiting to replace the card on Monday.... Well.. Sunday comes around and Ben (the duty manager at the time) appears at the door with another guy, they come in - quiz me about the stolen wallet and what not - generally skeptical (even though I was able to provide the police report number and bank cancellation number) and not providing what I would consider customer service. Ben then proceeds to tell me that basically he couldn't make a call and had to check that the on duty manager that I spoke to had made the right decision etc. Anyways - long story short, I get a phone call saying I have an hour to leave the hotel. So. No money due to the stolen wallet, no real means to return to where I am staying during the week whilst in Sydney and a complete reversal of a verbal agreement existing between the hotel management and myself. - To top it off, once I worked out how to get home etc etc The next day they call me AT WORK (Nikita was the one that rang) and say " you need to settle this by wed or we'll be taking further action" - Given that NONE of this was my fault, I have to say, being treated like a common criminal and not someone who paid to stay there leads me to say that I WOULD NOT recommend this hotel to people. Their management change their minds, break agreements and the treatment that I received was not at all to a satisfactory level. I work in Sydney during the week and live in QLD. On the weekend I tend to Stay in the city, I earn over $150k but perhaps it is because I am 30 and not 60 that I received this treatment, either way they have lost one customer, that is for certain... Oh, and the amount that they are willing to threaten to "take things further"... A whole $177.50. Given that I am interstate this week I daresay that they will "take things further" - Not happy at all. I will say that despite Ben and Nikita - there are some good staff. Props to Sarge in in room dining and the night on duty manager that was willing to help me and could see that I could sort everything out if I was able to stay. Ben on the other hand should not be in client facing hospitality - Perhaps more suited to corporate bean counting.

Reviews.Title: “Would probably not stay here again for leisure trips”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been to Sydney several times. On previous trips I've stayed at the Four Seasons or Shangri La. Since I'm GoldPointsPlus Elite for the first time, I figured I would give the Radisson a try. Based on the GoldPoints Plus website and other reviews here, I figured at the very least I would be upgraded and get a little more value. Nope. No upgrade at all or any other recognition of elite status.
