That's fine, but I'm now not going to be staying in any more Radisson properties this year since, if status doesn't mean anything, what's the point in adding more room nights to my account? As to the hotel, it's nice. I personally prefer to be closer to the Rocks and Circular Quay, so location was a little disappointing, but it's all walkable - just an extra 10 minutes. It is closer to Darling Harbor, though. The service was great. Easy check in and check out. At one point I entered the hotel with my daughter asleep in my arms and the doorman not only let us into the elevator, he went with us to let us into the room as well. Very cool. Concierge was very knowledgeable. The room was small but clean. Bed was comfortable. Biggest drawback was the poor TV selection - there are lots of children's channels in Australia, but you wouldn't know it at the Radisson. When awake at 4am with a jetlagged 4 year old, just one children's channel would have come in very handy! The free internet was decent. For business, absolutely stay here. For personal trips in the future, I'll probably stay at the Shangri La again. Bigger rooms with better views, better tv and better location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Ladidoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in Sydney, stopping over for a trip to New Zealand. Sure the hotel wasn't huge, however this is down town Sydney and the room met our needs perfectly. It was comfortable and well maintained (don't mind if the decor is a bit of date, but hate it when a five star hotel is shabby). The bed and pillows were great, and the bath for those of you who bathe good too. Room service was okay but not so good if you are on a diet or at least trying to be vaguely healthy. Check out and in was easy, although I can see how it might be problematic when busy (small lobby). Had mixed feelings about staying here, as I have stayed in some Radisson's elsewhere in Australia that are just awful. The same cannot be said for this Radisson and I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: dinkey1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Circular Quey early on Good Friday morning. Rang the hotel to ask if we could check in early, this was no problem. Upgraded to an executive room for 65AU$ this inluded breakfast and a two hour cocktail package. Walked to hotel with cases took less than ten minutes. Breakfast was good, alhtough we could eat in the small executive lounge we prefered the main resteraunt as more choice. The cocktail package was between 1800-2000 weekdays and 1730-1930 weekends. Unfortunatley, we found the earlier time unsuitable as most people in the hotel were tourists and out sightseeing or on trips arriving back to the hotel late. (This may be the hotels idea as not to open too many bottles of spirit) However, apart from this the hotel was in a great area, less than 10mins from Circular Quay and the gateway to all transport, rail, ferries and buses. We enjoyed wandering around the Rocks and browsing the market and a Guiness or two in the Irish Bars. The staff were friendly and could not do enough for us. The room was not to large but clean, modern and comfortable. A large bathtub and walk in shower. Only one problem bathrobes come in one size only extra small. On returning home I recieved a questionaire from the group, having filled this in and suggested larger bathrobes I had a reply from the manager imediatley advising that this had been forwarded to housekeeping. Nice to think that the manager actually does read the reviews. Free internet access came in handy. All in all I would definatley stay at the Raddison Plaza if I were to visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - first class accommodation 5 minutes walk from the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: tomlDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Plaza in Sydney for 14 nights whilst visiting our son. This is an absolutely brilliant hotel, located in central business district 5 minutes walk from all the attractions. The advantage to being in the CBD is that there is no traffic noise out of business hours. This is so close to everything there is no need for taxis and we felt really safe even when walking back to the hotel late at night. We had a large two double bedded with room with really comfortable beds and a great bathroom with separate walk in shower. Shower gel and other toiletries replaced every day and some really nice personal touches of a gift of some very up market bath products as we were on an extended stay and a chocolate bunny as we were there over Easter. All the staff are friendly, efficient and very approachable. The hotel seems to be smaller that many others in the area, but with all the same amenities - pool, health and beauty facilities, restaurant and bar. It is in a really interesting old building which once housed a Sydney newspaper. One of the key advantages to this hotel - and don't be put off by this - is that it seems to be primarily used by business people. This means that it is quiet (you haven't got lots of comings and goings over night) and the excellent sound insulation means that you can't hear what is going on in the next room. If we were looking to go back to Sydney we would certainly use this hotel and on the basis of our experience will be looking to use Radisson Hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: maryado
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as I had a work function in the city.Normally stay at the Sheraton on the Park but booked here as it was the only hotel available on the same night of the Mardi Gras in Sydney. It was in a good location.Close to the harbour.The lobby was nice but small and so was the room for that matter.Simple and not too many frills but I like frills at a 5star hotel.Service was very good by reception , restaurant and conceige. PArking is expensive.Breakfast is good value , but I have had better buffet breakfast. I would stay here again if I was on a budget and wanted 5star , although I wonder who rates hotels as this is not really a 5star hotel , probably 4.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: yunjun
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at Raddison Hotel on March. The location was great. Easy access to the Opera house, Sydney town hall, and so on. The room was very clean with a huge bathroom. Our kids were very happy to swim in the pool at night. I thought this was one of the best hotels in Australia until a few weeks later when I found out that I was charged with the service that I didn't get. I might stay at Raddison again, but I will be careful with the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandydesert
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ideal base for Sydney. The rooms were spacious, contemporary but comfortable and clean and all staff including the concierge were really helpful. Breakfast was great as it was buffet style with lots of choice. Easy access to sightseeing in Sydney. We had no complaints and we'd definitely not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cjaz
Reviews.Content: The consierge..........WOW, what a service. Just experiencing the Concierge is worth every penny spent. This group of Gentlemen are the friendliest and most polite men ever. They go out of their way and service is always before you expect it. Awesome. Reception could be a little better as it was a bit disappointing and there was several mistakes made but besides for that the room was clean and made the stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for most CBD locations”
Reviews.Author: robmigrates
Reviews.Content: Bed was very comfortable. Stayed in a premier room on the 8th floor. Did not have much of a view but as a business traveler it wasn't top of my agenda. Sleep was spoiled by some building work going on during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not really a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: KayaBursa
Reviews.Content: First of all, hotel has a fantastic location, in the CBD, very close to circular quay, the shopping streets, cafes, bars and convinience stores. Service is very good, very helpful people. Lobby is average, it is very modenr, clean and new but doesnt reflect a 5 star ambiance. Rooms are very clean. modern and nice, but mediocre in furnishings in my opinions. When you walk into the room, you dont feel the 5 star atmposphere, the hotel could be a novotel or mercure with that room. Well obviously all the other 5 start hotels in the CBD area had higher rates so this really explains why but still paying 335 AUD a nite I would expect a nicer room. Beds are big nd confortable, tc channl sletion is quite small. I would overall recommend this hotel for its modernity, cleanlinss, serbice and location but if you wnt a real 5 star, this is definitely not it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zigstar
Reviews.Content: These days even with a 5star Hotel, getting good service can be difficult. I was pleasantly surprised. By the time I had gotten out of the taxi, and gone to look for my bag, the concierge had already grabbed it and it was on the bag trolley! All of our requests were met and the staff are exceptional. Really great location-so quiet yet close to everything. Will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Bruns
Reviews.Content: Not much to say, brilliant location near Sidney Habour. Nice big rooms, with very comfy beds. Had that 5 star feel, that it should have. Only two minor hickups was the fact that you had to pay for internet access and one to too service minded staff member, but nothing that spoiled the experience. One of the few hotels I have stayed at that I give a rating of five.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: oaptravellerseventy
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my sister-in-law to Melbourne, Brisbane and Sydney. This 5 star hotel is super. Beds, bedroom and facilities are excellent. so is the location

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: RJG222
Reviews.Content: This hotel might always give you the feeling that you are away on a business trip, but if you want to be treated like a millionaire, then this is the place to come. Luxury, exceptional service, and perfect location, all at affordable rates... I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..just don't think about it make it first choice where to stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: NeenWollongong
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location switched on staff and wonderful happy service..plaza lounge wow and the room brilliant definitely the wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “why is this hotel only rated 22nd!!”
Reviews.Author: LeedsAnon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 8 days at the start of January in a block of 5 and 3 days. The location is very good, its 5 mins from Circular Quay and the Botanical Gardens and 10mins from Darling Harbour and The QVB shopping area. Its a very calm location compared to many of the other hotels, the roads around it aren't hectic so the rooms are quiet, particulalry at weekends. We had a great rate in a spa suite. The room was large and comfortable particulalry the bed whch is one of the best I have slept in. We also had free wifi in the room. There was also free internet and printing on 3 PCs in the business centre. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Anything we needed was dealt with almost immediately. We ate once in the bar which was good but always had breakfast at the fantastic cafe over the road on the corner (although they cafes are not open at weekends you can be at Circular Quay cafes including the Opera House cafe in 5mins walk). It has a small gym and pool which were fine particularly as you can run in the gardens just minutes away or swim in the open air 50m pool on the other side of the gardens 10mins walk away. What's great about this place is the balance of price, location and service. If you want harbour view and/or very bling room then that will cost you a lot more in another hotel when the reality is you are hardly in your room. We checked out some of the higher rated competition and just can't see why they are there comapred to this place. If you are wanting a very good base while travelling around Sydney then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, good for business”
Reviews.Author: markies21
Reviews.Content: I was here for a whole month in January 2010. Rooms are quiet, and the staff are real friendly. I don't know what the other guests are complaining about with the rooms being noisy. I had rooms 609, 401 (I think), 616 and 617 and they were all fine! But my favourite room of all those were probably 401 (again, not sure I got the room number right) - it's a very unusual layed out room at the end of the hall, but it's *massive*. The gym was great - very new equipment and if you're staying here for a while, you have to try the Chinese food place about 50 meters up on Hunter Street (right next to 7-11, it opens untli 7pm) - they do an awesome Curry Laksa and Chicken Rice. Oh, the beds are comfy too.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service, 5 star location, 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: To sum up this hotel in 1 sentence, "great location (but in a quiet street), great service, cosy room, free internet (which doesn't happen often in Sydney hotels), great facilities". If I want to be very picky, the only thing lacking is harbour view. My partner and I booked this hotel on last minute secret hotel which is great value for a 5 star hotel in the middle of CBD. Less than 5 min walk to Circular Quay, less than 5 min walk to Pitt Street Mall and one of my favourite Japanese restaruants is just around the corner. It's situated in a quiet street, away from the busy traffic and night clubs. The building is a heritage listed building (I love heritage buildings) but the hotel itself is very modern. Staff was very efficient and friendly. Initially we were given a room where hot shower is not working. We were upgraded immediately to another room. The room is nice, big, cosy and comfortable. All you expected in a 5 star hotel room. Great gym and functional swimming pool, spa and steam room. Radisson Plaza is on my list of one of my favourite in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “5 star without the lavishness”
Reviews.Author: orangestreet
Reviews.Content: This is a delayed review. We stayed there for 4 nights over the busy Christmas period. Check-in was not glitch free. The access card software had broken down and we were informed by a slightly snooty receptionist that we will be checked-in and we could collect our cards later. Apart from her, we found the rest of the staff unbelievably helpful and courteous. They were always up for a smile and full marks for their attentiveness and professionalism. The location cannot be faulted too. It is in a quiet part of the CBD but still close to the hustle and bustle of George Street and a short and pleasant walk to Circular Quay. Make sure you use the free CBD shuttle (#555) to explore the City. The hotel itself is in a fantastically reclaimed charming old building. The lobby looks tired and the vicinity around the lift area looks downright rundown. But things get better as you move up floors (ask for a higher floor) and enter the hallways. Everything is tastefully decorated and the room itself is excellent. Going with the theme of the hotel, everything is subdued and mild but tasteful. As you would expect from a 5 star hotel, everything works smoothly and housekeeping makes sure you have prompt service anytime you need it. Need extra towels - it will be in your room in 5 minutes, need a turn down service, no sweat at all. The indoor pool is adequate (for a CBD hotel) and the spa and sauna is fine. The shower in the bathroom is to die for and a reasonably deep bathtub adds to the comforts you would come to expect in a 5 star hotel. There is free fuss-free wireless internet in your room too. We had our laptop with us and this made making dinner reservations and getting directions easy. I would gladly stay at this hotel again. But if you are looking for the most luxurious five star hotel with sheer opulence at every turn, stay elsewhere. However, if you need great value for your money and pay just a bit more for 5 stars but not break the bank in trying to do so, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 5-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreshSugar
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Complimentary wireless internet in rooms * 24-hour Business Center * Great location, close to convenience stores, restaurants, the Rocks and Circular Quay all walking distance. * One of the lowest room rates I could find for a 5-star hotel in Sydney during peak holiday season. All the other hotels located within downtown were a lot pricer. Plus, some of the hotels charged 10 AUD per hour for internet in their rooms. Cons: * Do not stay anything at a lower priced than a Premier Room. We had so many issues with this one, I cannot imagine what it would be like staying at their regular rooms. * When we arrived at the hotel, the Bellhop was no where to be seen. There were stairs leading up to the lobby so we had to carry our heavy luggages up to the reservation desk. When the Bellhop finally appeared there was only a casual apology and he walked away. * when we arrived at our room, the pillows (the ones in black "satin") were oily and looked like they needed to be changed! * the shower door was broken. it wouldn't close properly so we had water coming out of the shower stall. * the bathroom door knob was broken. It broke off the first night we were there. * the cabinet door below the TV broke off it's hinge from old age the first week were were there. * when we requested an extra australian power adapter in our room, they asked us 3 times why we needed an extra one.... When obviously we had 2 laptops and needed to charge our cameras and camcorders. * service was inconsistant: sometimes they would forget to give us two bath robes! sometimes there would be one and some days there would be two. One day they will give us bottled water and the next couple of days they wouldn't. * there was a stain in our bath tub since we checked in... they didn't clean it until a couple of days later. it wasn't a very obvious stain, but it proved to us that they didn't clean the bath tub every day. * We found couple of pieces of broken glass in the hallway which they didn't clean up until the next afternoon. I cannot imagine kids in flip flops running in the hallways with pieces laying around like that. * One of the computers in the business center was broken for 3 days. Despite having a person at the business center service desk come in occasionally, the computer wasn't fixed until I had to notify the hotel. Overall: This hotel is great for families or with friends staying for only few nights. But definitely not a romantic getaway or a peaceful oasis for couples. There are many other hotels in sydney with better value and less issues!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault It”
Reviews.Author: HugoPDurham_UK
Reviews.Content: Excellent - very comfortable rooms, great facilities, and very central to Sydney. Easy walk to Circular Quay, the Rocks and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: fosterscott
Reviews.Content: If you've ever been to Sydney when the town is full, you know how difficult it can be to find a hotel room. We arrived in Sydney last week during just such a time. The Radisson's manager went out of his way to accomodate us, and even gave us a great rate on a suite. We were especially impressed with how well the hotel staff dealt with a full house. The suite was spacious, bright and clean. The bathroom was exceptional, with a large and deep tub. Internet access was free in our suite. Had the chance to visit the lobby bar. BIG tv at one end, comfortable seating, friendly staff. Nice fitness center. Fully equipped, clean. Spa services available. Location is nice, with entrances on both O'Connell and Pitt Streets. A few minutes walk from Circular Quay. Very nice property. Thanks for the excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but tons of glitches”
Reviews.Author: tjhToronto
Reviews.Content: The building and rooms and location are outstanding, well designed and spotless. However I ran into a huge number of gotchas with the staff. I asked them to remove the pillowtop from the bed, because it would send me to the chiropractor; they did, but a couple days later I found myself hobbling around and realized that they'd put it back on. The first morning my alarm clock went off just after 6am. I turned on the TV to find out I had a minibar tab, which was impossible given that I'd checked in at 6:30pm. When I told the front desk about this, the overworked woman got a bit annoyed. Then the minor annoyances. The TV takes 3 to 4 seconds to change channels -- no kidding, I timed it. The wireless internet didn't work (lots of routers, none of them could maintain a connection to my new blackberry, which has never had a problem elsewhere). Pretty much nothing worked without a hitch, and that's not what I expect of a Radisson. The facilities are great, I just don't have the same regard for the competence of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly ordinary but well positioned”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedUnderpaid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Plaza for 4 nights on business. Check in was quick and efficient and staff pleasant. I had a room on the 10th floor which was very nice and quiet. Nothing amazing style-wise, ordinary but very functional. The bed was very comfortable and big, and actually thinking about it the furnishings were very tasteful (modern neutrals with chocolate brown) and the pillow menu was a very welcome touch. I actually slept very well here, which I often don't in hotels. Bathroom was not huge but had possibly the best water pressure I have ever experienced. I had a tub and a separate walk-in shower and it was just lovely. Great for hair washing too! Ladies, the plug sockets are situated conveniently by the mirrors by the way. I used the gym just once and found it to be fairly well equipped. I would say though that is far from an appealing space. The pool is right next door and looked fine. Probably accounts for the humidity in the gym area. I did not try any of the restaurants or room service. I went running round the botanical gardens one evening and when I ran back into the hotel, obviously looking very hot (not in a good way!) one of the bellboys ran over and presented me with an ice cold bottle of water. I thought that was a really nice touch. Maybe he thought he was saving my life! Hotel is very well positioned and just minutes walk from the financial district, shopping, harbour etc. It doesn't enjoy the great views of some of the other hotels by the water of course. All in all a pleasant stay but nothing overwhelming. But no real criticisms either

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birmingham_UkBun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights whilst visiting Sydney for the first time on holiday. The hotel is centrally located in the CBD and was easy to get to from the airport using the train which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Staff were welcoming and helpful, the hotel is clearly a popular choice for the business traveller. Rooms were spacious and clean. There is a good business centre and leisure facilities were excellent. We stayed on a room only basis which was fine due to the abundance of eating options in the area. The bar had some good offers for drinks and bar food which varied on a daily basis. The hotel was well located for all of the main tourist attractions and a good central position to base my first visit to Sydney from. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jess_flying
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice about this hotel is the smiles on all the staff's faces. Everyone seems to be genuinely happy to be working there!! This did not change though our entire stay. The room (we were on the floor with access to the Plaza Club) was fantastic. There was a large glass panel above the gorgeous deep bath so you could look through into the room and out the window if you wanted to, or close the shutters if you didn't. The pool and spa were great and open long hours so you could enjoy a spa after dinner which was great. Just a quick walk and you were at Circular Quay, the location was excellent. One of the best things though was the breakfast - we had ours in the Plaza Club although I believe it is similar in the restaurant. Everything you could want and more including the most delicious selection of breads ever! Loved it, was a fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: Danzelldc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I always stay at the Radisson in Sydney. * room interior is beautiful, including the bathrooms * location of the hotel is ideal. Close to shopping and very close to Circular Quay * staff are all so friendly and sincere * room service is tasty While staying at the Radisson we recommend having pre dinner drinks at the Orbit Lounge Bar at Summit Restaurant, which is literally across the road from the hotel and provides fantastic views of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the worlds best hotel shower!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideArchitect
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a Deluxe Room on the 11th Floor with breakfast included. It was a great location (5mins walk to Circular Quay, Pitt St and Darling Harbour) and covered everything we wanted as a base for our holiday (visiting relatives). One of the highlights was the shower - brilliant. One of the low lights was the alarm going off at 5:15am on the first morning - perhaps Housekeeping could ensure that the alarm was switched off between guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2009
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Radisson Plaza Hotel Sydney and had a fantastic time. We arrived late afternoon and as soon as we pulled up out the front our car was taken and parked and our bags delivered to our room. Check in was nice and quick and in no time we were relaxing in our room. Within an hour of checking into our room we received a knock at the door and it was a bottle of champagne from the general manager, when I made the booking I had mentioned we were in town to watch the musical Wicked and were celebrating my partner's 40th birthday and was advised the champagne was a small gift - very kind! The room was very spacious and boasted a huge bathroom including a bath. The king size bed was devine and I had a wonderful nights sleep. We didn't dine in the restaurant or order room service but the room service menu was huge. There was so many selections that if we had chosen to order in we wouldn't have know what to choose. I will definitely stay at the Radisson again and would highly recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: fflyer_50
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the very best for staff service and hospitality, quality food and drinks. The Health Club was great - Terrific Massage. Ideally located 5 minute walk from Circular Quay. Catch the train from the airport. Easy walk to City Centre and Darling Harbour as wel as The Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doves4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the raddisson with 2 young children and we were treated like royalty by very single staff member. They are so friendly and approachable. The hotel is in a fantastic location , within walking distance to everywhere, the oprah house, harbour bridge, shops, etc. We have a 4 yr old and a 6yr old and they loved walking around Sydney. Thanks again for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN SYDNEY!!”
Reviews.Author: escapingbrisbane
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying here. The service is fantastic, the rooms are amazing. All the staff are so happy and friendly. The location is fantastic, located within a short stroll from everything great in Sydney. I am only going to stay here when I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with high standards of service.”
Reviews.Author: JayBees
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and found it to be excellent in every respect. It is very well located about a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay and within walking distance of Darling Harbour. The room was comfortable and well furnished and the servicing of the room was immaculate. The included full breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of cold and hot dishes. Complimentary internet access was also a great boon. However, it was probably the friendliness and standard of service that made most impact upon us. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and never once did we encounter anyone who displayed a less than friendly attitude. The Radisson gives the impression of a happy and genuinely caring hotel. Our only criticism would be that the available drawer space in our room was barely adequate. When we are next in Sydney we will definitely stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “great room, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: val_destination
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and I loved it. I would stay here again if I have the opportunity to return to Sydney. The room was beautiful and very stylish. The strongest point of this hotel is its location - it is central with most attractions within walking distance. Room service is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: perthmarlin
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor and set up of these rooms. A comfortable night's rest away from home. Only complaint relates to the breakfast service - understaffed and slow.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't fault the place”
Reviews.Author: ridgeback74
Reviews.Content: i've stayed here on two separate occasions and both times were not to be faulted. Rooms were lovely staff very pleasant and breakfast smashing. Great location and well worth the money. Hotel is very modern dÃ©cor and spotlessly clean. we were upgraded on second visit to very high floor with lovely French doors onto balcony, no great view bit nice to have fresh air after having spent weeks in air conditioned rooms while visiting OZ for 5wks. highly recommend hotel and would def go back, partner thought it was best hotel he's stayed in. beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Mia K
Reviews.Content: I booked our room via the hotels online booking service & was allocated a room on the 1st floor. In my opinion, this room was not up to a 5star standard. It was the smallest 5* room I have ever stayed in. The outdated & somewhat worn furniture was crammed in, with the TV cabinet protruding out to cover part of the bathroom entrance (dangerous IMO). The TV was very old, the bed OK, but certainly not luxurious. As we checked in late & had a dinner reservation at the award winning Bilson's (located in the same building & the reason for booking this hotel), I did not request a change of room, which I would have under normal circumstances. From what I could see looking into other rooms on the 1st floor when they were being cleaned the next day, rooms on one side of the building were much smaller than those on the other. Staff were lovely, breakfast OK, but not outstanding. Next time I dine at Bilsons I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel first class service”
Reviews.Author: PeterJS
Reviews.Content: Tradisson my partner and i had a very relaxing time and the service was extremely good. Not to mention Radisson is one of the few hotels that includes internet within the room both wireless and wired, I cant fault this hotel and will definately be going back. Being from melbourne i can say the service ran rings around any place ive stayed at in melbourne so thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay- great breakfast. Concierge a little disorganised.”
Reviews.Author: Dougeli
Reviews.Content: We booked this room at the last minute and arrived only 45 mins later, I was very pleased to find everything was ready when arrived and we were even upgraded to a suite. The very large suite was fantastic with modern fittings, comfy bed and a great bathroom. After a great start to our stay, I was a little dissapointed with the service from here on. It took almost 1.5 hours to have our luggage delivered, after a couple of phone calls to reception it finally turned up after being sent to the wrong room, there was also the issue of some smashed glass in our bathroom, housekeeping were supposedly notified by the concierge but didn't show up to clean it- we just had to step around it for the entire stay. The concierge seemed a little disorganised. Besides a couple of minor setbacks, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Radisson, we especially enjoyed the buffet breakfast where the food was fresh with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VicBCTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was amazing. We stayed on the Executive Floor, which included a daily buffet breakfast and evening drinks and canapes. All was delicious, and it was lovely to dine in the peace and quiet of the Executive Lounge. The staff throughout the hotel were helpful and efficient, and the room was quiet, if on the small side. The central location puts you a 5 minute walk from the harbour and opera house. If you can, stay here, and you will be treated like a valued customer.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary hotel at the price”
Reviews.Author: karzrao
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, the hotel is very average. I would not recommend this to any traveller. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieJ81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Radisson Plaza for 5 nights while on holiday in Sydney for his birthday a few years back. The room was very nice, however very small. The bathroom was spectacular! Great location as well. Very easy to get around from there. My only issue was with a rude staff member (I think his name was Walter), which was sad as everyone else was really nice. The concierge staff were fantastic! I would go back... I think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: concentrate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Sydney from New York and stayed 3 nights on the Plaza Club level (10th floor). Everyone was very helpful! The attendant in the Plaza Club for breakfast (Long) was very nice and always remembered our drink choices (latte with skim). There was no cream cheese and he made an effort to find some. The concierges were very knowledgeable and helpful. I called to have something pressed and housekeeping was at our room within 5 minutes. It was also prefectly pressed! Same when my wife called to have the room made up. The housekeeper was quick to come to the room and was discreet as she worked - my wife was working on her laptop in the room at the time. The beds are also very comfortable and the shower pressure in the shower is divine! I know guests are encouraged to take quick showers but the lovely showers are so relaxing it is difficult not to take longer showers. Also, the central location of the hotel can't be beat - walking distance to Darling Harbour, Harbour Bridge, restaurants/shopping. I have to say I was expecting to be comfortable but was genuinely surprised by the excellence of the service in the hotel. I plan be in Sydney again for business and look forward to staying at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TriniAussie
Reviews.Content: The wife and I visited Sydney over the Queen's Birthday weekend for two nights. We booked the hotel via lastminute.com (am I allowed to quote the website?) as a "mystery deal". So we did not actually know which hotel it was, beyond the fact that it cost about $160AU per night, and was 'located in the heart of the CBD, walking distance to Circular Quay'. We were pleased to find out that it was the Radisson, after payment. It cost us (with no traffic) about $30AU for a taxi from the airport. We were greeted by a doorman who cheerfully assisted us with our bags, without a hint of reproachment for a tip. (Besides, I had just used the last of my cash for lunch and the cab.) We got there about 11am, but we had to leave our luggage with the concierge, since the room would not have been ready for another hour. When we returned, our bags were already in the room. The room itself, like the lobby, was squeky clean and looked fairly new. The room was relatively large as well, so no complaints from me about the size. The bed was a queen size, and there were all the trimmings you would expect from a Radisson hotel: climate control, tv, minibar, desk, internet access, telephone, alarm clock, iron/board, safe, free tea/coffee, kettle, hair dryer etc. The bathroom was well appointed with both a shower and a bathtub (separate). The toiletries were ok as well. As we only stayed there two nights, our room was only cleaned once, but we had no complaints about the level of cleanliness on our return in the evening. We did not eat at the restaurant, or use room service, so we cannot comment on that. We did visit the fitness centre though, which was well equipped with a few treadmills and exercise machines, as well as a shallow exercise swimming pool with about 4 lanes, plus a spa on the side. My only complaint about this hotel, is the location. Now, the hotel is located in the CBD, but you are surrounded by tall office buildings that are shut on weekends and at night, so there is a fairly lonely feel to the location. There were no restaurants (to the best of my knowledge) within a 10 minute walking radius. Having said that, Circular Quay is just about 10 minutes walk away, where you can find a host of restaurants, the bridge, the Opera House, the ferries etc. After visiting Darling Harbour, we think that we would prefer to stay at a hotel in this area on our next visit, since it is far more lively. If you are a business traveller, with meetings in the CBD the following morning, then this hotel is for you. If you are a tourist, who does not mind a fair walk in a potentially lonely street at night for food, but only 10 mins walk from Circular Quay, then this hotel is also for you. Overall, 5 stars for interior and exterior, but only 4 stars for location (due to the touristy nature of my trip).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: le_corb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights for work. The staff were just lovely and the place is immaculate. Being a refurbished heritage building, Radisson have done a great job creating a lovely retro atmosphere with tasteful furniture and decor, even the staff looked the part! The concierge was a cool dude, in fact, I was surprised at how friendly the staff were, without being fake or overly-servile. Housekeeping were top notch, the rooms were cleaned beautifully. My only minor gripe was the room - I had an "atrium" room which had no balcony and a view into what looked more like a service duct rather than an atrium. It would have been nice to have known that at the time of booking. The room furnishings were really good though and you could hear a pin drop it was that quiet. The food there was lovely, would definately recommend breakfast and dinner, not expensive, and really good food. This is really the perfect hotel for a business traveller, and of course it's location in the heart of the CBD makes that even more so..

Reviews.Title: “A great choice - free guest wifi a refreshing bonus”
Reviews.Author: Bondi_Rimski
Reviews.Content: Shifted from the Quay Grand to the Radisson due to Friday night price offer ($500 at QG compared to $199 at the R.) All up a great one night stay. Reception staff very professional. Concierge always attentive at greeting guests coming and going. Room was pleasant if clearly a shift down from the QG, but view of shabby building across O'Connell st was nothing to write home about. I think at $199 per night with restaurant breakfast (good choices) for 2 and free wi-fi included we are starting to get seriously good value. Highly recommended and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “five star luxury and service”
Reviews.Author: bookmarks42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. We were upgraded to a spa suite room, which was massive. We had a big king size bed which was heaven to sleep on. Also we had the choice of what type of pillow we prefer whether it be feather, latex, U shaped etc, and the hotel is willing to supply it. They were very quick with check in and our bags where brought up to the room almost straight away. We had a small balcony that we could smoke on and also had a nice view of the city buildings plus of the harbour bridge. The staff were incredible, its almost as if they could read our minds. Extremely helpful with directions and places to see and go and very quick to help us with anything. Breakfast was ordinary, which was a shame. Location is a very short walk from circular quey which is where the harbour bridge and the opera house are located. You can also catch ferrys from here to various locations. We had booked a massage with the health spa, but i found the staff there slighty rude and unaccomidating. Valet parking was steep at $38 per night, but was told this is the average for sydney. I wouldn't recommend driving in sydney unless you had plans to actually go out of the city. My only gripe was our newspaper never showed up. Otherwise, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had expected a bit more from a Radisson - noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ronald100
Reviews.Content: Spent 16 (!) nights here on a business trip. Concierge service very friendly. Front desk in general friendly and helpful, however at check out the girl seemed 'annoyed' when I did not understand her (bad) explanation of the Radisson reward program. Pity because it left a bad impression of the Radisson on my final day in Sydney. Breakfast buffet is average and pricey at AUD 35, with extra charges for a cappuchino. Loved the roomservice Bolognese, a treat at only AUD 7.00. Housekeeping staff all very friendly and efficient especially the lady from Indonesia. Cable TV offer is limited, not many interesting channels to watch. The only thing I was really not realy happy about in this hotel was my badly insulated room. 4 out of the 16 nights I was woken up by people talking or snoring (!) in the room next to me, and at the weekend I had a young couple with a crying baby next door which kept me awake from 5 til 7 am. I complained and front desk promised to block the room next door for the rest of my stay, but sadly this did not happen. I think you should not promise these things if its not going to happen. During the weekend the hotel fills up with discount weekend trippers, which is fine, but I do think they should take into account that long stay business travelers want to sleep. I wonder if the 'executive' rooms on the higher floors would have been more quiet. I will never know because next time I think I will try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way. Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Nicolafb
Reviews.Content: I was only here for 2 nights unfortunately as I could easily have stayed at least a week! What a lovely hotel in every way. Great service from start to finish, fantastic room and brilliant location. What more could you ask for? The location is very central and so whilst you don't get a view of the Harbour once you leave the hotel 5 minutes later you are at Circular Quay. I updated to a suite which was nice but I think a standard room would have been perfectly fine. There was nothing to fault in the room Huge comfortable bed, great bathroom, fantastic shower and plenty of space. I didn't eat in the restaurant or go in the bar but they both looked really cool. The reception is a great place to hangout when you are waiting to meet up for the day's activities. Nothing was too much trouble at this hotel and it was a thoroughly pleasant experience to finish off our trip before flying home to GB.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Bliss”
Reviews.Author: KTJ058
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Radisson Plaza for the first time and wished we could have stayed longer. From the moment we pulled up in our car to the moment the left, we could not fault this hotel. Staff were experienced, professional and friendly and went out of their way to help and make you feel welcome. Check in and check out was hassle free, the room was immaculate and the bathroom superb even having bathroom scales so that you could weigh yourself (For those of us who are health and weight obsessed that was a wonderful touch!) The gym was very well equipped and the lap pool was delightful with a beautiful view especially if you are doing backstroke!.....I was the only person using both facitilies each time. We had the buffet breakfast both mornings and the selection was wonderful and if there was something you wanted that wasn't on show, they would get it for you! We dined in Bistro Fax both nights and contrary to other reviews found the prices very reasonable for Sydney. We both had 2 courses and drinks each night and the bill came in at under $100 each time. We often visit Sydney and stay at 5 star hotels in the CBD, selectively trying a different hotel each time we stay, but found the Radisson to be amongst the best, mainly for its more intimate and boutique feel. We booked the Radisson package and at $215 for the room and buffet breakfast , this was excellent value for money. We will definately choose the Radisson again!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel close to Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_G03
Reviews.Content: It was our 3rd visit to Sydney and we had booked the Radisson after a horrible experience at the Cremorne Point Manor in North Sydney....thankfully we moved in to the Radisson and instantly felt at home. We caught a ferry into Circular Quay and the hotel is just a short walk up into the city, perfect if you are planning on catching ferries our to the zoo, Manly or Darling Harbour or is you just want to enjoy the lovely restaurants and bars around the quay or the city centre. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and our room despite being the standard room was spacious and had a lovely big kind sized bed and large bathroom. If I went back I would however ask for a room with a nicer view than office buildings! I would highly recommend booking a massage while you're there, definitely the best I've had. A very nice hotel. Oh and the wireless broadband was complimentary which were thought was a nice touch....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central & peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: raybird
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, very comfortable and quiet. A carpeted room with two very large beds and good quality linen. Choice of pillows. Irritating music in the public areas, complimentary wifi efficient in our room on 4th floor (supposedly only working in lobby). Good breakfast choice, but coffee somewhat tasteless. The hotel is very central and only about 10 minutes on foot from circular quai and in the other direction to Pitt Street shopping and the central plaza. Highly recommended with agreeable and helpful staff. There is apparently an excellent, if pricey, top quality restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby staff”
Reviews.Author: emmandnath
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel 5 minute walk to the bridge. Room was ok. Staff were really snobbish and made you feel a bit awkward.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location.”
Reviews.Author: ncyprus1
Reviews.Content: A little puzzled by some good reviews of the club lounge. Firstly, it's not a lounge, it's a room with 6-7 tables squeezed in very close together, even whispering people across the room could hear you. The little room upstairs with a few tables and mini-tub chairs in, is dismal. Considering the average breakfast spread and the early closing of the whole area, staff attitude apart (as they were very good) these are the worst club facilities we have ever come across. The room was small, but comfortable, small, but nice bathroom - excellent powerful shower - but very small towels (only 3 between us, called for more, then got 6, which we needed as they never seemed to dry properly). Staff were hit and miss, reception greeting and check-out wasn't all that brilliant, concierge and 'bell-boys' very good. It was in a great location, but there are others in the same area, that if we went back we would try. If you do go, save your money, club isn't worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: squamish
Reviews.Content: Believe the 5 star reviews. We just spent 2 perfect nights at the Radisson Plaza and would stay here again in a heartbeat. We were on the 10th floor (I requested a quiet room and ours was like being in a tomb; we never once heard street noise or our neighbors.) in a premier room with a king bed and soaking tub. Internet access was free and extremely fast. The hotel even offers you a choice of pillow types in case the standard down feather pillow does not suit you. (Many people overlook the importance of a good pillow for a good night's sleep.) The staff was extremely polite and helpful, from the check in desk to the porters. I only found fault with the concierge and it was minor indeed. We did not eat at the restaurant as the room service prices indicated it was rather expensive for what you got. Tip: right next door on O'Connell St is an espresso shop called More and it's a good place for coffee and a light breakfast. The Radisson is also an easy walk to the famous sights of Sydney including the opera house, the harbor bridge and the aquarium/king street wharf. The only thing missing as far as I can tell is a view, but it's a short walk to phenomenal ones. And with the current, favorable exchange rate, this hotel is very good value. Book online at the Radisson website.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the exec lounge option”
Reviews.Author: Teesside_tourer
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, with good facilities and only a few minutes walk from both Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Pay the extra for the Executive Lounge option. Service there is impeccable, the "complementary" breakfast good and the evening canapes and drinks first class. Very helpful Concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tcasLondon
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in the morning our rooms where not ready but the friendly staff provided us with a free breakfast while we waited which was not too long .The room was very spacious clean , nice trendy design with a beautiful bathroom , not much of a view just lots of offices but not a problem , very comforatable bed, flat screen tv and good selection of channels, interrnet was also very good and reasonably priced. I used the bar in the evening , once again friendly staff the location is excellent although the hotel is in the finacial district it is a short walk from the opera house/ sydney harbour and there are plenty of bars/clubs nearby. I have stayed at this hotel before and its always a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Well located high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights and found the hotel to be of an excellent standard. The staff were friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge and bar staff. The concierge were able to suggest a pick-up and drop-off laundry service that was extremely efficient and unbelievably good value compared to the hotel's own service. We ate in the bar and found the food to be good quality and the service of a very high standard. The hotel is well located for exploring Sydney, only a short walk to the harbour. The immediate streets outside the hotel are very quiet in the evening and at weekends since they are in the business district. Our room was very clean and of a good size with an excellent bathroom. The decor was very modern and up to a high standard. The hotel pool was very quiet during our stay - there is a good size pool, jacuzzi and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever - 5 Star!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Bear_and_Penguin
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Radisson Plaza Sydney back in Jul 04, but have only had a chance to review it now. This hotel was amazing. The decor is rich and makes you feel like you have really gone out for a weekend away. Felt very sexy, expensive and rich. We arrived with a deluxe room booked but was advised that a pipe had bust and they had to change our room. We were a little worried about this but shouldn't have been. We were upgraded to a Plaza Club Room with complimentary access to the Radisson Plaza Club Lounge and a view of Sydney Habour. We weren't disapointed. We had breakfast daily and canapes at night. The room was spacious, the decor was fresh, clean and cutting edge. The Bistro Fax restaurant within the hotel is a must for those romantic dinners, we had a beautiful 3 course dinner there. The staff we great and always there to help. The health club is great both gym and pool facilities are great and very clean. The pool temperature is superb even in winter. The location is fantastic with a 5 - 10 min walk to Sydney Sky Tower, The Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Plenty of taxi cabs as its in the heart of Sydney's financial district. We have to stay that we have recently stayed at the Hilton Sydney and this would have to be the better choice for 5 Star Hotels in Sydney. We will stay at Radisson Plaza Sydney again for sure. Tip: Make sure you order a picnic hamper to be delivered to your room with some wine. You can have a great picnic out or in your room for something more romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room and location”
Reviews.Author: tonginic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located downtown Sydney. Staff is really friendly and the hotelroom (premier room) is the biggest I have ever had in such a hotel. Huge beds and big bathroom. Food is too expensive - not worth having breakfast at the hotel, there is a superb cafe across the street. After 2 weeks in a caravan this was absolutely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - look no further !!”
Reviews.Author: Alyia
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Radisson Plaza exceeded all expectations. Great service, the Atrium room was of high standard and not small at all (as other reviews would suggest), excellent bathroom facilities and the buffet breakfast was very nice with great variety. The location of this hotel was spectacular...less than a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay and Wynyard train station was less than 5 minutes. The staff was friendly and always polite and even though we arrived hours earlier than our scheduled check in, we were able to access our room immediately. Do yourself a favour - stay here!!! great price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and small room”
Reviews.Author: VT2369
Reviews.Content: The premium room is very small, we had a hard to fit our 3 big suitecases into the room. We booked this hotel because it was recommended by this site. I think it was overrated. I would not recommend it. For similar price, Westin Sydney is in a much better location with better service. I will stay in Westin Sydney if I ever go back to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “All Too Easy, Great Hotel, Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: bellajanelondon
Reviews.Content: I'm based in the UK for most of the year and I've had friends stay at the Radisson in the UK and have to say that this hotel lived up to the hype. Great service, good location, surrounded by all the major sites, helpful staff with directions and umbrellas when it rains! Slept and ate well, no complaints, would come back. All too easy really. A great stay sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_285
Reviews.Content: Couldnt fault this hotel. From the moment we arrived staff were extremely helpful. Local knowledge was second to none. Professionalism, appearance and attitude of all staff was excellent. Public areas and Bedrooms were exceptionally clean and well maintained. Spa and Gym was excellent with brill facilities. Have already recommended this hotel to friends travelling to Sydney this month and will continue to do so. Well Done to this hotel, they've got it spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Another great radisson”
Reviews.Author: JsyAli
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a lot of radisson hotels and have never had any problems and this is why we choose to spend 3 nights at the radisson plaza. From the moment we arrived the staff were attentive, friendly and helpful, we couldn't fault any of them. The porter took our bags to the room, the room was upgraded to a plaza room as we were on honeymoon and we found a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine with a card congratulating us on our wedding - a really nice touch. The rooms were spotless, cleaned twice a day, the bed was turned down while we were out in the evening and the bed was so comfortable (this is what we love most about the radisson hotels!). The concierge were knowledgable and answered all of our questions, they even gave us directions out of sydney and advice about where we might want to go when our hire car arrived. We didn't eat at the hotel but the bar and restaurant looked good. Location was fab, a 5 minute walk from circular quay, 2 mins from the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Service With Smiles”
Reviews.Author: HuttonBoston
Reviews.Content: I'm currently on vacation and enjoying a good time in Australia. I'm familiar with the Raddisson hotels from America but this one in Sydney is really great, a higher class than I expected. The bellhops were great in making me feel welcomed when I arrived. Not being familiar with Sydney the Concierge team have been fantastic with ideas of what to see and do. The hotel doesn't seem to be far from anything, I've been able to walk all over the city. If the weather clears up today I'll get around a bit more. Lots of things close by. I've eaten in the hotel which was great but there are conveniences close by to grab a snack from and banks too. The staff have all seemed friendly and generally interested in me. A classy hotel and definately worth the stay. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, very comfortable hotel - super beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: rachiemoo
Reviews.Content: Central location, near to the Circular Keys, Darling Harbour and Shopping!! Lovely rooms, really really comfy, beds are fab would like to bring one home!!!! Breakfast in the main restaurant is nice but Plaza Club breakfast is just well, rather average. Meals are nice too, but rather pricey compaired to the excellent food on offer around and about! Staying here at Christmas but have to say its a very sterile seasonal environment, lacking in genuine cheer!!! That said the staff are very helpful and some of the smiles appear to be genuine!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: M90_AMT
Reviews.Content: Great location, can walk to opera house or bridge or shopping district. reception quick and charming. Concierge really helpful with directions,maps and bookings. We booked a room on the executive floor with access to the special lounge. The breakfast was good but what was special was the lack of people - there was only us and another couple, so it was quiet, peaceful and enjoyable to relax over breakfast reading the complimentary papers. The waiting staff couldn't have been more helpful. THere were also canapes and free drinks at night - 6 good wines to choose from including sparkling wine/champagne style, some bottled beer/lager, 5 spirits and soft drinks all laid out in buffet style so you can help yourself whenever you want a top up. Again there was only us and another couple so it was lovely to unwind in the evening over a drink and snack. The room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean, bathrobes, nice toiletries, good towels, free internet access included in the executive room rate which we used all the time, very comfy bed and choice of pillows, well stocked mini bar. We didnt' eat here except for breakfast. All in all a very comfortable stay in a well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the 5 Star Rating”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my birthday, I was upgraded to a premiere suite. The hotel: Located not particularly in the heart of the CBD but approximately 10 minutes walk away. The hotel itself is a historical building. It is a good hotel if you plan to visit circular quay because this is 10 minutes walk away. The pool area was pretty average for a 5 star hotel. The rooms: The rooms are small and not very spacious. The bathroom was facing the bed which was annoying. The door of the bathroom was glass so you could imagine when the lights were turned on it would wake up others up. The bathroom however was nice with a marble finish. The beds were not entirely comfortable. The air con failed to work which made the room really hot. There was no views. I am surprised that this hotel has a 5 Star Rating. I would give it a 4 if I rated it. There is many other better hotels then this one

Reviews.Title: “RUDE receptionist!!!”
Reviews.Author: YIWAN
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I can only write a VERY scathing review of this hotel! My experiences with the Radisson Plaza in Sydney began a few days before I arrived. I called them to check which room I had been booked into and, after reading a review on this site, requested that the two single beds in the room NOT be pushed close together as I was sharing with an elderly Aunt and wanted a bit of space so we could sleep without breathing into each otherâ€™s faces.... I also explained that I would be arriving at 10am after travelling from interstate since 4am, and NEEDED to rest and change before I was due at a function at 3pm. The person on the phone said they would request an early book-in time and indicated that a room WOULD be ready for me when I arrived. I got there a bit after 10am on Thursday 4th December. The RUDEST staff member possible was at the reception counter!! My room had been booked and paid for by the organisation that had invited me to Sydney. The man at the counter confirmed my booking, and then requested a credit card from me. I told him I didnâ€™t have one. He then told me to pay him $100 â€œin case I used the mini barâ€�. I told him that I didnâ€™t have $100 and re-explained that the room had been paid for by the organisation and if there were any problems maybe he should talk to THEM! I also asked for the mini bar to be taken from my room as I had no intention of using it. The man then said that I had to wait until 2pm for a room to be available for me. I told him I was very tired and needed a cup of tea and a rest before having a shower, getting changed and attending the function at 3pm. He said I could use the shower at their â€˜Health Cubâ€™. I asked if there was a bed there I could rest on for a few hours... The answer was â€˜noâ€™. He then turned away and ignored me.... I then told him I NEEDED to rest (NO offer of a cup of tea was forthcoming...) and would do so by sleeping on a sofa in the foyer until a room was available. Within half an hour of me stretching out on one of the lounges, a LOVELY, kind and helpful young staff member, Ravi Singh, approached me and said a room was available and I that would be upgraded to a Premier Room. She took me to this room, which had two double beds in it (placed about 30cm apart). Returning to the room with my Aunt later that night after the function, and wanting to make ourselves another cup of tea, we realised that there was no milk left, as there had been only 3 or 4 single portions of milk provided. After trying to call room service about four times they finally answered the phone and promptly brought 4 more single portions.... Strangely, there were only enough products for ONE guest in the bathroom, so we had to share the shower cap and shampoo... and there was only one armchair to sit on... There WAS an extra sugar packet, I discovered it imbedded in thick dust under the TV... Itâ€™s probably STILL there! The next morning we went to check out at 9.30am. The â€˜express check outâ€™ counter was unattended and the same man was at reception. He ignored me when I asked him if I could check out until, worried that I would miss my flight back home if I didnâ€™t leave soon, I INSISTED on him taking my keys... He was SO RUDE that I approached another staff member in the foyer and asked him to identify the receptionist, whom he named as â€˜Abdhallahâ€�. I told this other staff member that I was going to write a review of the hotel, he looked shocked, then asked me what I was going to say in it.... I was SO disappointed to have this hotel stay almost ruined by the unpleasant Abdhallah. If there were more staff members like Ravi Singh employed to assist guests, it would almost be worth its five star rating....

Reviews.Title: “5 Star All Way - I'll Be Back For Another Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jadore1
Reviews.Content: I very recently stayed here and it was nothing short of my 5 star thoughts, I have been lucky enought to travel throughout the world and yes, sometimes what you think you're gonna get and what you do get can be very different but I was not sold short here. The staff were very friendly and always helpful with our questions. The room was a good size and the bathroom too with both a bath and shower to choose from! It has a nice modern feel to it. We were plesantly surprised with our breakfast, it was served in the room as part of what we booked and we thought it would just be a piece of cold toast, no way, we didn't need lunch till late. Found it all really easy and peaceful. My partner and I will both be back. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “5 star price, 1 star service , seriously”
Reviews.Author: travelnotmuch
Reviews.Content: Booked the romantic getaway package, it all sounded good BUT *booked smoking room, given non smoking room, back to reception... the staff reaction was not good, they were not happy with us.... *champagne and strawberries on arrival ??? took 2 hours, and 4 phone calls..... * given a card for someone- Ravi Singh to assist us in any way, however she was not at work and was at home!!! doesn't work weekends,, nice lady no help to us..!!! * in room breakfast, arrived on time.. but no sugar, milk, empty salt and pepper, and a filthy trolley. Coffee good, but coffee pot needed a clean... yuk... also only 1 chair..this was weird. The good stuff- awesome bed. bath and room was ok. the end

Reviews.Title: “Ticks All the Boxes”
Reviews.Author: Blankko
Reviews.Content: A busy but very comfortable hotel in an excellent location. The standard room was tastefully decorated and furnished and included a swish marble clad bathroom with both bath and shower. Sizewise, I never felt cramped even though the room wasn't huge. The bed was comfy with good quality linen. Plenty of attractive places for breakfast nearby if you don't want to eat in. Sydney itself is great. I highly recommend the Manly ferry trip and the open top bus tours.

Reviews.Title: “Get an inside room if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: oysterenthusiast
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Radisson on Saturday and Sunday night. The room faced onto Pitt Street - it was a Premier room, the next step up from Atrium. When we arrived it seemed quiet and we didn't hear street noise. However, that night a nearby club was blasting music outside. It was so loud and so late at night that I believe in most US cities you'd have to get a permit. I finally called reception at 12:45am and was told it would stop at 1am. When it was still blaring at 1:15am, I called again to request to be moved to another room. The said they didn't have any other rooms, and that they had called the club and were told it was a special function that would go until 2am. They offered me no alternatives. At this point I wish I had called the police, because it's very doubtful to me that this volume of noise outside would be legal. However, I just suffered through until it finally stopped. This is probably a lesson for any urban hotel - get an inside room. I wish we had saved some money and gotten an Atrium room so that we could sleep. Otherwise the room was gorgeous, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom spectacular. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: CK1Adelaide
Reviews.Content: The standard hotel room is very spacious,no views to speak of but I was out all day.Huge bathroom with separate shower/bath.I liked the fact that it actually has a TV as some hotels have that Teletext TV which drives me nuts.Service was extremely efficient not friendly but prompt.I would take good service over bad facility/service with friendly staff.That was about the only letdown. There was a underground walkway to the train station.10 minute walk to the Opera House and the same to Pitt St Mall.Can't ask much more from a hotel. I had a few grumbles about the wrongly billed minibar,noisy plumbing which I expressed in the post stay survey.I had a prompt reply from the GM and a refund. After all the reviews I have read on all the Sydney hotels especially the 5 star ones; one can't ask more than big rooms,good service,central location and good prices.What else do you need? There are heaps of things to do outside the hotel and this place had a pillow menu as well.The gym looks adequate and pool was good.There is the GPO Wood Fire Pizza 5 minutes walk away.The nearest eatery Malay Chinese Takeaway had the best laksa I have tasted in Australia-really.Max Brenner's chocolate bar is 7 minutes walk away for your late night nightcap.You get my drift...

Reviews.Title: “The hype is justified 4 sure”
Reviews.Author: CamilleJeanPierre
Reviews.Content: This really is a special place. The hype is justified and all the previous good reviews are bang on. From reception to leaving my bags on exit the service was impeccable and nothing was too much for the staff on hand. I opted for a premier standard room (the second most basic on their list) and it was very impressive. Large, well appointed, high ceilings, luxurious bathroom. The place was more like an executive room you get in other hotels. Thereâ€™s a large hallway entrance, a massive king size bed with options to choose different pillow fabrics (decadent city, man!), an iPod radio/alarm docking station, advanced climate control, thick sumptuous bathrobes, a well stocked and reasonably priced minibar, a large desk and sofa chair. The bathroom is well lit with a large bath and separate shower cubicle. Enough said â€“ you ainâ€™t gonna do any better for your buck in such a central location because itâ€™s also perfectly positioned in the CBD. Whilst I didnâ€™t use the restaurant or bar they looked equally impressive and relaxing. I will come back to this place without a doubt. Prices do seem to vary greatly not only throughout the year but throughout the week. I got a great deal for my Sunday night stay but if it had been a Thursday night I would have paid double. A great place to stay for a few nights after youâ€™ve touched down before heading to cheaper digs. Unless youâ€™ve got loads of dosh to stay here for a week or two in which case I hate you. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: SixContinents
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business with a free room upgrade (booked on hotel web site) and used hotel fitness center and laundry service. Pros: Convenient location in Sydney CBD, lots of restaurant choices nearby (no need to use hotel restaurant if you don't want to) and a five minute walk to Circular Quay. - Rooms recently renovated with comfortable beds, internet service worked reliably - Efficient front desk check in / check out Cons: Fitness center has reasonable amount of cardio equipment and weight machines for a hotel, but a lot of the machines and equipment are old. A better option may be to head over to Circular Quay for a run. (There's an interesting run along the elevated Cahill Walk and across the Harbour Bridge--to get there take the elevator located just outside the Circular Quay train station.) - Likely similar at other area hotels, but the laundry service is expensive (A$15.95 tax included for one shirt). Overall was quite impressed with hotel. It left the impression that it is well managed and the staff care about the job they are doing. Would choose to stay there again on another trip to Sydney for business or tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value, good location”
Reviews.Author: krazygloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights in October. We booked a one bedroom suite with tub. The room layout was fantastic, air conditioning system worked really well, desk setup was nice and the TV was a good size. The closet space was good with drawers for clothing, it was nice to unpack and store the suitcases off the side. There was a separate seating area and a safe beside the bed. The bathroom was a very good size; my only complaint would be that it did not have a tempature regulated mixer in the shower, so if someone flushed the toilet you tended to get scalded. The bed was reasonably comfortable and they do offer a pillow menu as well. Housekeeping was top points; the room appeared clean and replenished every day. The gym was average; the equipment could use a little updating, but all functional and tidy. We had mixed feelings about the massage, but this hotel is not known for this service, next time I would give it a pass. The lounge on the main floor was comfortable and the staff extremely friendly, accommodating and attentive. As this is a business oriented hotel, it defiantly catered to those who needed the amenities. The business centre was also functional and easy to access. My only complaint here is that the internet, which is accessed through a 3rd party was sloppy, the cable that came with our room didnâ€™t work, so we had to get another one, and I guess I was under the impression that the rooms would be wireless. Other than that, the Valet was prompt and friendly, location was reasonably good, try the Japanese restaurant on the other side of the street, as well as the cafe on the corner. Its a few blocks off the main shopping district, making it a bit farther than other hotels, but great at night as the nightlife isnâ€™t outside your window. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel as there are many choices within the area of the hotel which are well priced. In addition, the room service achieved their target time, and the food was decent. Over all, a well priced hotel for the business traveller or tourist that can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokexpat
Reviews.Content: I am a leisure traveler, who now lives in Bangkok. I stayed at the Radisson for 12 nights at the end of September 2008. Location. Perhaps the best feature of the Radisson is it's location in the CBD. I was able to take a train from the airport to the Wynyard station, which is only a block away from the hotel. Because I was able to walk to almost all the places I wanted to visit in Sydney, I used public transportation very little. Some examples: Circular Quay (10-15 minutes' walk), Sydney Opera House (15-20 minutes), Pitt Street Mall (5-7 minutes). In the immediate vicinity of the hotel, were all the services I needed, such as two 24 hour convenience stores, book store, food courts, and ATM machines. Some comments I read suggested that the area was dead after office hours and on weekends, but I did not find that to be the case. There were always others on the street and I always felt totally safe, even with many late night walks back to the hotel from the Sydney Opera House. Neighborhood restaurants and entertainment venues were open nightly. Room. I had an inside room on the 10th floor. It was large and had every imaginable convenience and amenity. I particularly liked the iPod docking station with speakers. The room itself was furnished in the "contemporary" or "minimalist" style favored by international chains. I would prefer something more elaborate, but the room was so convenient and comfortable, that I can't complaint. The bathroom was gorgeous. The Staff. The staff couldn't do enough for me. They were friendly and went beyond just answering a question or providing a service. I consider the friendliness and competency of the staff a prime attribute of this fine hotel. Plaza Club. Because I was going to stay for 12 nights, I decided to spend the extra money and upgrade to the Plaza Club, or whatever they call it. Breakfast in the Plaza Club, which was located on my floor, while not grotesquely elaborate like some five star hotels, was plentiful, varied and delicious. The cocktail hour at night was replete with wonderful food. I had free access to the PCs in the business center (I don't travel with a laptop) 24 hours a day. The upgrade was well worth the cost and I highly recommend it. I loved Sydney and am planning to return next year. I wouldn't stay in any hotel other than the Radisson. As they kids say: "They have their act together."

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience in every way”
Reviews.Author: travelette08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for our anniversary. We had a really lovely stay. Even though we purchased the cheapest package, when we arrived they upgraded us to a room with a spa. My boyfriend asked them to organise some flowers, which they did and they were absolutely beautiful and waiting in the room when we arrived. The buffet breakfast was great, and the staff at reception were so helpful the whole time. Out room was lovely, huge, and freshly decorated. I'm so sick of big hotel chains that are shabby and still expensive. We couldn't have been happier with the Radisson Plaza Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: opinion81
Reviews.Content: Very good experience while booking my stay followed by excellent check-in staff and bellhops! Room was perfect and as one of our days in Sydney was rainy we spent quite some time in our room and also in the public spaces where we received excellent service with great food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: middge
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel in Australia when we arrived in Sydney from Paris (my wife, myself and our 3 children). Very well located in the town centre and walking distance from everything. Clean rooms, helpful staff, good facilities - a perfect place to start a trip to Australia

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rbmb
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good for business. 10 minute walk to Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson Plaza! Believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this week during a quick trip to Sydney to celebrate our anniversary and see a show at the State Theatre. We thought about staying at the Swissotel which is across the road from the theatre, however decided on the Radisson after reading the reviews. So glad we did. All the staff knew it was our annivserary after I made a passing comment on the website booking form (I booked direct with the hotel) and treated us so well. We stayed in an executive floor room - which had access to the executive club. Fantastic. The canapes in the early evening are nearly enough for a meal and the drinks on offer are far more than we expected. We were given free cocktails (thank you Jasmine) for our anniversary and treated like rock stars. Everything was fabulous. Breakfast the next morning in the club was also a full buffet spread and more selection than anyone could ask for.
