We didn't bring our young daughter, however wouldn't hesitate next time as other families were there with their little ones and the kids were treated just as well as the grownups. All the staff are super friendly and there is no five star snobbish behaviour. The hotel was about a ten minute walk to the QVB and Pitt St - very well suited if you had business in the banking end of town but not too far from Circular Quay and other tourist spots. Couldn't recommend the hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely - bathroom was great - large separate bath, walk in shower. The hotel's buffet breakfast is a shocker. Coffee is awful and staff aren't generous with refills. The cafe over the road on the corner was the best place for an easy meal. The beds are extremely hard - but I suspect that suits the Asian market who seem to like their beds to be firm? Pool is an indoor lap pool on the 1st floor. On the whole, I'd probably not stay there again as there are other places to try next time. It wasn't good enough to want to use it regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: traveling*chococat
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Sydney and based on reviews on Trip Advisor, the Radisson Plaza was an easy choice. Very nice front reception desk, upgraded us to a corner room, very nice views of the CBD. Beds were extremely comfortable, bathrooms were nicely appointed and classic. No noise from surrounding rooms - a plus! The CBD was very hip and happening during the week, on the weekend, a little quieter but a nice change of pace. Very easy walk to Wynyard station - great public transportation on the train system! The Rocks and Circular Quay are also less than 5 minutes away. Amazing. We loved the Radisson so much we booked to return for our final weekend in Sydney there as well. Highly recommended. Only one drawback, the concierge was a bit snooty. One final addition, their Bistro Fax was a nice place to have a relaxed dinner. Good Mod Oz cuisine and nice waitstaff.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Dath
Reviews.Content: Having read good trip adviser reviews I booked an Atrium room package on the hotel's own website. Disappointed with room, old fashioned TV with poor reception in a dark wooden noisy cabinet, all other hotels of this rating I've stayed at in Sydney at least had a plasma or LCD. View of an alleyway, not what I expected. Nice bathroom, comfy beds. Breakfast room downstairs seemed like you were eating in a cellar. Good location though, easy walk to Rocks and shopping. Would I stay again, probably not, I'd pick a hotel at The Rocks - with a decent view!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Alanxx
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in a Plaza club room and enjoyed every minute.The room was more than adequate with a good bathroom. What really made the stay was the Plaza Club.We upgraded on arrival and were very well looked after.I don't eat meat and one night it was mostly meat canapes so the person in charge of the Club telephoned the chef and had some food especially sent up to the Club for me.Excellent service.We would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “A treat”
Reviews.Author: Packhorse
Reviews.Content: We had a good room with a glimpse of the Bridge. Well thought out room. Impeccable service. Excellent food from Bar or Restaurant. Brilliant value. Only one criticism: the so-called Business Centre a disgrace - expensive compared with Dubai or Bangkok, internet cut off without warning, ludicrously short opening hours.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MegaPearls
Reviews.Content: We got a great price when booking the Radisson in Sydney, we booked on lastminute.com.au and stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights upon arrival in Australia. The hotel is located within walking distance to the main shopping areas. A walk to Darling Harbour takes about 15 minutes. We got a fabulous room with a huge bathroom (walk in shower and big bath). We had room service in the middle of the night (jetlag...) and the service and food was great. The internet only cost 18 Aussie dollars for 24 hours which isn't bad when you compare it to other hotels in Sydney. For breakfast we walked a few minutes to the nearby restaurants and cafes. In general, we had a great stay at this hotel. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Rethink the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: timeout34
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a rare, very much anticipated long weekend in Sydney with my sister, and am now looking forward to a good night's sleep! We booked the Radisson after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and were hoping for a bit of luxury to spoil ourselves. Instead, we got a very average room (okay, we booked on Wotif, but even so). We had booked two single beds, but basically got a king bed that had been split in two but both sides were still right next to each other (I mean literally, about half a centimetre gap) - not ideal at all. The beds were peculiarly made with thin mattresses on top of other enormous mattresses, with sheets that didn't tuck in properly and it all just kept sliding off and coming untucked. There were two odd bedside lamps hanging right down from the ceiling at head height, so every time we got out of bed or sat up we banged our heads. We didn't even get saucers to go with our cups. Our bath plug leaked, and our lamp wasn't working (to be fair, they did fix the lamp as soon as we told them about it). The swimming pool was average (the pictures do it a lot of favours), the steam room smelt horrible, and the spa was tiny and closed for maintenance. The whole hotel felt like a bolthole for airline staff and for corporate conferences. Good points: great location, beautiful building (on the outside only, at least in our experience), staff quite helpful. Bad points: completely unrestful. What a waste of a holiday! Sydney was fun though.

Reviews.Title: “The Radisson was brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Crazycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 8 nights in February. The hotel was fantastic. Great location right in the heart of the city, within walking distance to all the main sights. Concierge were very helpful with arranging trips and gave some good tips on restaurants to go to. Breakfast was a little overpriced and the food was not that great. We ate there once and after that went out for breakfast which was much more interesting - eating at pavement cafes in the sunshine. The room was average in terms of size, bathroom was great with separate shower and bath. Very comfy and it was always a great place to come back to after long days exploring Sydney. The small pool and gym were a bonus considering the great price we paid. We swam each evening and most of the time had the pool to ourselves. I also had a massage which was fantastic and pretty good value for money. Food in the restaurant in the evenings was good too, although we preferred to eat out in Sydney. Overall a fantastic stay at a great price. We would not hestiate to book again when we go back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Excellent Location - but breakfast prices are exhorbitant.”
Reviews.Author: RORSCAN
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Plaza in the heart of Sydney's CBD was a great place to stay on a weekend visit to Sydney. The location, just a short stroll from the Central Quai and a few blocks from the George Street Shops and the touristy Darling Harbour, was ideal for pedestrian travellers. It will be our first choice on a return visit to the city. Booking via the internet was efficient and easy. Our room while on the smaller side, was perfect for the two of us. It was excellently maintained, and extremely comfortable. All of the staff we met from doorman to concierge were extremely courteous and helpful, and we could only praise their professionalism and their service. It was much of the same calibre as boutique hotels in which we have stayed, and there is a very comfortable "small hotel" feel to the Radisson Plaza. Our only complaint was with the buffet breakfasts. The buffet trays were not always kept full, and the choices were somewhat mundane. At thirty plus Australian Dollars per person, we felt the prices exhorbitant and after one breakfast, we walked across the street to a cafe. There, waiting for our order to arrive, we sipped coffee and juice, enjoyed the passing parade and talked to each other. We did not have to wait in line for a short order cook who was trying to catch up on the bacon tray, stand in line for toast to be cooked, wait for the juice container to be refilled, and hope that there would be hot hashbrowns or pancakes ready when we finally got to that section of the buffet. . It actually took less time for our restuarant ordered breakfast to arrive, and it cost significantly less ($7.00 Au) per person. . A significant difference in price. We noticed in booking, that the prices for the rooms dropped as it got closer to our anticipated date of arrival. We paid quite a few dollars less than the rate that was initially posted for the room by waiting until shortly before our arrival date to reserve. If we excluded the "breakfast experience" from our review, we would have rated our stay as excellent, and we recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless and great value”
Reviews.Author: Dustys_Mum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply faultless for the price. I have travelled extensively and I found this property comparative to any in the world. We travelled to Sydney for my brother's wedding and had a number of rooms on a range of floors and all were of a high standard - the showers are incredible. We also had a range of needs in terms of room types that changed on very short notice and the staff were very accommodating even though the hotel was full. Further, my mother is disabled and the staff could not have been more helpful and understanding of her needs. I recommend making the most of the facilities - the steam room is lovely. The location is great and we even tried the bistro for dinner one night and the meal was great. That said we also used the cafes around the hotel as there are plenty of options. This hotel is great and we will be heading back as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrific!!”
Reviews.Author: tinat168
Reviews.Content: We had quite a different experience than the previous reviewer... it was absolutely amazing!! We arrived at the hotel at around 8:30am, hoping for a room, but of course since it was so early, we didn't expect anything. The manager on duty was extremely friendly and called housekeeping to service our soon-to-be room. We also upgraded to the Plaza Lounge (for $85/day, less if you're traveling alone). He sent us up to the lounge where we enjoyed hot and continental breakfast, coffee and tea. Around 10am, the manager came up to escort us to our room -- this is a little longer than what we had anticipated, but we can't really complain since official check-in time is 4pm. Room was very clean, modern, chic, comfortable and bigger than expected! I heard that some hotels in the CBD are small, which is true (our friend was staying at a large 4-star hotel nearby and his room was Manhattan-tiny!). The upgrade includes unlimited internet access, complimentary turndown, 2 pressings for clothes and all-you-can-eat-and-drink beverage and canapes hour -- red, white and sparkling wine, liquor and mixers, beer, soft drinks, sparking water, fresh oysters etc. Needless to say, with all this good food, we hit the gym, which was very well-equipped. Overall, excellent service and a stellar hotel! I would agree though that there is limited selection of food options immediately near the hotel, but after a 5-10 min walk you have a plethora of restaurants of all varieties. Note: many places are closed on Good Friday -- we ate Chinese dimsum for lunch and Chinese for dinner that day :) absolutely amazing

Reviews.Title: “10th stay and still great!”
Reviews.Author: CuteEmma
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's 10th stay at the Radisson - the reason we know this is because we had a welcome basket with Easter eggs and fruit when we arrived and a card from the Manager wishing him a lovely 10th stay! I have stayed with him on 5 of these occasions and this was the first stay with out 1 year old daughter! The service was excellent as usual and the bathrooms are the best you will ever see in a hotel - I have never ever stayed in a hotel with a better bathroom. The Concierges were awesome, I never had to ask for help with my pram someone would always come and assist me down the stairs. The cot they provided (at no extra charge) was excellent and my daughter slept very well (better then she does at home!) they also allowed us to stay in the room a bit later before we checked out so my daughter could have her morning nap before we went out for the day. I would never stay in another hotel in Sydney - it is so close to everything and they make you feel very special. The cafe across the road is also very nice!

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: suziem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson on a busy weekend in late February. Check in was quick and polite. The porters were there right away to help with the luggage and the concierge was extremely helpful in letting us know where best to dine with a five year old in tow. The hotel is clean and we stayed in one of the atrium rooms. I wouldn't say that the rooms were huge but they were clean and quiet. Our room had a big window that looked out to an inside light well. The bathroom was huge and had a deep soaker tub and a separate shower stall. We had a mini fridge in our room. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but it looked busy every night. There is a lap pool, sauna, and steam room for hotel guests and the night we used it, it was empty except for us. The best thing about the Radisson is that it is so close to Circular Quay, which is pretty much in tourist central. It is about 3 blocks to walk down to the Quay. It is within 10 minutes walking time to the Rocks. If you head the opposite direction, it is about a five to ten minute walk to the main shopping area of the city. If you want to catch the city rail (train), Wynard or Martin Place stations are the closest to the hotel. The hotel rates itself as a five star hotel but I would probably rate it a 4 and a half. All in all, it is a fantastic hotel if you want to be close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Crestwicke
Reviews.Content: As with other reviews, the location can't be beat, but after the businesses close down for the evening, there isn't much dining available without walking to the wharf. We did enjoy the dining room at the hotel, not the real expensive one, but just the one in the lobby. Nice fish selections. The bar scene is lively too, which is a plus when you are visiting a new country. The room had several little things in disrepair, but not enough to wait in line at the front desk to report them. Overall, it was a good value in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Pcollico
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights over a weekend here after making a decision to not stay in the Darling Harbour area where we have stayed many times previously. This hotel had great service, no check in or check out problems, very quiet and bright airy rooms and very pleasant and friendly, helpful and efficient staff. This is a superb location close to the city centre, minutes walk from Circular Key and The Rocks, and within easy distance of other areas if you desire. Having stayed in 10 international hotels in the last year this rates as being the equal with many others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: I used to commute between Melbourne and Sydney (Australia) for work and regularly stayed at the Radisson Plaza. I've stayed at this hotel at least 20 times in the last 3 years. The Radisson Plaza is a gorgeous, modern hotel in a historic building. The rooms are nicely decorated in neutral tones and are always very clean. The hotel has an excellent room service menu and 2 nice restaurants (Bilson and Bistro Fax). The thing I love most about this hotel is that it only ever takes me less than 5 mins to check-in and out. They have my details on the system and all I have to do is sign when I arrive - room keys are already ready. The only thing I don't like about this hotel is that I've found the concierge/bell boys lazy and unhelpful. On a few occasions, as I'm lugging my suitcase up the stairs on O'Connell side to get into the hotel, the concierge/bell boy have just stood there, staring and not offering any assistance. I have to say this is the only hotel I've stayed where they don't offer any assistance with your luggage (even 3 star hotels do this!). Having said that, the unhelpful concierge/bell boys have not deterred me from staying at this hotel because I do like every other aspect of it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel,new and well located just dont expect high end luxury we stopped here 3 days with my wife after a china business trip stay in sydney was perfect and hotel enviroment and location helped(met k.kwong at her restaurant,15 minutes taxi from hotel) loved the room and the bath ,window connected liked buffet breakfast included in room rate

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: DVal
Reviews.Content: This being our second trip to Sydney we decided to try a differant hotel. After reading some reveiws about this hotel on TA we were expecting high things. We were not dissapointed in the slightest. On arrival we were welcomed with a warm smile and friendly, yet respectfull greeting by the doorstaff, and help into the hotel with our luggage. The front desk staff were hugely polite and helpful offering me the best room in the hotel on finding out I had booked our stay here to coinside with my girlfriends birthday. And what a room. On the top floor, this corner room seemed to be in the converted loft area of the hotel and was simply huge. Decorated to a very high spec with all the mod cons you'd expect from a 5* hotel as well. The concierge was very knoledgable and was very happy to go out of his way to help us organise excursions, get us a table at restaurants that I knew were booked out months in advance after trying myself, and generally being very helpfull. The Club lounge is very nice with evening drinks and canapes being served nightly and a breakfast service second to none. The choices offered were anything you desired it seemd! Overall from our arrival to departure the hotel's staff couldn't have done more for us even with the hectic too'ings and frowing's of the Indian cricket team from the hotel and the swarves of press camped out on the doorstep. Ive stayed at some of the leading hotels in the world and i'm happy to rate the Radisson Plaza in my top 3.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: jetsettter
Reviews.Content: My first instance of a problem was when I arrived, to be told there was no reservation. After some shuffling, my reservation was found since it had originally been made as a pre-registered arrival (room held for an early morning check-in). The check-in clerk was quite apologetic and indeed efficient. Having found my room, he checked me in and off i went. As i opened the door to the room i immediately realised I had been checked into the wrong room. The original booking had been for a 1br king spa suite (shown on the web site and advertised with a guest toilet). I had changed the booking once removing the pre-registration request and had sent 2 emails requesting informatio neither of which have ever been acknowledged. On the day i was checking in (interstate local) I sent a fax to the hotel requesting a later check-out and a pillow request (since the hotel advertises a pillow menu). So i had done all I could to make my requests known. Back down to the check-in and again the staff member was most apologetic but the reservation (and I had all the details of the booking) at the hotel end was not correct. However after moving some people off their allocated upgrades (sorry bout that) I was given the 1 br spa king I had booked. No pillow request, no late check-out confirmation, no guest toilet. I know things can go wrong, I am in the industry, but with so much follow through from my end it just really surprised me that a hotel so highly reviewed by TA (and my choice was based on that) could get it so wrong. To the Hotels credit they did give me late check-out. Overall, this is a good hotel for tourists coming in from overseas on exchange rates that make you think it is cheap but for the average australian traveller it is over rated and over priced. Ive seen better decor in cheaper hotels and the room service pricing is just excessive (but no doubt thats Sydney). Thank goodness for the hotels location with everything you could want in walking distance and a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable friendly, very central hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: dalainz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay and were really pleased with the hotel. We booked on www.wotif.com and got a really good deal ( bearing in mind it was Australia Day weekend). The hotel is set in a quiet street about a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and pretty much all the central tourist sites. Its convenient for all the CBD Hire car offcies too - which are an easy walk away through the park.Our room and bathroom was modern and comfortable and the only niggle was that the TV was pretty low rent but as we didnt really use it - not a problem.If you have kids to entertain in the early evening you might want to check up on this when you book. Broadband is available in the room for $24 per 24 hours and wifi at the same price is available in the lobby. Breakfast was more than adequate and service was really quick. The gym and indoor pool were good too but a tad small - but note the pool is really for adults wanting to exercise rather than a place to take the kids to unwind after a big day sight seeing. We would definitely consider it again when we next visit Sydney. All in all a really friendly hotel

Reviews.Title: “Spot-On!”
Reviews.Author: jemipie
Reviews.Content: The unexpected highlight of our honeymoon hotels! Great location, charming staff and amazing service. Very clean and well designed rooms. We loved the urban chic decor and comfy bed. Great lap pool and delicious room service too. Check in and out were smooth and easy and concierge were delightful. If you're wondering where to stay in Sydney, your search ends here. Whether you want to head to the harbour or the shops, this is the perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Rad”
Reviews.Author: megablst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our way through to New Zealand. I've been before and as with my previous stay everything was exceptional from the furnishings of the room to the customer service. Location is perfect for seeing sydney being 5 mins from circular key and 5 mins in the opposite direction to the center of Sydney's shopping. The bed was particularly of note - the best we slept in whilst away (we both agreed on this).The only thing you won't get here is any form of view from the window, other than that this is great place to stay and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good without being exceptional”
Reviews.Author: daccas
Reviews.Content: Had we not been staying here over new year I would probably have left with a more positive feeling. Because of the time we stayed we obviously had to pay a premium. This left me feeling that we hadn't really gotten value for money. We had a room with a queen bed which was too small and given we paid over Â£200 per night I thought that was poor. The service was OK but not to the standard I was expecting. We had a car and were please to hear they had a valet service. HOWEVER, what they failed to tell us was that it cost $37 per day! We stayed at the Shangi-La 2 years earlier for a similar price. I'd definitely choose that over the Radisson next time.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTLY SITUATED”
Reviews.Author: DLODRATSAB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Plaza for 7 nights over New Year with my wife and two teenage daugters .This stylish hotel is in a perfect location being only five minutes walk from circular quay and the main shopping areas .Check-in was fast and efficient and the rooms were very well presented and maintained to a very high standard throughout our stay .All the staff were very freindly and helpful and one staff member deserves particular mention , Lee the young barman was very efficient and engaging and is a real credit to this hotel .I will certainly stay at this very nice hotel on my next stay in this wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “In the CBT but central for everything”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Gums_Addict
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Syd on honeymoon (late twenties). Stayed in club room, liked free canapes and 'champagne' every night (Australian sparkling wine fair enough, still nice). Nice hotel, has everything you need, quite small though. Swimming pool is nice but not very wide, only fits a couple of swimmers swimming lengths. Not a tall building so no great views (ours was interesting though into an office bldg over the road - one man did not go home the entire time we were there honestly!) Staff was pleasant, rooms clean and everything you'd expect from a 4* reputable Radisson hotel. Would recommend it. Location was great, and convenience of easy walking access to everything (e.g. Rocks, Darling Harbour, CBD, Parks, Oxford St etc) was worth not having a view of the harbour for. Straight over the road to Wyndham underground line for further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely...”
Reviews.Author: LottieCardiff
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay here whilst in Sydney. It was just perfect; spacious room, beautiful beds, quiet air con, luxurious bathrooms with lovely toileteries. Breakfast served in the bedroom was definitely a highlight - a full table with hot plate timely delivered with strawberry ricotta pancakes to die for. Recommend the chocolate dipped strawberries too!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: KylieBrisbaneLocal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for work training, very central location you can walk to everything. Hotel room booked was the standard but I think it was above averge, very very clean, felt brand new, not many hotels rooms look exactly like the photos on the website like this one did. Check in and out was super fast, less than 5 min, bed was brilliant, excellent shower and bath, view was of the street below but ok. Very quiet, you cant hear anything at night. Was only there for one night so didnt get a change to check out pool but Im sure that was great as well. Very good quality for pretty low price ($250).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: Firstly you do not stay at this hotel for the views - I had an inner courtyard view, and even if you have an outside room, you wil have a view of a busy street. But the location is great - 5 minutes walk to Circular Quay, the Botantic Gardens, Hyde Park, Wynyard and the Pitt Street Mall. You can't go wrong. Room was not out of this world but was comfortable, clean and very functional. Bathroom was nice - powerful good showers, deep baths and nice toiletries in the room too. Service good - for some reason I'd been booked into a smoking room but moving me to a non-smoker was no problem at all. Staff were courteous whenever I encountered them, and maid service in the room was good. Didn't bother with the restaurants - usual hotel prices for drinks and breakfast. I wandered over to the Capri Cafe in the Menzies Arcade by Wynyard Station every morning for a freshly cooked fry up every morning for A$10!! Hotel is strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fantokyo
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent if you are on business and your office is nearby (such as in my case) and it is reasonable convenient to the Opera House, the rocks and shopping in central sydney. Staff are overall very friendly, always greet you when you arrive by taxi, open the doors when walking into the lobby etc. Rooms are good but not very spacious. No views. Dry Cleaning is poor. I had a pair of cotton pants washed and the laundry/pressing was so poor that I had to redo it. Shirts were not done particulary well either. A good value hotel, but not particulary memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: davo2005
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Radisson in 6 months and once again we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We only stayed one night and wished we could have stayed longer. The room we stayed in was a premier room and by hotel standards is huge. Not only did the room have one of the largest and most comfortable beds ive experienced, it also has a comfy armchair, a large writing desk +chair and plenty of storage space. The rooms as well as the hotel's facilities are contemporary and are of a very high quality. Unfortunately we did not dine at either of the hotel's highly rated restaurants but we did order room service for all of our meals and were very satisfied. The food was great and the service very efficient. Hotel staff were pleasant and very helpful in all dealings with them. This truly is a great hotel and has become our favourite in Sydney. We like to experience a number of hotels in the cities we visit yet next time we visit i think its going to be the Radisson once again!

Reviews.Title: “ambience and modern newness”
Reviews.Author: SharonK88
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The restaurant bistro fax was just perfect. Our room was on the 12th floor and had a balcony, just lovely. We travel allot and I loved this hotel, small boutique style, great personal service and great food. Fabulous for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best hotel to date”
Reviews.Author: Mazzy_7
Reviews.Content: We were at the Radisson Plaza for 3 nights in 2005 and it is still the best hotel we have stayed in before or since. The room was beautiful, very tastefully decorated and although not on the roomy side there was space for two comfortable easy chairs. The bed was very comfortable, actually the pillow was so wonderful that I went out and bought the same one as soon as we got home. The bathroom was clean and luxurious - we especially loved the tv view from the spa. Staff were unfailingly polite, courteous and helpful. All this and a beautiful, heritage building too...

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, lost points on service”
Reviews.Author: kalsop
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed out stay; the hotel was of good quality, the rooms were nice and quite spacious, and the facilities were well-maintained. However 2 services error left a bad impression. Firstly, we bought a package with late checkout of 4pm. On the day of checkout, we came back to our room before the late checkout time, and had been locked out. We had to explain our case at reception and there was no apology. As we prepared our things to leave, we could hear the hotel cleaning staff standing right outside our room door, talking loudly and waiting to get in and clean the room. The second we walked out of the room, they all walked straight in - the door didn't even close behind us! Secondly, we were charged on the bill for a meal we never ordered/ate. I disputed it, and after 5 minutes, the woman at reception agreed to take it off the bill. A week later I found that this sum had been charged separately to my credit card. When I rang up to query it, I was eventually told it would be refunded, but no apology. I would expect better from such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in CBD”
Reviews.Author: struck
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Plaza Hotel was a great hotel. Less than 200 m from the Wynyard train station and less than a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay. Many restaurants are located near the hotel. You could not beat the location! Check-in was very easy. My room was not ready when I arrived at 7 AM, but they stored my luggage and let me take a shower in the health club (a nice thing after the overnight flight from Los Angeles). Rooms were quiet and comfortable. There wasn't much of a view from the room, but you didn't hear any road noise below. I stayed on the club level and the full breakfast was good. The business centre was not staffed, but I was able to use the computers whenever I needed. There is a small fee to use the Internet, but it is much cheaper than the Internet access in the rooms if you aren't using your personal computer for long periods of time. The concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions. Bilson's restaurant is located within the hotel and is one of only seven Sydney restaurants to be given the "three hat" award by the Sydney Herald. It was expensive but well worth the experience. The staff were wonderful and friendly. The only complaint I had was with the health club. Some of the exercise equipment was not properly maintained, and there was a wait for to use some of the new machines. No equipment was provided to clean up after workouts and there was only the large bottle of water available for hydration. The pool, spa and steamroom were all clean. I would certainly stay here again if I ever traveled back to the Sydney area.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: julieanne
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here, and would happily have stayed longer had our itinerary allowed. We had a deluxe room with small balcony, and for just that little extra I would definitely recommend the balcony rooms. You have a view of The Bridge as well as a nice sun trap! The bed was divine, and the marble shower fantastic. What impressed us was, although it is a large hotel and obviously used to business travellers, they had time and courtesy for us 'holidayers'. The concierge couldn't have been more helpful. Note, the pool is not wide: it is indeed, a lap pool. But if there's only 2 of you in it, it's more than adequate. Has a lovely spa pool too. The buffet breakfasts were very good. I recommend this hotel if you want to be in the centre of the CBD and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: roselilycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Plaza for a second time in August 2007 as a special weekend treat. We were upgraded to a spa studio room which included access to the Plaza Executive Lounge which made it an even extra special treat. This hotel doesn't have the views of other hotels in the city but it certainly makes up for it in other ways. From the moment we checked in till the minute we checked out everything was special. The staff are extremely professional and well trained and friendly. The room we had was spotless, very big with lots of space to move around and the massive (again spotless) bathroom had a huge spa bath. My bed was so comfortable and I had the best sleep for a long time - I wanted to bring it home with me. Definately worth staying here - can't wait for my next visit to the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a central CBD location”
Reviews.Author: angnando
Reviews.Content: The historic building houses a very modern hotel that for its outstanding service, close proximity to Sydney's financial centre, and reasonable pricing would rank it amongst one of the more comfortable places in sydney for the well travelled business person. Vallet parking and good service right from when you enter the hotel makes settling in very easy. Whilst the standard room I stayed in perhaps could've been a little roomier, everything else was of a very high standard. Large and comfortable king size bed, very modern bathroom which somehow manages to fit in a separate bath and shower, and all the other standard amenities. No real views out of my window, unless you like looking at office buildings, but then you don't stay here for the view. The hotel has a restaurant (which I've heard is very good, but didnt get a chance to eat there), a decent lounge area, health club with sauna, spa, pool, and a business centre. Recommended if you need to stay in Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: japanaland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great staff! The location was ideal for business travelers and families. The Opera House was a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There was also a train station about 5 minutes away. The rooms were large and clean. The only downside was the fee for internet service. I paid $50 for just one day. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “top class”
Reviews.Author: RFraser
Reviews.Content: The reviews are true! This is definately a special experience, a top class hotel with an excellent location. We booked this (and all our other accomodation) on the strength of tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. Sydney itself is magical, with the Opera House, harbour cruise and Bridgewalk all being must do's - as are the Powerhouse and Maritime Museums (If you like that sort of thing). We were disappointed with the Tower restaurant this time, the dining experience being noticeably more cafe like than our last visit 5 years ago - but you get your moneys worth with the views! Bondi beach is about a 45 min bus ride and although smaller than you might think is well worth a look. Opal shops are numerous and can easily induce meltdown in the Visa card, but are all part of the experience. Try the Opera Cruise with Captain Cook tours around the harbour if you get the chance - unfortunately it wasn't running on the days we were there but we will get it next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tyrolean
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights during our trip along the east coast. The stay was fantastic: Staff was very friendly, rooms reasonably sized and according to five star standard. As this was a part of our honeymoon we flound complimentary sparkling wine in our room in the first evening! My wife and me would stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Standard 4* stuff”
Reviews.Author: mikey82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July at a budget rate with breakfast included. Nice quick check-in with friendly staff. Room is nice and big although I was a bit shocked to see that my king sized bed was just 2 singles stuck together!!! I'm not sure if this is the norm these days.. but i certainly expected a proper king! Clean room and Bathroom. Powerful shower. Comfortable stay.. nice and quiet. Breakfast was nice.. like the chef who cooks you up an omelette or poached/fried eggs every morning. Gets sickening after 4 mornings.. .but good enough. Can't believe they even have chinese porridge there!! On the whole... it's a standard no-nonsense hotel. Nothing extraordinary... but then nothing bad. Area is nicely located about 10 mins walk from the main circular quay terminal (transport hub to all major attractions) so no complaints there. Solid... just nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant helpful staff and excellant location”
Reviews.Author: kimbeg73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison for 7 nights in June with a young baby and were really pleased with the hotel's central location and the helpful and attentive staff, expecially the porters and doormen who helped us with the baby buggy. Our room was nice and large, as was the bathroom. However, the rooms did not seem entirely soundproof - which was a worry for us when junior started screaming! We had room service on about 4 occasions and this was pretty good - although there was some variances in quality. The breakfasts were really nice and a huge variety of food to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Position”
Reviews.Author: Oscar371
Reviews.Content: I was tempted to rate this hotel as excellent but a few areas are not that good. The outstanding area was the staff's attention and attitude. The room was modern & chic but could have been a little larger. The lobby is fine but not stunning. The food in the cafe restaurant was average and over-priced. The internet connection could be better but I found it adequate. The business centre became crowded at times but had most of my requirements. Having received a good direct room rate for 5 nights I feel this hotel is good value for its class and will stay there when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel if you are on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: mcopun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Ideally located in the heart of the CBD, hence you will be tempted to stay here if you are traveling on business. But beware, the basic facilities expected by a business traveler, internet and connectivity are in a complete mess. I stayed here for more than a week and throughout the stay, it was impossible to get a good internet connection in the room. The hotel management made constant promises to improve the service, but could never resolve the problem. Also, there is a bandwidth limit on the internet, therefore, if you are using internet phone for your overseas calls or watching some online video, be prepared to pay a hefty amount to the hotel. Ofcourse, you will be disconnected everytime you use up the bandwidth. So if you are traveling on business.....stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMumBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the special weekend rate including breakfast. We had a premier room on the 11th floor. The room was spacious and modern with a large, spotlessly clean marble and tiled bathroom. The shower was fantastic, very powerful and a large walk in cubicle. The bed was large and very comfortable with plenty of pillows and a selection of other pillows available. Rooms have tea and coffee making facilities. We had room service which was reasonably priced, prompt and delicious hot food. The breakfast in the bistro was sensational, an amazing array of hot and cold buffet food and a chef to cook omelettes etc to order. The valet car parking was $35 for the stay, and the car can be fetched and parked as often as required. The concierges were great, really helpful and knowledgeable. Staff on the front desk, room service and the breakfast chef were also very pleasant and helpful and a credit to the Radisson. The pool area is lovely and the pool a good size for laps though a little warm for training. Main shopping areas are a five minute walk (Pitt St Mall) and it is less than ten minutes walk the opposite direction to circular quay. I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on our first visit to Australia and it did not disappoint in any way. The staff and service were very good and the room was well equipped and very clean. The view was as good as you could expect from a city centre hotel and the location was very good for walking to the harbour bridge, Rocks and shopping arcades near Pitt Street. We had breakfast in our room on the first morning which was very good, but we didn't eat in the hotel after that as it is a bit expensive and there were plenty of eating places elsewhere. During the day there are food courts among the shopping centres with a huge selection of meals, which don't seem to get a mention in the guide books. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sdyball
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and were pleased with an efficient check-in with friendly staff. The hotel reception was immaculate as was the bathrooms. We stayed in the spa suite and the room did not disappoint. The bed was ENORMOUS and comfortable with quality sheets. The one problem we encountered was the spa jets not working which was a bit of a disappointment. The breakfast standard was a little lower than other 5 star hotels I've stayed at. Overall, it was a satisfying stay and what you would expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: iha
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty swish, probably what you would expect. Got a good w/e rate as place is in business district, so area is a bit dead but really well located to get to other areas easily and fast. Good service, very nicely styled and clean room which was a good size. Like most hotels of this calibre, the extras eg internet were an absolute rip off though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123cat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in here based on these reviews and we were not disappointed, the rooms are comfortable, clean, modern and have everything you need. We stayed for 7 nights and the hotel is perfectly placed for exploring The Rocks and Circular Quay (I recommend the BridgeClimb!) and the botanical gardens. I would definitely stay here again - great location, super helpful staff and a lovely stay. We didnt have breakfast included and there is a very nice cafe across the street open on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “A belated review”
Reviews.Author: TheThreeJays
Reviews.Content: Forgot to write this review at the time so may be out of date!! An excellent hotel and brilliant location near the quays. We stayed at Christmas and my only complaint is that there was no acknowledgment of this fact. The rooms are reasonably sized and very well appointed. The price was very good. I booked during the summer and though it was peak season I paid a very average price for the three nights. Book early for this time of the year- we wanted to stay over the new year but everywhere was booked out and we ended up in an awful hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Central, excellent rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Vesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Radisson Plaza Sydney for two nights on a stop over. Hotel is very centrally located, rooms are spacious and very well decorated, service is friendly and breakfast was good. Our only small complaint was that we asked for a view and got just a building wall.

Reviews.Title: “super staff, super rooms, super location”
Reviews.Author: Akid
Reviews.Content: We spent a great week in sydney. And we fortunately choose to stay at the radisson plaza. The check in service was less than great, however this was our only negative. After explaining it was our holiday of a lifetime, we asked if he could asign us a good room. To which his answer was yes, at a cost of $55 dollars a night for a upgrade!!!! Anyway the room we got was great. No real view but all the amenities we really good. The room was a good size, the bed was comfy. The bathroom was really nice, with a good size bath and a great shower. The hotel has a modern feel and so to are the rooms The hotel has a great location. 5 minute walk to circular quay, and other city attractions just a walk away i.e Darling harbour. Food in the hotel was nice , on the one occasion we tried it and it was reasonably priced. We tried the bistro fax, give it a go! Staff excellent. I must give high praise to Rod the Concierge. He was very well informed and very much a gentleman. He helped me organise a surprise for my girlfriend. Thanks again ROD Acouple of things i would like to recommend is a trip to -5 bar. This is basically an ice bar with all ice fixtures and fittings, great fun, just near the ferry terminals. Secondly have a splurge and go to Aria for a nice meal. It is is out of this world! Great food and views of the opera house and harbour bridge

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great service all round.”
Reviews.Author: andregre
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel - No spectacular views, but centrally located in CBD for all main sites, including circular quay. Staff were universally friendly, efficient and helpful. My room in the main wing was spacious, well appointed and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - stylish”
Reviews.Author: australian73
Reviews.Content: I have been staying regularly at the Radisson Plaza. It is beautifully located. You can walk to circular quay, the opera house and darling harbour. It is a busy hotel and has a bit of a travelling salesman feel to it, however the rooms are well furnished and the bathrooms are spacious complete with good sized bath. Service is what you expect without being notable. It has a small gym which really is only good for a bit of cardio. I have not eaten at the hotel because you can get to plenty of good places in the city. Overall aplace to come if your on business or for a short convenient stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rlarragy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the the Radisson Plaza in January 2007. I had lived in Sydney years ago and went back with my husband for our honeymoon. Needless to say, a good hotel was very important to me as I wanted him to love Australia as much as I had. Unlike our Perth Hotel, the Radisson did not disappoint. We got a very competitive rate on hotels.com and to be honest I couldn't believe the quality of the rooms for the amount we paid. The room was spacious, clean and the bed was the most comfortable in all the hotels we stayed in during our 3 week trip. I'm also a clean freak so I went straight in to check out the bathroom and was so pleased. It was immaculate with a bath, separate shower cublicle and plenty of space. As I knew Sydney well we didn't engage the concierges much, however, they were at all times making efforts to engage us (although not in an annoying way). Insisting on carrying our bags to our rooms (tip not expected) and one morning when we were waiting for a tourbus to arrive to take us to Blue Mountains, the concierge came outside, asked us which tour we were on and rang to see if they were on their way even though we didn't ask him too. The attitude was very much above and beyond. The room service was good and breakfast was excellent although the coffee shop on the corner diagonally opposite the O'Connell St entrance to the hotel is very good and very reasonable. The business centre is also very handy with access to pc's and printers. The location is within 5 mins of circular quay. Will never recommend anywhere else to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aquarianchick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson with my husband one saturday night. situated roughly halfway between Circular quay (where the opera house, harbour bridge, the rocks and all must-go touristy places) and Pitt Street shopping area (Myer, David Jones, small boutiques, QVB, Louis vuitton, etc - basically one of the best concentration of shopping in sydney). Its about 5-10 mins walk either way...depending on how fast you walk. Excellent business hotel, apparently quite busy with business people on weekdays. Not surprised as the hotel is surrounded by offices. We were in a standard king room. Room was well appointed with modern decor, excellent lighting, bed was very comfortable...not much of a view though as back to back buildings in the area - this is understable as this was a city hotel. Did not have much interaction with staff as opted to eat in the many excellent restaurants in Sydney. Bathroom was lovely and clean, looked like it was recently refurbished! Im normally very picky and fussy with hotel rooms and amenities but radisson passed with flying colours. Excellent indoor pool and spa, gym is good as well but crowded when we went up. Only gripe was check out the next day...line was too long and snaked around the lobby. didnt mind the wait though as we were in no hurry to go anywhere. maybe this was because it was a weekend...i can only imagine that the front desk is adequately staffed during weekdays as business people have appointments to go to and meetings to catch. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind the walk/commute...otherwise, stay at the Park Hyatt or shangri-la if you want to be in Circular quay and Hilton or Swissotel if you want to be in the heart of the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice plush hotel in the center of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: bc399
Reviews.Content: World-class hotel in the CBD of Sydney. Furnishings, shower, bath, etc was very up to par; had a comfortable stay and good sleeps. Staff was efficient and helpful. My only peeve would be that since the hotel is renovated from an older building, the windows might not offer the best views. For example, most rooms on Floor 8 have the bottom half of their windows blocked by an external ledge, leaving you staring up to see outside as if from a jail cell. Other than that, everything was plush and neat and I wouldn't mind staying there again (hopefully not on the same floor!).

Reviews.Title: “A gem !”
Reviews.Author: OzVoyager
Reviews.Content: A hotel that has it all worked out. Great location, helpful staff, clean very well presented rooms and good restaurants. Stayed at the Radisson Plaza twice in January 2007 for business trips. In particular, the staff on reception were very helpful with room and late check out requests.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: never_stop_exploring
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five nights during our one month vacation in Australia in Sept / Oct. The hotel is really a great place to discover all the fantastic sites of Sydney in short time - you are in walking distance of nearly everything - max 10 minutes walk to the opera and the Rocks and less still to the wharf. The rooms are very nice, of appropriate size and clean. The only thing I would complain about is the expensive breakfast, a little less in prize would have been enough as well. Service in the breakfast period is not five star as well. However, the concierge staff is more than friendly and helpful. They booked us a table at Doyle`s on the beach - take the ferry and have lunch there from the veranda and enjoy awesome seafood and a terrific view on Sydney! When going to the Blue Mountains for one day they were also very helpful to explain the way out of the city as Sydney is rather terrible to drive if you are not a local. Going to Sydney again we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Leyland-wanderer
Reviews.Content: After considerable research my wife and I chose to stay at the Radisson because of its location, close to the Rocks area, the Opera House and Bridge. If we had the choice again we would look for a hotel around Darling Harbour where there are more readily accessible restaurants and bars for the evening. Where the Raddisson is located closes down at weekends because it is in a business area. Having said that the hotel was really quite nice. The staff were very helpful and the lobby bar a very pleasant place to rest tired limbs after a day exploring. The rooms were of an average size but well maintained and very clean. There were no views from our room at all as it was an internal room and that made it a little dark - and hard to guess what the weather was like to choose appropriate clothing.

Reviews.Title: “Always Excellent”
Reviews.Author: The_Hills
Reviews.Content: I stay here about once a quarter, and have done so for the last couple of years (our office is just across the street). It never disappoints, the room are great with plenty of room and always in great condition. The bar is very relaxed but professional although I'm not keen on the restaurant where breakfast is served ... but most would be happy with it. I prefer the coffee shops across the road. All in all this is a world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: mg35
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weekend special rate. Very nice architecture building with modern interior quite a bit nicer than your run of the mill tourist hotel. Upon arrival the service was prompt and friendly, however there was s miscommunication between the front desk and housekeeping and I was given a room that had not been cleaned yet. I reported it back to the front desk and was immediately upgraded to a deluxe room. So that pretty much made it up for me since the room was a really nice one up on the top floor. I would agree with the other reviews that for the price it's about as good as you will get in Sydney. It's also reasonably quiet given the central location. All services were above average. It's in a great location for seeing the city although there's not much of a view from the rooms themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: hellwolf
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Highly recommended. From the friendly check-in staff to the spotless well maintained room with the spa bath to the wonderful buffet breakfast and lastly checking out, the entire experience is one I was very happy with and I know that this is one hotel I would be more than happy to come back to in future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mobert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent seven days at this hotel and found it near perfect. It's in a great location less than a 10 minute walk to the Rocks and Opera House. Although a little on the small side, the rooms and bathroom in particular are stylish and comfortable. Hotel concierge staff was wonderful in helping to book restaurant reservations and a tour to the Blue Mtns (don't miss this park - it's a must see on any visit to Sydney). At current exchange rates, we paid about US $225 per night which included the buffet breakfast (quite good). Would definitely return. Cheers mates!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: melstodola
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place to stay! We had a great time! We (Americans) had a bit of a time finding the place... mostly because we weren't used to driving on the left hand side of the road and lots of one-way streets downtown. It was humorous... we could see it... just couldn't figure out how to get to it! I think the Bellman sensed our frustration & offered to return our rental car for us (we were dreading trying to find the rental car place)! He was our saviour! The hotel is a great location! Everything is a very easy walk away. The concierge and the whole staff were just so nice & went out of their way to make sure we had an enjoyable time. The rooms were just great! I loved the spa tub & gorgeous bathroom. Everything was nice & clean. I would love to visit the hotel again. We did pay for the upgrade to the Plaza level (I think that's what they called it) and enjoyed the evening drinks. Definitely do that if it's in your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Circular Quay and Pitt Street Mall”
Reviews.Author: DIYTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and quite new. The room is nice and spacious. Noise from street noise is minimum even though it is heart of the business district (I stayed in the sixth floor). Breakfast buffer in the hotel restaurant is above average. There are plenty of cafes near by that you can sit outside weekdays do people watching. On the downside, the bed is harder than I expect for a upscale hotel. The lobby is small. It can be crowded when a lot of people are checking out at the same time in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Macros_The_Black
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel in an excellent location for the harbour - once you get your bearings! The service is good here and the breakfast was surprisingly good, even for a vegetarian. There is a doorman to hail taxis, etc, and the porters are quick to move your luggage for you. Of course, a fair bit of tipping is expected. The room was surprisingly large and the bathroom was gorgeous. If you wanted to you could open the shutters on the big window between the bathroom and bedroom and watch TV, or something! The shower and the toiletries were very good. We found the bed to be very comfy and there was a well-equipped desk in the corner. We thought that the price was reasonable for such a good hotel - we got it for about Â£92 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: saccuch
Reviews.Content: During our family trip to Australia, we stayed at 3 different hotels in Sydney (others were Hyde Park Inn and Marriott Sydney Harbor). This was our favorite. The staff were all friendly and the concierge was the best. Had room ready early as we were beat when we arrived. Try to book the buffet breakfast--it is not to be missed. Can't really explain the negative comments from a reviewer from a few weeks ago. We thought this place was top notch!

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Plaza Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 27 O'Connell St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
